original: @67b * // 'jam dpal mtshan brjod kyi bshad 'bum bzhugs /
analyzed: @67b * // 'jam dpal mtshan brjod kyi bshad 'bum bzhugs /
translated: The Hundred Thousand Explanations of the Names of Mañjuśrī

original: * // 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: * // 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Mañjuśrī, the youthful one.

original: 'phags pa zhes pa rje btsun 'jam dpal gyi mtshan brjod pa 'di ni snying po bsdus pa'i rgyud yin pas rgyud gzhan las 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa zhes pa rje btsun 'jam dpal gyi mtshan brjod pa 'di ni snying po bsdus pa'i rgyud yin pas rgyud gzhan las 'phags pa'o //
translated: This recitation of the names of the venerable Mañjuśrī is a tantra that condenses the essence, and is therefore superior to other tantras.

original: 'jam pa ni nyon mongs pa sra zhing rtsub pa'i zug rngu med pas so //
analyzed: 'jam pa ni nyon mongs pa sra zhing rtsub pa'i zug rngu med pas so //
translated: Gentle means free from the hard, rough, painful afflictions.

original: de las legs pa'i yon tan thams cad 'byung bas dpal lo //
analyzed: de las legs pa'i yon tan thams cad 'byung bas dpal lo //
translated: Glory means that all excellent qualities arise from that.

original: yang na rang bzhin rgyu'i 'jam dpal bsgom pa lam gyi 'jam dpal /
analyzed: yang na rang bzhin rgyu'i 'jam dpal bsgom pa lam gyi 'jam dpal /
translated: Alternatively, there are three: natural Mañjuśrī, the cause; meditation on path Mañjuśrī;

original: 'bras bu mthar thug gi 'jam dpal dang gsum ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu mthar thug gi 'jam dpal dang gsum ste /
translated: and ultimate fruition Mañjuśrī.

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang bcas pa dang / phyogs 'ga' dang ma bral ba dang / mtha' dag dang bral ba gsum la rim pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang bcas pa dang / phyogs 'ga' dang ma bral ba dang / mtha' dag dang bral ba gsum la rim pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: These are to be applied respectively to the three: one who possesses all the bonds, one who is not free from some aspects, and one who is free from all.

original: mtshan brjod pa'i don ni 'og nas yang dang yang bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan brjod pa'i don ni 'og nas yang dang yang bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the name recitation is taught again and again below.

original: de nas zhes pa ni aa tha zhes pa'i sgra ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni aa tha zhes pa'i sgra ste /
translated: Then is the word atha.

original: bkra shis pa'i tshig yin pas klad du byung zer la /🔽yang na kha cig ni /
analyzed: bkra shis pa'i tshig yin pas klad du byung zer la / yang na kha cig ni /
translated: Since it is a word of auspiciousness, it is said to be placed at the beginning.

original: de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
analyzed: de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
translated: Also, some assert that Then, the glorious Vajradhara

original: zhes pa'i don ma rgyud kyi bskyed rdzogs su 'dod de /
analyzed: zhes pa'i don ma rgyud kyi bskyed rdzogs su 'dod de /
translated: refers to the creation and completion stages of the mother tantras.

original: de yang aa tha badzra dha ra shr'i man zhes pa'i sgra ste /🔽aa ni lte ba na aa thung du bshad pa lta bu'i rnam pa reg bya tsha ba gtum @68a * //
analyzed: de yang aa tha badzra dha ra shr'i man zhes pa'i sgra ste / aa ni lte ba na aa thung du bshad pa lta bu'i rnam pa reg bya tsha ba gtum @68a * //
translated: That is the word atha vajradhara śrīman.

original: mo me'i rang bzhin du gnas la /
analyzed: mo me'i rang bzhin du gnas la /
translated: A is the short a explained to be at the navel, which has the aspect of a hot sensation, the nature of fierce fire.

original: tha ni spyi bo bde chen tsakra byang sems kyi tha me'i rgya yi ge tha log gi dbyibs su gnas /
analyzed: tha ni spyi bo bde chen tsakra byang sems kyi tha me'i rgya yi ge tha log gi dbyibs su gnas /
translated: Tha is the great-bliss cakra at the top of the head, which has the shape of the inverted Indian letter tha, the seal of the semen of bodhicitta.

original: badzra ni rdo rje ste mi phyed pa'i don lte bar bde ba phab nas de la 'bar 'dzag bya ste mi phyed pa /
analyzed: badzra ni rdo rje ste mi phyed pa'i don lte bar bde ba phab nas de la 'bar 'dzag bya ste mi phyed pa /
translated: Vajra means indivisible, and when bliss descends to the navel, it is burned and drips there, making it indivisible.

original: dha ra ni 'chang ba ste de dang mi 'bral ba'o ;
analyzed: dha ra ni 'chang ba ste de dang mi 'bral ba'o ;
translated: Dhara means to hold, and that is not to be separated from.

original: / shr'i ni dpal te de la legs pa'i yon tan thams cad 'byung bas so zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: / shr'i ni dpal te de la legs pa'i yon tan thams cad 'byung bas so zhes 'dod do //
translated: The east is glory, because all good qualities arise from it.

original: des sems gdul bya 'dul zhes ma rgyud du sbyar ro //
analyzed: des sems gdul bya 'dul zhes ma rgyud du sbyar ro //
translated: It is said that the mind is to be tamed by it, which is applied to the mother tantras.

original: yang na kha cig ni /🔽'jam dpal kri ya dpa' bo grub pa nas sangs rgyas gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi mtshan brjod cing /🔽de la bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par phyag 'tshal ba bas /
analyzed: yang na kha cig ni / 'jam dpal kri ya dpa' bo grub pa nas sangs rgyas gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi mtshan brjod cing / de la bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par phyag 'tshal ba bas /
translated: Alternatively, some say:🔽In the Sādhana of the Hero of the Kṛiyamaha, Mañjuśrī, it is said that the bhagavat has declared that the merit of reciting the names of the buddhas equal to the grains of sand in the Gaṅga river and prostrating to them for an eon or more🔽is surpassed by the merit of reciting the name of the venerable Mañjuśrī and prostrating once.

original: rje btsun 'jam dpal gyi mtshan brjod cing phyag lan cig btsal na de bsod nams khyad par 'phags so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pas 'khor rnams the tshom skyes te /
analyzed: rje btsun 'jam dpal gyi mtshan brjod cing phyag lan cig btsal na de bsod nams khyad par 'phags so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pas 'khor rnams the tshom skyes te /
translated: The retinue gave rise to doubt, thinking,

original: drang don du yin nam ;
analyzed: drang don du yin nam ;
translated: Is this the provisional meaning or🔽is it the definitive meaning?

original: nges don du yin snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa de gcad pa'i phyir de skad gsungs pa /
analyzed: nges don du yin snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa de gcad pa'i phyir de skad gsungs pa /
translated: In order to cut through that conceptualization, it was said in that way.

original: de ma thag kho nar phyag na rdo rjes gsol ba btab cing zhus pas de nas bya zer te /
analyzed: de ma thag kho nar phyag na rdo rjes gsol ba btab cing zhus pas de nas bya zer te /
translated: Immediately after that, since Vajrapāṇi made a request, the bhagavat said, Listen, Vajrapāṇi!

original: slob dpon sgeg pa'i grub mtha' gleng gzhi dang 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na zhes pa la sogs pa tshig gi phrad med pa'i de nas zhes pa'i tshig gcig klad du byung ba'i rgyud 'di rang rkya'i rgyud ma yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon sgeg pa'i grub mtha' gleng gzhi dang 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na zhes pa la sogs pa tshig gi phrad med pa'i de nas zhes pa'i tshig gcig klad du byung ba'i rgyud 'di rang rkya'i rgyud ma yin te /
translated: Master Lalitavajra asserts that this tantra is not an independent tantra because it has the word “then” at the beginning, which is not a connective word such as “thus,” “in this way,” “at one time,” and so on, which are found in the nidana and the phrase “thus have I heard.”

original: rgyud gzhan dang 'brel pa'i rgyud gcig yin par bzhed de /🔽dper na rdo rje rtse mo nas gzhan dang 'brel pa'i bshad rgyud yin pas /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan dang 'brel pa'i rgyud gcig yin par bzhed de / dper na rdo rje rtse mo nas gzhan dang 'brel pa'i bshad rgyud yin pas /
translated: He asserts that this is a tantra connected to another tantra.

original: de nas rgyal po rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: For example, since the Vajra Peak Tantra is an explanatory tantra connected to another tantra, it begins with the words “Then Vajradhara the king.”

original: zhes klad nas 'byung ba dang / dpal sgyu ma chen mo rtsa rgyud stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dang 'brel pas de nas mkha' 'gro ma rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o / de yang de nas zhes pa 'di phyag na rdo rje'i bla dags kyi tshig yin te /
analyzed: zhes klad nas 'byung ba dang / dpal sgyu ma chen mo rtsa rgyud stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dang 'brel pas de nas mkha' 'gro ma rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o / de yang de nas zhes pa 'di phyag na rdo rje'i bla dags kyi tshig yin te /
translated: And since the glorious Great Illusion Tantra is connected to the twelve thousand chapter root tantra, it begins with the words “Then the dakinis” and so on.

original: phyag na rdo rje rgyud 'di'i sdud pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje rgyud 'di'i sdud pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the word “then” is a reference to Vajrapani because he is the compiler of this tantra.

original: 'o na sdud pa po yin pas de nas bya ba 'di sdud pa po'i tshig yin par cis shes she na /
analyzed: 'o na sdud pa po yin pas de nas bya ba 'di sdud pa po'i tshig yin par cis shes she na /
translated: Well then, since he is the compiler, how do we know that the phrase “then” is the compiler’s words?🔽Because the words of the teacher’s reply are the words of the retinue, and the words of the compiler are the words of the one who connects the two.

original: bka' stsal ston pa'i tshig zhus pa 'khor gyi tshig mtshams sbyor sdud pa po'i tshig yin pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i rgyud sgyu 'phrul drab shlo ka phrag drug stong @68b par bcom ldan 'das kyis rdo rje'i mgur bzhes ba ste /
analyzed: bka' stsal ston pa'i tshig zhus pa 'khor gyi tshig mtshams sbyor sdud pa po'i tshig yin pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i rgyud sgyu 'phrul drab shlo ka phrag drug stong @68b par bcom ldan 'das kyis rdo rje'i mgur bzhes ba ste /
translated: The root tantra, the Magical Emanation, was sung by the Bhagavat in six thousand shlokas in vajra speech,🔽not in Sanskrit, but in vajra words.

original: sam skri ta'i skad du ma bzhes par rdo rje'i tshig tu bsgyur bas de dbang po rtul po'i 'khor rnams kyis ma go nas dbang po rtul ba'i 'khor nye bar bzung ba'i phyir de ma thag kho nar bya ba gzhan gyis bar mchod par phyag na rdo rje'i
analyzed: sam skri ta'i skad du ma bzhes par rdo rje'i tshig tu bsgyur bas de dbang po rtul po'i 'khor rnams kyis ma go nas dbang po rtul ba'i 'khor nye bar bzung ba'i phyir de ma thag kho nar bya ba gzhan gyis bar mchod par phyag na rdo rje'i
translated: Since the retinue of dull faculties did not understand, the retinue of dull faculties was taken into consideration, and immediately after that, the Bhagavat was requested by Vajrapani

original: 'khor ram grogs lnga brgya dang lhan cig glur blangs gang lags bshad du gsol //
analyzed: 'khor ram grogs lnga brgya dang lhan cig glur blangs gang lags bshad du gsol //
translated: to explain the song that was sung together with his retinue of five hundred.

original: zhes gsol ba btab pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes gsol ba btab pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the request.

original: aa tha zhes pa de ma thag pa la bya'o //
analyzed: aa tha zhes pa de ma thag pa la bya'o //
translated: The word “then” refers to immediately after that.

original: lnga brgya dang lhan cig tu ste /
analyzed: lnga brgya dang lhan cig tu ste /
translated: He took vows together with five hundred others.🔽Thus, the Vajrapani Empowerment Tantra declares:🔽Vajrapani took vows together with five hundred companions who were training to follow Vajrapani.

original: de ltar yang phyag na rdo rje dbang bskur ba'i rgyud las phyag na rdo rje'i rjes su slob pa'i grogs lnga brgya dang lhan cig tu mnos zhes 'byung ba des ni grogs kyi grangs kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang phyag na rdo rje dbang bskur ba'i rgyud las phyag na rdo rje'i rjes su slob pa'i grogs lnga brgya dang lhan cig tu mnos zhes 'byung ba des ni grogs kyi grangs kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This passage indicates the number of companions.

original: lnga brgya po de rnams kyi mtshan ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: lnga brgya po de rnams kyi mtshan ci yin zhe na /
translated: What are the names of those five hundred?

original: kun kyang lag na rdo rje zhes pa sha stag go //
analyzed: kun kyang lag na rdo rje zhes pa sha stag go //
translated: All of them are called Vajrapani.

original: mtha' yas zhes pa lnga brgya po de /
analyzed: mtha' yas zhes pa lnga brgya po de /
translated: The five hundred are called infinite because

original: re re la yang 'khor lnga brgya lnga brgya /
analyzed: re re la yang 'khor lnga brgya lnga brgya /
translated: each of them has a retinue of five hundred.

original: yang 'khor de re re la yang /
analyzed: yang 'khor de re re la yang /
translated: Each of those retinues

original: sum 'khor lnga brgya lnga brgya mnga' ba'am /
analyzed: sum 'khor lnga brgya lnga brgya mnga' ba'am /
translated: has a retinue of five hundred.

original: yang na lnga brgya po de rnams zab mo stong pa nyid rtogs pas /
analyzed: yang na lnga brgya po de rnams zab mo stong pa nyid rtogs pas /
translated: Or, those five hundred have infinite qualities because they realize profound emptiness.

original: yon tan mtha' yas pa ste mtshan gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan mtha' yas pa ste mtshan gyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the etymology of their name.

original: dpa' bo ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa gdul dka' ni lha chen gsum la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyis 'dul dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpa' bo ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa gdul dka' ni lha chen gsum la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyis 'dul dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are heroes because they are invincible and they are difficult to tame because they must be tamed through suffering, such as the three great gods.

original: 'dul ba ni phan 'dogs pa'i tshul dang / tshar gcod pa'i tshul gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba ni phan 'dogs pa'i tshul dang / tshar gcod pa'i tshul gnyis pa ste /
translated: The Vinaya is the method of benefiting and the method of subduing.

original: gong gi bas 'di khyab che ste phrin las kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: gong gi bas 'di khyab che ste phrin las kyi khyad par ro //
translated: This is more extensive than the above, and is the special activity.

original: 'jigs su rung ba ni khro bo'i lus te /
analyzed: 'jigs su rung ba ni khro bo'i lus te /
translated: The terrifying is the wrathful body.

original: khro bo'i lus kyi gzugs ldan pa //
analyzed: khro bo'i lus kyi gzugs ldan pa //
translated: Possessing the form of a wrathful body.

original: zhes pas 'og nas kyang rgyas par 'chad de gzugs kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: zhes pas 'og nas kyang rgyas par 'chad de gzugs kyi khyad par ro //
translated: This will be explained in detail below, and is the special form.

original: rdo rje ni phyag mtshan rtse mo ni steng gi cha rab ni rtse mo'i cha las phra mo 'phros shing nam mkha' thams cad du tam tam byung ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni phyag mtshan rtse mo ni steng gi cha rab ni rtse mo'i cha las phra mo 'phros shing nam mkha' thams cad du tam tam byung ba'o //
translated: The vajra is the hand implement, the peak is the upper part, and the tip is the part of the peak. The subtle emanation spreads out from the tip, and the tam tam arises in all space.

original: phyag na rdo rjes rang gi gdan las bzhengs nas gsol ba 'debs pa'i dus su de'i rjes su slob pa'i grogs lnga brgya po de rnams kyis rang gi stan gang yin pa las langs te /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rjes rang gi gdan las bzhengs nas gsol ba 'debs pa'i dus su de'i rjes su slob pa'i grogs lnga brgya po de rnams kyis rang gi stan gang yin pa las langs te /
translated: When Vajrapani rose from his seat and made a request, at that time, the five hundred companions who were following him rose from their own seats.

original: phyag g-yas pas rdo rje rnams yang dang yang du bsgyur zhing gsor te rdo rje'i theg pas sems can rnams 'khor ba las 'don pa la mnga' @69a * //
analyzed: phyag g-yas pas rdo rje rnams yang dang yang du bsgyur zhing gsor te rdo rje'i theg pas sems can rnams 'khor ba las 'don pa la mnga' @69a * //
translated: With his right hand he repeatedly brandishes and shakes his vajras, having gained mastery in liberating sentient beings from cyclic existence by means of the Vajra Vehicle.

original: brnyes pa'i don to //
analyzed: brnyes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: phyag mtshan gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: phyag mtshan gyi khyad par ro //
translated: This is the difference in hand implements.

original: shes rab ni stong pa nyid de mtha' thams cad dang bral ba zab pa'i don dam /
analyzed: shes rab ni stong pa nyid de mtha' thams cad dang bral ba zab pa'i don dam /
translated: Wisdom is emptiness, free from all extremes, the profound ultimate.

original: snying rje ni thabs thugs rje chen po ste rgya che ba de gnyis kyis 'gro ba'i don byed de /
analyzed: snying rje ni thabs thugs rje chen po ste rgya che ba de gnyis kyis 'gro ba'i don byed de /
translated: Compassion is the method, great compassion. With those two, he acts for the welfare of beings.

original: 'gro ba zhe sdang can rnams la snod ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba zhe sdang can rnams la snod ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: He is not a non-vessel for those beings with anger.

original: rdo rje rigs kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa nas de bzhin dug lnga cha mnyam pa rnams rigs bsdus kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i bar du don byed pa ni 'gro don byed pa'i nang na mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa nas de bzhin dug lnga cha mnyam pa rnams rigs bsdus kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i bar du don byed pa ni 'gro don byed pa'i nang na mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: From entering the mandala of the Vajra Family up to entering the mandala of the Unified Family for those with equal parts of the five poisons, acting for their welfare is the supreme among those acting for the welfare of beings.

original: dga' ba ni gdul bya zhe sdang can de dang bdag 'tsham pas gdul bya de la dga' la /
analyzed: dga' ba ni gdul bya zhe sdang can de dang bdag 'tsham pas gdul bya de la dga' la /
translated: Joy is delighting in that disciple with anger, as he is suitable for oneself.

original: 'gro ba ni rang zhe sdang can gdul ba'i gnyen po khro bo'i lus la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni rang zhe sdang can gdul ba'i gnyen po khro bo'i lus la dga' ba'o //
translated: Going is the delight in the wrathful body, which is the antidote for the subjugation of those who are naturally hateful.

original: spro ba ni gdul bya de 'dul ba la spro /
analyzed: spro ba ni gdul bya de 'dul ba la spro /
translated: Excitement is the enthusiasm for the subjugation of those to be tamed.

original: khro bo'i lus kyi chas 'jigs su rung ba'i chas bshad de /
analyzed: khro bo'i lus kyi chas 'jigs su rung ba'i chas bshad de /
translated: The attire of the wrathful body is explained as the attire of the terrifying.

original: 'jigs byed chen po dang drag tu dgod dbu phyag zhabs du ma spyan mi sdug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs byed chen po dang drag tu dgod dbu phyag zhabs du ma spyan mi sdug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the great terrifying one, the one who laughs fiercely, the one with many faces, hands, and feet, the one with unpleasant eyes, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas phrin las zhes pa longs sku dang sprul sku'i phrin las te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas phrin las zhes pa longs sku dang sprul sku'i phrin las te /
translated: The activity of the buddhas is the activity of the sambhogakāya and nirmāṇakāya.

original: longs sku ni gnas dang dus dang 'khor rnams lhan cig tu chos bstan pa las gzhan gyi phrin las mdzad la /
analyzed: longs sku ni gnas dang dus dang 'khor rnams lhan cig tu chos bstan pa las gzhan gyi phrin las mdzad la /
translated: The sambhogakāya performs activity other than the teaching of the dharma in the place, time, and retinue.

original: sprul skus ni mi bstan pa nas mdzad de ;
analyzed: sprul skus ni mi bstan pa nas mdzad de ;
translated: The nirmāṇakāya performs activity without teaching.

original: de gnyis bstan pa la bar du gcod pa'am gdug pa can 'dul bas phyag na rdo rje rnams ni mgon te /
analyzed: de gnyis bstan pa la bar du gcod pa'am gdug pa can 'dul bas phyag na rdo rje rnams ni mgon te /
translated: Since those two are the protectors of the doctrine, the vajra holders are the protectors.

original: bcom ldan 'das la lus btud nas grogs de rnams dang lhan cig tu /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la lus btud nas grogs de rnams dang lhan cig tu /
translated: Having bowed to the Bhagavān, they said,

original: glur blangs gang lags bshad du gsol //
analyzed: glur blangs gang lags bshad du gsol //
translated: “Please explain the songs.”

original: zhes gsol ba btab pa dang 'brel te des grogs rnams kyi the tshom chod do //
analyzed: zhes gsol ba btab pa dang 'brel te des grogs rnams kyi the tshom chod do //
translated: This is related to the supplication.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa ni ta th'a ga ta'i sgras 'gro ba dang / rtogs pa dang / gsung ba la rab tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa ni ta th'a ga ta'i sgras 'gro ba dang / rtogs pa dang / gsung ba la rab tu 'jug ste /
translated: The term tathāgata is derived from the term tathāgata, which refers to going, realization, and speech.

original: ji srid du spang bya yod kyi bar du sa dang lam gong nas gong du 'gro ba ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du spang bya yod kyi bar du sa dang lam gong nas gong du 'gro ba ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: As long as there are objects to be abandoned, going higher and higher to the stages and paths is the perfection of abandonment.

original: spang bya spangs nas ji lta ba dang ji snyed pa'i shes bya thams cad shes pa ni rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa ste de gnyis bdag gi don to //
analyzed: spang bya spangs nas ji lta ba dang ji snyed pa'i shes bya thams cad shes pa ni rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa ste de gnyis bdag gi don to //
translated: After abandoning the objects to be abandoned, knowing all objects of knowledge, both the way things are and the diversity of phenomena, is the perfection of realization. Those two are for one’s own benefit.

original: rtogs pa'i don gzhan la ston pa ni gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don gzhan la ston pa ni gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Teaching the meaning of realization to others is the perfection of benefit for others.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni bha ga b'an te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni bha ga b'an te /
translated: Bhagavat means

original: bdud bzhi @69b bcom pa'am yang na phun sum tshogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdud bzhi @69b bcom pa'am yang na phun sum tshogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: the one who has conquered the four māras or who possesses the qualities of perfection.

original: rdzogs pa ni bdag gzhan gyi don thams cad ma lus par rdzogs pa de lta bu'i sangs rgyas de la phyag na rdo rje de rnams kyis gsol ba 'debs pa de thams cad kyang rdo rje gsor zhing bsgyur bzhin pa dang bcas pa des btsan thabs sam mi
analyzed: rdzogs pa ni bdag gzhan gyi don thams cad ma lus par rdzogs pa de lta bu'i sangs rgyas de la phyag na rdo rje de rnams kyis gsol ba 'debs pa de thams cad kyang rdo rje gsor zhing bsgyur bzhin pa dang bcas pa des btsan thabs sam mi
translated: All of those Vajrapāṇis who make requests to that buddha, while brandishing and waving their vajras, are thinking, “I am requesting in a forceful or unwilling manner.”

original: dga' bzhin du gsol ba 'debs snyam pa la phyag lan gsum btsal bskor ba lan gsum byas nas /
analyzed: dga' bzhin du gsol ba 'debs snyam pa la phyag lan gsum btsal bskor ba lan gsum byas nas /
translated: They should prostrate three times and circumambulate three times.

original: thams cad kyang thal mo sbyar zhing sor rtsel rdo rje sib be thogs nas gus pa'i tshul gyis mdun phyogs su spyan sngar bus mo g-yas pa sa la btsugs te 'dug par gyur te 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig 'di skad do //
analyzed: thams cad kyang thal mo sbyar zhing sor rtsel rdo rje sib be thogs nas gus pa'i tshul gyis mdun phyogs su spyan sngar bus mo g-yas pa sa la btsugs te 'dug par gyur te 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig 'di skad do //
translated: All of them should join their palms, hold a vajra scepter at the tips of their fingers, and with a respectful manner stand in front of the master, having placed their right knees on the ground.

original: des ni zhu tshul gyi the tshom chod do //
analyzed: des ni zhu tshul gyi the tshom chod do //
translated: This resolves the doubt about the manner of requesting.

original: gang gi ched du zhus snyam pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gi ched du zhus snyam pa la gsungs pa /
translated: If it is wondered for what purpose they are requesting, it is stated:

original: khyab bdag ni brtan g-yo thams cad la khyab pa ste kye khyab bdag ces sangs rgyas la bod pa'o //
analyzed: khyab bdag ni brtan g-yo thams cad la khyab pa ste kye khyab bdag ces sangs rgyas la bod pa'o //
translated: The all-pervading lord pervades all things stable and moving. O all-pervading lord is an address to the Buddha.

original: phyag na rdo rje la phan gdags mi dgos rdo rje ni stong pa nyid de zab pa'i don dam mo //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje la phan gdags mi dgos rdo rje ni stong pa nyid de zab pa'i don dam mo //
translated: The vajra in Vajrapani is emptiness, the profound ultimate truth.

original: dpal ni dkyil 'khor bdun gyi lha la bya ste kun rdzob tu rgya che ba des legs pa'i yon tan ster la de gang dang ldan pa ni phyag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: dpal ni dkyil 'khor bdun gyi lha la bya ste kun rdzob tu rgya che ba des legs pa'i yon tan ster la de gang dang ldan pa ni phyag na rdo rje'o //
translated: The splendor is the deities of the seven maṇḍalas, the vast relative truth. He who bestows the good qualities of that splendor is Vajrapani.

original: yang rdo rje ni dbyer mi phyed pa'i ston pa dang 'khor dang sdud ba tha mi dad pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang rdo rje ni dbyer mi phyed pa'i ston pa dang 'khor dang sdud ba tha mi dad pa'i don to //
translated: The vajra also means the indivisible meaning of the non-differentiation of teacher, retinue, and compiler.

original: de ltar yang dgyes pa'i rdo rje las /
analyzed: de ltar yang dgyes pa'i rdo rje las /
translated: Thus, in the Hevajra Tantra it is said:

original: nga nyid ston pa nga nyid chos //
analyzed: nga nyid ston pa nga nyid chos //
translated: I am the teacher, I am the Dharma,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and so forth.

original: 'chang ba ni skye med don rtogs pa'i rtags su phyag mtshan rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: 'chang ba ni skye med don rtogs pa'i rtags su phyag mtshan rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
translated: The bearer is one who holds the vajra as a symbol of realizing the meaning of non-arising.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dam ngo bo de lta bu dang ldan pa'i phyag na rdo rje des gsol ba btab ba de bshad du gsol zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dam ngo bo de lta bu dang ldan pa'i phyag na rdo rje des gsol ba btab ba de bshad du gsol zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: Please explain is connected to that.

original: gdul dka' zhes pa sems can sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la 'dzud pa ni phan 'dogs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzud pa dang tshar gcod pa'i tshul gyis 'dzud pa las /
analyzed: gdul dka' zhes pa sems can sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la 'dzud pa ni phan 'dogs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzud pa dang tshar gcod pa'i tshul gyis 'dzud pa las /
translated: Difficult to tame means that sentient beings are brought into the Buddha's teachings by being brought in through the method of benefit and by being brought in through the method of annihilation.

original: 'dir tshar gcod pa'i tshul gyis 'dzud pa ste chen po gsum la sogs pa zhi bas mi 'dul ba gang yin pa de btsan thabs sam mi dga' ba'i tshogs 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir tshar gcod pa'i tshul gyis 'dzud pa ste chen po gsum la sogs pa zhi bas mi 'dul ba gang yin pa de btsan thabs sam mi dga' ba'i tshogs 'dul ba ste /
translated: Here, it is bringing in through the method of annihilation. Those who are not subdued by the great three and so forth are those who are subdued by the method of force or the method of displeasure.

original: de yang dpal khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba las khyab 'jug 'dul pa'i phyir lcags kyu can gyis snying ga nas bzung nas 'ongs pas khos lcags khyu bcag @70a* //
analyzed: de yang dpal khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba las khyab 'jug 'dul pa'i phyir lcags kyu can gyis snying ga nas bzung nas 'ongs pas khos lcags khyu bcag @70a* //
translated: Moreover, in the Shri Vishuddhachakra, for the sake of taming Vishnu, the one with the hook seized him by the heart and brought him. He broke the hook

original: nas shor bas /
analyzed: nas shor bas /
translated: and escaped.

original: lcags kyu la sogs bcag nas ni //
analyzed: lcags kyu la sogs bcag nas ni //
translated: Having broken the hook and so forth,

original: bdag cag rnams kyis kho shor na //
analyzed: bdag cag rnams kyis kho shor na //
translated: we have lost him.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po ji ltar bgyi //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po ji ltar bgyi //
translated: How should the King of Knowledge act?

original: zhes pa nas dril bus myos su bcug nas brgyal ba las /
analyzed: zhes pa nas dril bus myos su bcug nas brgyal ba las /
translated: From there, having been intoxicated by the bell, he fainted.

original: 'og gi phyogs thal bas khebs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes te sangs rgya'o zhes lung bstan /
analyzed: 'og gi phyogs thal bas khebs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes te sangs rgya'o zhes lung bstan /
translated: He was reborn in the world below, covered with ashes, and attained Buddhahood.

original: dbu la zla ba tshes gcig pa'i dbu rgyan bskor ba lta bu ste drag shul gyis 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: dbu la zla ba tshes gcig pa'i dbu rgyan bskor ba lta bu ste drag shul gyis 'dul ba'o //
translated: On his head, he had a crown ornament like a crescent moon.🔽This is the taming through wrath.

original: gdul bya rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa ni phyag na rdo rje ste phrin las kyi khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pas bshad du gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa ni phyag na rdo rje ste phrin las kyi khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pas bshad du gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa dang 'brel to //
translated: The supreme among the disciples is Vajrapāṇi. Since he possesses such special activity, he is related to the request to explain.

original: dpa' bo ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa 'jig rten gsum ni sa bla sa 'og sa steng na tsa mund'i'i ming po rgyal bar byed pa dang / sbrang rtsir byed pa dang / don grub pa gsum las phyag na rdo rje rgyal ba ste phrin las kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: dpa' bo ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa 'jig rten gsum ni sa bla sa 'og sa steng na tsa mund'i'i ming po rgyal bar byed pa dang / sbrang rtsir byed pa dang / don grub pa gsum las phyag na rdo rje rgyal ba ste phrin las kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The hero is Aparājita. The three worlds are the upper, lower, and middle realms. Among the three brothers of Caṇḍa, Jayakara, Madhukara, and Siddhakara, Vajrapāṇi is the victor. This is the special activity.

original: rdo rje dbang phyug ni rdo rje'i theg pa la mnga' brnyes pa'am rdo rje'i rigs las mnga' brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbang phyug ni rdo rje'i theg pa la mnga' brnyes pa'am rdo rje'i rigs las mnga' brnyes pa'o //
translated: Vajra lord means that he has attained mastery over the Vajra Vehicle or has attained mastery over the Vajra family.

original: gsang ba'i rgyal ni nyon mongs pa lnga mtshams med kyi las la sogs pa gsang ba'i 'os yin pa de las rgyal ba'am /
analyzed: gsang ba'i rgyal ni nyon mongs pa lnga mtshams med kyi las la sogs pa gsang ba'i 'os yin pa de las rgyal ba'am /
translated: King of secrets means that he has conquered the secrets that are suitable to be kept secret, such as the five afflictions and the five heinous actions.

original: yang na rdo rje'i rigs la sogs pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i dam tshig zhe sdang can bsgral ba dang / ser sna can gyi nor ma byin par blangs la dkon mchog dang bla ma mchod pa la sogs pa lta bu gsang ba'i ma mo yin la de las rgyal bas gsang ba'i rgyal te /
analyzed: yang na rdo rje'i rigs la sogs pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i dam tshig zhe sdang can bsgral ba dang / ser sna can gyi nor ma byin par blangs la dkon mchog dang bla ma mchod pa la sogs pa lta bu gsang ba'i ma mo yin la de las rgyal bas gsang ba'i rgyal te /
translated: Alternatively, he is the king of secrets because he has conquered the secret mother tantras, such as liberating those with hatred and taking the wealth of the miser without their permission in order to make offerings to the Three Jewels and the guru, which are the uncommon pledges of the Vajra family and so on.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan can gyis gsol ba btab pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan can gyis gsol ba btab pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is how the name is applied to the supplicant.

original: padma dkar po kha bye ba dang 'dra ba'i spyan mnga' ba /
analyzed: padma dkar po kha bye ba dang 'dra ba'i spyan mnga' ba /
translated: He has eyes that resemble a fully opened white lotus.

original: rgyas pa ni shin tu kha bye ba ste mu kha zhes pa'i sgra kha dang sgo dang gdong pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: rgyas pa ni shin tu kha bye ba ste mu kha zhes pa'i sgra kha dang sgo dang gdong pa la 'jug ste /
translated: Fully opened means very open. The term mukha refers to a mouth, a door, and a face.

original: 'dir ni gdong gi zhal dang / padma rgyas pa lta bu can te skye mched kyi khyad par de lta bu dang ldan te gsol ba btab pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dir ni gdong gi zhal dang / padma rgyas pa lta bu can te skye mched kyi khyad par de lta bu dang ldan te gsol ba btab pa dang sbyar te /
translated: One should apply the supplication.

original: rang gi lag gis rdo rje de yang dang yang du gsor ba ni rdo rje theg pas sems can rnams sgrol ba'i brda'am /
analyzed: rang gi lag gis rdo rje de yang dang yang du gsor ba ni rdo rje theg pas sems can rnams sgrol ba'i brda'am /
translated: Waving the vajra again and again with one's own hand is a symbol of liberating sentient beings through the Vajrayāna.

original: yang na 'khor der mi ma yin pa mang po bar du gcod pa'i phyir 'dus pas rang gi padma dang zla ba'i gdan gang yin pa las bzhengs nas bzhin khro ba dang bcas pas mche ba gtsigs gtsigs mdzad cing @70b rdo rje yang dang yang du gsor bas
analyzed: yang na 'khor der mi ma yin pa mang po bar du gcod pa'i phyir 'dus pas rang gi padma dang zla ba'i gdan gang yin pa las bzhengs nas bzhin khro ba dang bcas pas mche ba gtsigs gtsigs mdzad cing @70b rdo rje yang dang yang du gsor bas
translated: Alternatively, since many nonhuman beings gathered in the retinue in order to create obstacles, one should rise from one's lotus-moon seat, with a wrathful face, gnashing one's teeth, and wave the vajra again and again.

original: mi ma yin pa bar du gcod pa'i phyir lhags pa rnams kyi bsam pa la gshis ngan 'dis rdo rje brdeg gam snyam du sems te /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa bar du gcod pa'i phyir lhags pa rnams kyi bsam pa la gshis ngan 'dis rdo rje brdeg gam snyam du sems te /
translated: The thought of the nonhuman beings who have come in order to create obstacles is that this bad-natured one will strike with the vajra.

original: gdug pa can sba bkong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdug pa can sba bkong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is in order to frighten the wicked.

original: phyag mtshan gyi khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pa bshad du gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: phyag mtshan gyi khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pa bshad du gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa dang 'brel to //
translated: The request is connected with the request, “Please explain the one who has such special hand implements.”

original: des ni gsol ba 'debs mkhan ngo shes so //
analyzed: des ni gsol ba 'debs mkhan ngo shes so //
translated: By that, the supplicant is recognized.

original: khro gnyer zhes pa khro gnyer gyi rlabs g-yo ba'i rgyan dang ldan pa zhal gdangs pa mche ba gtsigs pa ste /
analyzed: khro gnyer zhes pa khro gnyer gyi rlabs g-yo ba'i rgyan dang ldan pa zhal gdangs pa mche ba gtsigs pa ste /
translated: “Frowning” has the ornament of the wave of frowning, an open mouth, and bared fangs.

original: de lta bu'i grogs po la sogs pa phyis kyi rnal 'byor pa mtshan nyid kyi sgom chen rnal 'byor pa rnams la bdag ces bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i grogs po la sogs pa phyis kyi rnal 'byor pa mtshan nyid kyi sgom chen rnal 'byor pa rnams la bdag ces bya ste /
translated: Such a friend, etc., is called “I” to later yogins, great meditators with characteristics.

original: tshe 'di la sman pa dang phyi ma'i don dang thugs brtse ste 'di dang phyi ma gnyis ka'i don to //
analyzed: tshe 'di la sman pa dang phyi ma'i don dang thugs brtse ste 'di dang phyi ma gnyis ka'i don to //
translated: It is medicine for this life, the benefit of the next life, and compassion, the benefit of both this life and the next.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba zhes pa ni rgyu la ma 'bras bu sbyar te /
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba zhes pa ni rgyu la ma 'bras bu sbyar te /
translated: “Magical net” is the result applied to the cause.

original: de yang 'dir rgyu sgyu 'phrul dra ba lam 'bras bu sgyu 'phrul dra ba gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang 'dir rgyu sgyu 'phrul dra ba lam 'bras bu sgyu 'phrul dra ba gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, here there are three magical nets: the cause, the path, and the result.

original: de yang rgyu ni gnyis med kyi shes pa nyid sna tshogs su snang bas sgyu 'phrul lo //
analyzed: de yang rgyu ni gnyis med kyi shes pa nyid sna tshogs su snang bas sgyu 'phrul lo //
translated: The cause is the nondual consciousness itself, which is magical because it appears as a diversity.

original: de tsham na glo bur dri mas bsgribs kyang skye med stong pa nyid kyi rgya dang ma bral zhing de dang 'brel pas dra ba lam ni 'ching ba phyogs dang bral /
analyzed: de tsham na glo bur dri mas bsgribs kyang skye med stong pa nyid kyi rgya dang ma bral zhing de dang 'brel pas dra ba lam ni 'ching ba phyogs dang bral /
translated: At that time, although obscured by adventitious stains, it is not separate from the seal of unborn emptiness and is connected with it.🔽Therefore, the net is free from the direction of bondage, free from some direction, and the maṇḍala of fifty-three deities appears in front.

original: phyogs 'ga' dang ma bral ba lha lnga bcu rtsa gsum gyi dkyil 'khor mdun du snang yang rang bzhin stong pa'i rgya dang ma bral bas sgyu 'phrul dra ba zhe'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'ga' dang ma bral ba lha lnga bcu rtsa gsum gyi dkyil 'khor mdun du snang yang rang bzhin stong pa'i rgya dang ma bral bas sgyu 'phrul dra ba zhe'o //
translated: Since it is not separate from the seal of empty nature, it is the net of illusions.🔽The result is the five kāyas, the five pristine consciousnesses, and the single taste of the mind of enlightenment, the nature of reality, and the mere appearance of the five families, the five buddhas, and so on.

original: 'bras bu ni sku lnga ye shes lnga chos nyid byang chub sems su ro gcig pa'i bdag nyid dang rigs lnga sangs rgyas lnga la sogs par snang tsam na stong ba'i rgya dang ma bral bas sgyu 'phrul dra ba zhe'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni sku lnga ye shes lnga chos nyid byang chub sems su ro gcig pa'i bdag nyid dang rigs lnga sangs rgyas lnga la sogs par snang tsam na stong ba'i rgya dang ma bral bas sgyu 'phrul dra ba zhe'o //
translated: Since it is not separate from the seal of emptiness, it is the net of illusions.🔽Here, the net is the path.🔽The result is perfect enlightenment.

original: de la 'dir ni dra ba zhes pa lam des 'bras bu mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de ci nas kyang bdag gis thob par mdzod cig ces pa ste bdag don no //
analyzed: de la 'dir ni dra ba zhes pa lam des 'bras bu mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de ci nas kyang bdag gis thob par mdzod cig ces pa ste bdag don no //
translated: “Please obtain that for me” is the benefit for oneself.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / khong khro ma rig pa lta ba the tshom ste rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa drug gis sems gnyug ma ma bcos pa de dkrugs rnyog rdzogs nas mi shes pa de ma rig pa'i 'dam du bying nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / khong khro ma rig pa lta ba the tshom ste rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa drug gis sems gnyug ma ma bcos pa de dkrugs rnyog rdzogs nas mi shes pa de ma rig pa'i 'dam du bying nas /
translated: The mind is disturbed and agitated by these six root afflictions, and the ignorance of not knowing how to escape from that state causes one to sink into the mire of ignorance.

original: de las 'thon pa dka' ba de lta bu'i 'khor ba'i sems can la phan pa ste gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu /
analyzed: de las 'thon pa dka' ba de lta bu'i 'khor ba'i sems can la phan pa ste gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu /
translated: The temporary result is the benefit of sentient beings in samsara, who are difficult to extricate from that state.

original: bla med 'bras bu ni mthar thug ste /
analyzed: bla med 'bras bu ni mthar thug ste /
translated: The unsurpassed result is the ultimate.

original: de thob par bya ba'i phyir bshad du gsol zhes @71a * //
analyzed: de thob par bya ba'i phyir bshad du gsol zhes @71a * //
translated: In order to attain that, please explain.

original: gsol ba btab pa dang 'brel te /
analyzed: gsol ba btab pa dang 'brel te /
translated: This is related to the supplication.

original: des ni gang gi ched du zhus pa'i the tshom sel to //
analyzed: des ni gang gi ched du zhus pa'i the tshom sel to //
translated: This removes the doubt of for whom the request is made.

original: zhus pa dang gang la zhus snyam pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhus pa dang gang la zhus snyam pa la gsungs pa /
translated: Since it is wondered who made the request and to whom, it is said:

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
translated: The perfect Buddha, the Bhagavān.

original: zhes pa rigs ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs /
analyzed: zhes pa rigs ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs /
translated: The family is the tathāgata family.🔽Buddha is Vairocana.

original: sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings /
translated: Wisdom is the dharmadhātu.

original: de bzhin du 'gro ba'i bla ma ni rin chen rigs 'byung ldan mnyam nyid ye shes /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gro ba'i bla ma ni rin chen rigs 'byung ldan mnyam nyid ye shes /
translated: Likewise, the guru of beings is Ratnasambhava, the mirrorlike gnosis.

original: ston pa ni rdo rje rigs mi bskyod /
analyzed: ston pa ni rdo rje rigs mi bskyod /
translated: The teacher is Akṣobhya, the vajra family.

original: me long lta bu dam tshig chen po ni byang chub sems rdo rje sems dpar ro gcig par gyur pa de nyid mkhyen pa ni snang ba mtha' yas so sor rtog pa /
analyzed: me long lta bu dam tshig chen po ni byang chub sems rdo rje sems dpar ro gcig par gyur pa de nyid mkhyen pa ni snang ba mtha' yas so sor rtog pa /
translated: The great pledge of the mirrorlike gnosis is the bodhicitta that has become of one taste with Vajrasattva, the wisdom of discernment.

original: dbang po bsam pa mkhyen pa ni las kyi rigs bya ba grub pa /
analyzed: dbang po bsam pa mkhyen pa ni las kyi rigs bya ba grub pa /
translated: The knowledge of the thoughts and wishes of the disciples is the karma family, the wisdom of accomplishment.

original: mchog ni rigs lnga byang sems rdo rje rigs dang drug tu ro gcig pa'am /🔽de bzhin du ye shes lnga /
analyzed: mchog ni rigs lnga byang sems rdo rje rigs dang drug tu ro gcig pa'am / de bzhin du ye shes lnga /
translated: The supreme is the one who has become of one taste with the bodhisattvas of the five families and the vajra family, making six.

original: chos nyid byang chub sems dang drug tu ro gcig pa'am /🔽bde gshegs lnga /
analyzed: chos nyid byang chub sems dang drug tu ro gcig pa'am / bde gshegs lnga /
translated: Or, likewise, the one who has become of one taste with the five gnoses and the bodhicitta of reality, making six.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dang drug tu ro gcig tu gyur pa ni mchog gi ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dang drug tu ro gcig tu gyur pa ni mchog gi ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, the one who has become of one taste with the five sugatas and Vajrasattva, making six, is called the supreme teacher.

original: de la rnam snang la ci'i phyir rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam snang la ci'i phyir rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is Vairocana called the perfect buddha?

original: bdag gzhan don thams cad rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pas so //
analyzed: bdag gzhan don thams cad rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pas so //
translated: Since the nature of the vajra master is the perfection of all one's own and others' goals,

original: 'o na rigs gzhan dag gzhan gyi don ma rdzogs sam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rigs gzhan dag gzhan gyi don ma rdzogs sam zhe na /
translated: one might wonder, Are the goals of others not perfected by the other buddha families?

original: rigs gzhan la yang ma rdzogs pa med kyi /
analyzed: rigs gzhan la yang ma rdzogs pa med kyi /
translated: There is no incompleteness in the other buddha families.

original: 'on kyang 'di ni yon tan phyogs re la dgongs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni yon tan phyogs re la dgongs so //
translated: However, the qualities of the other families are considered in terms of individual aspects.

original: de bzhin du rgol tshig rnams khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgol tshig rnams khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: In the same way, the objections should be drawn out.

original: de la 'gro ba ni sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: de la 'gro ba ni sku gsung thugs so //
translated: The going is the body, speech, and mind.

original: bla ma ni yon tan de de'i bdag nyid rin chen 'byung ldan la gnas pas de skad bya'o //
analyzed: bla ma ni yon tan de de'i bdag nyid rin chen 'byung ldan la gnas pas de skad bya'o //
translated: The guru is the one who has the nature of those qualities, who is Ratnasaṃbhava, and is called that.

original: ston pa zhes pa ni mi bskyod pas rang gi de nyid gzhan la ston pa ste /
analyzed: ston pa zhes pa ni mi bskyod pas rang gi de nyid gzhan la ston pa ste /
translated: The teacher is Akṣobhya, who teaches others his own nature.

original: gtsug dgu nas kyang rang gi ngo bo de nyid ston par mdzad pa rdo rje gtsug tor zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gtsug dgu nas kyang rang gi ngo bo de nyid ston par mdzad pa rdo rje gtsug tor zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the statement in the Uṣṇīṣavijayā, The one who teaches his own nature is the vajra uṣṇīṣa.

original: dam tshig ni byang sems rdo rje ste stong pa'i don las mi 'da' la de nyid kyi ye shes lnga'am thams cad la khyab pa chen po ste /
analyzed: dam tshig ni byang sems rdo rje ste stong pa'i don las mi 'da' la de nyid kyi ye shes lnga'am thams cad la khyab pa chen po ste /
translated: The commitment is the bodhisattva vajra, who does not transgress the meaning of emptiness, and is the great pervader of the five or all pristine consciousnesses.

original: des na de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: des na de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called that.

original: de nyid mkhyen ces pa ni chos can so so la chos nyid so sor mkhyen pas sam /
analyzed: de nyid mkhyen ces pa ni chos can so so la chos nyid so sor mkhyen pas sam /
translated: That very knowledge is the knowledge of the individual dharmatā in each phenomenon.

original: yang na gong ma'i ston pa nyid kyi dam tshig de nyid mkhyen pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gong ma'i ston pa nyid kyi dam tshig de nyid mkhyen pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, it is called that because the teacher above knows the commitment of suchness.

original: gang zag gdul bya'i dbang po rab @71b 'bring tha ma thams cad bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyis mkhyen pas don grub pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag gdul bya'i dbang po rab @71b 'bring tha ma thams cad bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyis mkhyen pas don grub pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since the gnosis of successful activities knows all the faculties of the disciples, high, medium, and low, it is called accomplishing the purpose.

original: de lta bu'i ro gcig pa mchog gi ston pa de la bshad du gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa ste des ni gang la zhus pa'i the tshom chod pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ro gcig pa mchog gi ston pa de la bshad du gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa ste des ni gang la zhus pa'i the tshom chod pa'o //
translated: The request is Please explain that teacher of the supreme, single taste. That resolves the doubts of the request.

original: don gyi ngo bo gang zhus snyam pa la /
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo gang zhus snyam pa la /
translated: What is the essence of the meaning requested?🔽The supreme expression of the name

original: 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' yi //
analyzed: 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' yi //
translated: of Mañjuśrī, the jñānasattva,

original: mtshan ni yang dag brjod pa'i mchog / ces pa la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: mtshan ni yang dag brjod pa'i mchog / ces pa la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ste /
translated: and so on, is as follows.

original: de la 'jam dpal ci la bya /
analyzed: de la 'jam dpal ci la bya /
translated: What is meant by Mañjuśrī?

original: ye shes sems dpa' ci la bya /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' ci la bya /
translated: What is meant by jñānasattva?

original: mtshan brjod pa ci la bya zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan brjod pa ci la bya zhe na /
translated: What is meant by the term “Mañjuśrī”?

original: de la 'jam dpal ni ci la bya ba bya ba ste grub mtha'i sgo nas ci la bya zer ram /
analyzed: de la 'jam dpal ni ci la bya ba bya ba ste grub mtha'i sgo nas ci la bya zer ram /
translated: Is it the case that Mañjuśrī is the name of something?

original: dngos po gnas thabs kyi 'jam dpal ci la bya zer /
analyzed: dngos po gnas thabs kyi 'jam dpal ci la bya zer /
translated: Is it the case that Mañjuśrī is the name of the abiding reality of things?

original: de la grub mtha'i 'jam dpal ci la bya zer na nyan thos ma h'a yo ga ste rnal 'byor chen po'i bar du mi mthun te /
analyzed: de la grub mtha'i 'jam dpal ci la bya zer na nyan thos ma h'a yo ga ste rnal 'byor chen po'i bar du mi mthun te /
translated: If it is the case that Mañjuśrī is the name of a philosophical tenet, then it is not the same as the philosophical tenets from the śrāvakas up to the great yoga.

original: nyan thos kyi grub mtha'i 'jam dpal ni so so'i skye bo rang rgyud pa 'phags pa'i rigs can khye'u lo brgyad pa'am bcu drug pa lta bur 'dod //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi grub mtha'i 'jam dpal ni so so'i skye bo rang rgyud pa 'phags pa'i rigs can khye'u lo brgyad pa'am bcu drug pa lta bur 'dod //
translated: The Mañjuśrī of the śrāvaka philosophical tenets is asserted to be an ordinary being with an individual continuum who is of the family of the āryas, like an eight-year-old or sixteen-year-old boy.

original: theg pa thun mong gi grub mtha' sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' slob pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa rang rgyud gcig par 'dod //
analyzed: theg pa thun mong gi grub mtha' sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' slob pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa rang rgyud gcig par 'dod //
translated: The Mañjuśrī of the philosophical tenets of the common vehicle is asserted to be a bodhisattva of the tenth stage who is included in the path of training and has a single continuum.

original: theg pa chen po thun mong ma yin pa'i gzhung gis bskal ba dpag tu med pa'i gong du sangs rgyas pa mi slob pa'i sa sa bsdus pa gcig tshogs pa'i phyir rang don du sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa'i cha bzung ba cig yin par 'dod /
analyzed: theg pa chen po thun mong ma yin pa'i gzhung gis bskal ba dpag tu med pa'i gong du sangs rgyas pa mi slob pa'i sa sa bsdus pa gcig tshogs pa'i phyir rang don du sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa'i cha bzung ba cig yin par 'dod /
translated: According to the uncommon scriptures of the Mahayana, he is held to be a bodhisattva on the tenth level who has taken on that role for the sake of others, because he is the single level that is subsumed within the level of no more training, which was attained countless eons ago.

original: kri ya las rigs gsum las rgyu rigs kyi cha bzung ba'i 'jam dpal du 'dod do //
analyzed: kri ya las rigs gsum las rgyu rigs kyi cha bzung ba'i 'jam dpal du 'dod do //
translated: According to the kriya tantras, he is held to be Manjushri, who is the aspect of the causal family among the three families.

original: yo gas ri rab kyi steng du sangs rgyas rgyal mchog sprul pa'i dus su nub phyogs kyi sems dpa' gnyis pa rdo rje rnon po zhes bya ba de la 'jam dpal du 'dod do //
analyzed: yo gas ri rab kyi steng du sangs rgyas rgyal mchog sprul pa'i dus su nub phyogs kyi sems dpa' gnyis pa rdo rje rnon po zhes bya ba de la 'jam dpal du 'dod do //
translated: According to the yogatantras, he is held to be Manjushri, who is the second being in the west, called Vajrashatru, when the supreme emanation Buddha manifests on top of Mount Meru.

original: rnal 'byor chen pos chos sku'i bdag nyid la 'jam dpal du 'dod do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen pos chos sku'i bdag nyid la 'jam dpal du 'dod do //
translated: According to the mahayoga tantras, he is held to be Manjushri, who is the embodiment of the dharmakaya.

original: de la kun du bzang po zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de la kun du bzang po zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: He is also called Samantabhadra.🔽He is also called Shri Maha-sukha.

original: dpal bde ba chen po zhes kyang bya ba de las 'dir ni dngos po gnas lugs kyi 'jam dpal de ston te /
analyzed: dpal bde ba chen po zhes kyang bya ba de las 'dir ni dngos po gnas lugs kyi 'jam dpal de ston te /
translated: Here, the Manjushri of the natural state of things is being taught.

original: de ci la bya zhes dris pa'i don des ni ye shes rnam pa lnga chos nyid byang chub sems dang drug ro gcig par gyur te /
analyzed: de ci la bya zhes dris pa'i don des ni ye shes rnam pa lnga chos nyid byang chub sems dang drug ro gcig par gyur te /
translated: The meaning of the question “What is that?” is that the five aspects of pristine consciousness and the dharmatā of bodhicitta are of one taste.

original: de yang gong du /
analyzed: de yang gong du /
translated: Also, above it says:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes sku //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes sku //
translated: The jñānakāya of the bhagavān

original: zhes pa me long lta @72a * //🔽pu'i ye shes gtsug tor chen po ni mnyam pa nyid /
analyzed: zhes pa me long lta @72a * // pu'i ye shes gtsug tor chen po ni mnyam pa nyid /
translated: is the great uṣṇīṣa.🔽The lord of words is the jñānakāya of the individually discriminating pristine consciousness, the self-originated dharmadhātu, which is the accomplished activity.

original: tshig gi bdag ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes sku bya ba grub pa rang 'byung chos kyi dbyings te de rnams ro gcig pa'i rang bzhin ni 'jam dpal gyi rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: tshig gi bdag ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes sku bya ba grub pa rang 'byung chos kyi dbyings te de rnams ro gcig pa'i rang bzhin ni 'jam dpal gyi rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature of those being of one taste is the essence of Mañjuśrī.

original: de la me long lta bu'i ye shes la ci'i phyir ye shes kyi sku zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la me long lta bu'i ye shes la ci'i phyir ye shes kyi sku zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the mirror-like pristine consciousness called the jñānakāya?

original: sku ni rten byed pa ste ye shes des ye shes lnga'i rten byed pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sku ni rten byed pa ste ye shes des ye shes lnga'i rten byed pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The kāya is the support; since that pristine consciousness supports the five pristine consciousnesses, it is called that.

original: yang na me long lta bu ni gsal ba ste /
analyzed: yang na me long lta bu ni gsal ba ste /
translated: Alternatively, the mirror-like pristine consciousness is clarity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i rten byed pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i rten byed pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since it supports the arising of the reflection of the buddha’s kāya, it is called that.

original: de bzhin du rgol tshig sbyar /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgol tshig sbyar /
translated: Likewise, apply the argument.

original: gtsug tor chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor te rin chen 'byung ldan rigs lnga'i dbu rgyan du byung pas de skad bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor te rin chen 'byung ldan rigs lnga'i dbu rgyan du byung pas de skad bya'o //
translated: The great uṣṇīṣa is the uṣṇīṣa of the Tathāgata, which is called that because it appears as the crown of the five families of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: tshig gi bdag ni so sor kun rtog gi gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du chos can so so la chos nyid so sor mkhyen pas de brjod pa'i tshig 'byung bas de'i bdag go //🔽yang na so sor kun rtog la shes bya ji snyed pa snang ste rtogs pas de brjod pa 'byung /
analyzed: tshig gi bdag ni so sor kun rtog gi gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du chos can so so la chos nyid so sor mkhyen pas de brjod pa'i tshig 'byung bas de'i bdag go // yang na so sor kun rtog la shes bya ji snyed pa snang ste rtogs pas de brjod pa 'byung /
translated: The lord of speech is the individual knowledge of the individual dharmatās of all phenomena from the form of individual knowledge up to omniscience, and since the speech expressing that arises, it is the lord of that.

original: des na so sor rtog pa de la tshig gi bdag ces bya'o //
analyzed: des na so sor rtog pa de la tshig gi bdag ces bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, in individual knowledge, all objects of knowledge appear and are realized, and since the expression of that arises, that individual knowledge is called the lord of speech.

original: ye shes sku ni bya ba grub pa des gzhan don byed pas sku'i las yin pas ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes sku ni bya ba grub pa des gzhan don byed pas sku'i las yin pas ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The jñānakāya is the activity of the kāya that accomplishes the welfare of others through that, and since it is the activity of the kāya, it is called jñāna.

original: rang 'byung ni chos kyi dbyings su sangs rgyas tsam na nyon mongs 'khor ba'i chos thams cad bsnyil zhing por te 'bras bu rang 'byung bas de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rang 'byung ni chos kyi dbyings su sangs rgyas tsam na nyon mongs 'khor ba'i chos thams cad bsnyil zhing por te 'bras bu rang 'byung bas de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Self-arisen means that when one is enlightened in the dharmadhatu, all the phenomena of afflictions and samsara are destroyed and eliminated, and the result is self-arisen.

original: des ni 'jam dpal ngo shes so //
analyzed: des ni 'jam dpal ngo shes so //
translated: That is the recognition of Manjushri.

original: de la ye shes sems dpa' ci la bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ye shes sems dpa' ci la bya zhe na /
translated: What is the jnana being?🔽If it is asked what is the jnana being, in the ultimate truth, it is the nature or essence of the nonarising gnosis of the mind of all tathagatas.

original: don dam du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs skye ba med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid dam ngo bo la bya na kun rdzob tu dkyil 'khor bdun gyi gtso bo'i thugs ka nas ye shes sems dpa' bdun aa ra pa tsa la sogs pa'i mtshan
analyzed: don dam du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs skye ba med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid dam ngo bo la bya na kun rdzob tu dkyil 'khor bdun gyi gtso bo'i thugs ka nas ye shes sems dpa' bdun aa ra pa tsa la sogs pa'i mtshan
translated: In the relative truth, the seven jnana beings are the principal ones of the seven mandalas.

original: can sku mdog dang phyag mtshan gyis bsdus pa'i gzugs su bzhugs so //
analyzed: can sku mdog dang phyag mtshan gyis bsdus pa'i gzugs su bzhugs so //
translated: The name is Arapachana and so on.

original: gnas kyang don dang gnas kyi sgo nas de nyid do //
analyzed: gnas kyang don dang gnas kyi sgo nas de nyid do //
translated: The abode is also that in terms of the meaning and the abode.

original: mtshan ci la bya na rang gi ngo bo ni mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: mtshan ci la bya na rang gi ngo bo ni mtshan nyid med de /
translated: If it is asked what is the name, the essence is without characteristics.

original: kun rdzob sna tshogs su shar rgya che ba btsal na de nyid cir yang mi rnyed zab pa'i don dam de gnyis su med pa ni gnyis med gcig pa zhes bya ste rang gi ngo bo de la @72b dbye na zab pa dang rgya che ba ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob sna tshogs su shar rgya che ba btsal na de nyid cir yang mi rnyed zab pa'i don dam de gnyis su med pa ni gnyis med gcig pa zhes bya ste rang gi ngo bo de la @72b dbye na zab pa dang rgya che ba ste /
translated: If its essence is classified, it is profound and vast.

original: mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas par dbye na rigs bsdus pa la mtshan brgya brgyad cu rtsa drug la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas par dbye na rigs bsdus pa la mtshan brgya brgyad cu rtsa drug la sogs pa'o //
translated: If it is classified in brief and in detail, there are one hundred and eighty-six names that classify the buddha families, and so on.

original: don zab don ni rgya che zhing //
analyzed: don zab don ni rgya che zhing //
translated: The meaning is profound and vast.

original: zhes 'og nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes 'og nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: This will be explained below.

original: de gnyis la ci'i phyir zab pa dang rgya che zhe na /
analyzed: de gnyis la ci'i phyir zab pa dang rgya che zhe na /
translated: Why are those two profound and vast?

original: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni don chen mtshungs med ces te stong nyid de dang 'dra ba'am mtshungs pa med pa'i phyir zab /
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni don chen mtshungs med ces te stong nyid de dang 'dra ba'am mtshungs pa med pa'i phyir zab /
translated: The reason for using the term “profound” is “the great meaning is unequaled,” because emptiness is profound because it is unequaled or without anything similar to it.

original: de nyid kun rdzob tu dkyil 'khor bdun gyi lhar snang zhing dkyil 'khor bdun gyi gti mug can la sogs pa'i don byed cing de dang de'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug pas don chen byed de de'i phyir rgya che'o //
analyzed: de nyid kun rdzob tu dkyil 'khor bdun gyi lhar snang zhing dkyil 'khor bdun gyi gti mug can la sogs pa'i don byed cing de dang de'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug pas don chen byed de de'i phyir rgya che'o //
translated: It is vast because it performs great benefits, since it appears as the deities of the seven maṇḍalas in the relative, it performs benefits for the ignorant ones of the seven maṇḍalas, and it enters the maṇḍala of each.

original: mtshan gyi las ni rab zhi zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan gyi las ni rab zhi zhes pa ste /
translated: The function of the name is “peace.”

original: rgya che ba'i mtshan gyis sems can gyi nyon mongs ba zhi bar byed la zab pas shes bya zhi bar byed /
analyzed: rgya che ba'i mtshan gyis sems can gyi nyon mongs ba zhi bar byed la zab pas shes bya zhi bar byed /
translated: Since the name is vast, it pacifies the afflictions of sentient beings, and since it is profound, it pacifies the object of knowledge.

original: mchog ci la bya zhe na /
analyzed: mchog ci la bya zhe na /
translated: What is supreme?

original: 'og nas thog ma bar dang zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'og nas thog ma bar dang zhes pa ste /
translated: It is said below, “first, middle, and last.”

original: thog mar thos pas spro /
analyzed: thog mar thos pas spro /
translated: First, one is inspired by hearing.

original: bar du bsams pas dga'/
analyzed: bar du bsams pas dga'/
translated: In the middle, one is delighted by thinking.

original: tha mar bsgoms pas shin tu sbyangs pa thob /
analyzed: tha mar bsgoms pas shin tu sbyangs pa thob /
translated: In the end, one obtains pliancy through meditation.

original: des na mchog go //
analyzed: des na mchog go //
translated: Therefore, it is supreme.

original: yang dag brjod pa ci la zer zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag brjod pa ci la zer zhe na /
translated: What is the perfect expression?

original: 'das pa la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ste mar me mdzad la sogs pas gsungs /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ste mar me mdzad la sogs pas gsungs /
translated: It is said below, “Dīpaṃkara and so on,” which means that it was taught by Dīpaṃkara and so on.

original: byams pa la sogs pa gsung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa gsung bar 'gyur /
translated: It is said that it will be taught by Maitreya and so on.

original: da ltar sh'akya thub gsung de ltar rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad de /
analyzed: da ltar sh'akya thub gsung de ltar rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad de /
translated: The speech of Shakyamuni is always like that, without interruption.

original: bde ba can dang padma can gyi sangs rgyas rnams 'don ba gcig btang snyoms pa'i rtog pa med pa de rang bzhin gyis zab mo'i don brjod /
analyzed: bde ba can dang padma can gyi sangs rgyas rnams 'don ba gcig btang snyoms pa'i rtog pa med pa de rang bzhin gyis zab mo'i don brjod /
translated: The buddhas of Sukhavati and Padmanarteshvara do not have the concept of equanimity, and they naturally express the meaning of the profound.

original: man ngag tu rdo rje 'chang rnams rdo rje'i mgur du rtag tu bzhes so //
analyzed: man ngag tu rdo rje 'chang rnams rdo rje'i mgur du rtag tu bzhes so //
translated: In the pith instructions, the Vajradharas always sing vajra songs.

original: gsungs ngo snyam pa'i rtog pa mi mnga' yang chos kyi dbyings rtag tu rang sgra thal le 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gsungs ngo snyam pa'i rtog pa mi mnga' yang chos kyi dbyings rtag tu rang sgra thal le 'byung ngo //
translated: They do not have the concept of thinking, “I will teach,” but the sound of the natural expression of the dharmadhatu always arises.

original: des na yang dag par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: des na yang dag par brjod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the perfect expression.

original: rgyud chen zhes pa 'jam dpal rtsa ba'i rgyud sgyu 'phrul dra ba shlo ka drug stong par /
analyzed: rgyud chen zhes pa 'jam dpal rtsa ba'i rgyud sgyu 'phrul dra ba shlo ka drug stong par /
translated: The great tantra is the root tantra of Manjushri, the Magical Net, in six thousand shlokas.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po gsang sngags kyi don gyi rtogs pa 'chang ba dpag tu med pa rnams kyi rtogs pa'i don la dga' bzhin du rdo rje'i glu blangs pa'i don gang lags pa bshad du gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po gsang sngags kyi don gyi rtogs pa 'chang ba dpag tu med pa rnams kyi rtogs pa'i don la dga' bzhin du rdo rje'i glu blangs pa'i don gang lags pa bshad du gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the request is: Please explain the meaning of the vajra song that was joyfully sung by the holders of the realization of the meaning of secret mantra, the countless great Vajradharas.

original: mgon po zhes pa ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas 'gro ba'i mgon du gyur pa bskal ba zang gi sangs rgyas stong du gnyis kyis ma tshang ba kun gyi ste /
analyzed: mgon po zhes pa ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas 'gro ba'i mgon du gyur pa bskal ba zang gi sangs rgyas stong du gnyis kyis ma tshang ba kun gyi ste /
translated: The lord is the protector of beings, the buddhas of the three times, the buddhas of the Fortunate Eon, less two.

original: @73a * // rgyal po yul 'khor skyong gi bu stong las che dag phyag na rdo rje'o //

analyzed: ji ltar 'tsham pa bzhin du sems can rnams la bshad par 'tshal lo zhes gnod sbyin gsang ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes grogs dang bcas pas bcom ldan 'das la de skad ces gsol nas /
translated: The Lord of Secrets, the yakṣa Vajrapāṇi, together with his companions, having made this request to the Blessed One,

original: lus btud thal mo sbyar te gus pa'i tshul gyis mdun na gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: lus btud thal mo sbyar te gus pa'i tshul gyis mdun na gnas par gyur to //
translated: bowed his body, joined his palms, and respectfully remained in front of him.

original: de ni zhus pa'i rim pa rnam par phye ba ste le'u dang po rdzogs so /
analyzed: de ni zhus pa'i rim pa rnam par phye ba ste le'u dang po rdzogs so /
translated: This is the first chapter, which analyzes the sequence of requests.

original: // / de nas zhes pa snga ma bzhin du phyag na rdo rje'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: // / de nas zhes pa snga ma bzhin du phyag na rdo rje'i tshig yin te /

analyzed: 'di'i sdud pa po ni phyag na rdo rje yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'o na sdug pa po'i tshig yin pas don med dam snyam pa las don med pa ma yin te /
translated: If one thinks, But since it is the words of the compiler, is it not meaningless? it is not meaningless.

original: gsol ba btab pa'i rjes de ma thag kho nar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang dbang la slar gsungs pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: gsol ba btab pa'i rjes de ma thag kho nar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang dbang la slar gsungs pa dang 'brel to //
translated: It is connected to the Blessed One's reply to the Lord of Secrets immediately after the request.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of Bhagavān and perfect buddha has already been explained.

original: sh'akya thub ces pa rgyal po sh'akya'i rigs kyi kha thub pa'am lus ngang yig gsum gyi sgo thub pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sh'akya thub ces pa rgyal po sh'akya'i rigs kyi kha thub pa'am lus ngang yig gsum gyi sgo thub pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Śākyamuni means “the sage of the Śākya clan,” or “the one who is able to tame the three doors of body, speech, and mind.”🔽Two-legged means that among gods and humans, he is supreme.

original: rkang gnyis zhes pa lha dang mi de gnyis kyi nang na mchog / de lta bu'i mchog ston pa des /
analyzed: rkang gnyis zhes pa lha dang mi de gnyis kyi nang na mchog / de lta bu'i mchog ston pa des /
translated: Such a supreme teacher

original: gsang dbang la ni slar gsungs so //
analyzed: gsang dbang la ni slar gsungs so //
translated: again spoke to the one empowered by the secret.

original: zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: This is connected to the above.

original: des ni gsung mkhan ngo shes so //
analyzed: des ni gsung mkhan ngo shes so //
translated: This recognizes the speaker.

original: skabs kha cig tu ni gzhan gyi lce byin gyis brlabs nas chos bshad du bcug pa @73b yang yod pa las 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi zhal nas slar gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: skabs kha cig tu ni gzhan gyi lce byin gyis brlabs nas chos bshad du bcug pa @73b yang yod pa las 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi zhal nas slar gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: In some contexts, he empowers the tongues of others and makes them explain the Dharma. Here, the Bhagavān himself again spoke from his own mouth.

original: ljags bzang ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo gsum la sogs pa dam pa'i chos thams cad kyi 'byung ba'i gnas ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ljags te /
analyzed: ljags bzang ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo gsum la sogs pa dam pa'i chos thams cad kyi 'byung ba'i gnas ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ljags te /
translated: His tongue is excellent because the Bhagavān’s tongue is the source of all the sacred Dharma, such as the three wheels of Dharma.

original: de yin pas de la ni ljags bzang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yin pas de la ni ljags bzang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “the good tongue.”

original: ring zhing zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ring zhing zhes pa ni /
translated: Long:

original: kha cig ni ljags ring zhing srab pas zhal gyi bzhin g-yogs nas zhes 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni ljags ring zhing srab pas zhal gyi bzhin g-yogs nas zhes 'dod de /
translated: Some assert that because the tongue is long and thin, it covers the face.

original: 'dir ni ring zhing rgya che bar yangs pa spros shing brkyang nas 'gro ba rnams sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i don mdzad do //
analyzed: 'dir ni ring zhing rgya che bar yangs pa spros shing brkyang nas 'gro ba rnams sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i don mdzad do //
translated: Here, it is asserted that it is long, vast, and wide, and that it is extended and stretched out, and that it acts for the sake of generating the mind of going and so on.

original: sa bla sa steng sa 'og gsum gyi 'jig rten snang bar byed cing nyon mongs dang / phung po dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu'i bdud bar du gcod par byed pa'i dgra rnams btul sems can log pa'i sdug bsngal sbyang pa la sogs pa dang ngan song gsum gyi sdug bsngal thams cad sbyong ba'i phyir gsol ba btab pa'i rjes de la chos bshad pas 'od zer dang bcas pa'i 'dzum🔽pa mdzad de /
analyzed: sa bla sa steng sa 'og gsum gyi 'jig rten snang bar byed cing nyon mongs dang / phung po dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu'i bdud bar du gcod par byed pa'i dgra rnams btul sems can log pa'i sdug bsngal sbyang pa la sogs pa dang ngan song gsum gyi sdug bsngal thams cad sbyong ba'i phyir gsol ba btab pa'i rjes de la chos bshad pas 'od zer dang bcas pa'i 'dzum🔽pa mdzad de /
translated: Having illuminated the worlds of the three realms above the earth, on the earth, and below the earth, having subdued the enemies that create obstacles, such as the afflictions, the aggregates, the Lord of Death, and the demon of the sons of gods, and so on, in order to purify the sufferings of sentient beings, and in order to purify all the sufferings of the three lower realms, the Buddha smiled with light rays, having been requested to teach the dharma.

original: de yang chos gsung pa'i snga rtags ni 'od zer bkye ba dang / ljags rkyong ba dang / 'dzum pa mdzad pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / de lta bu rnam pa mang du yod pa las 'di yang snga rtags su bstan pa ste /🔽'dis ni gsung tshul go ba'o //🔽tshangs pa'i gsung zhes pa bcom ldan 'das nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: de yang chos gsung pa'i snga rtags ni 'od zer bkye ba dang / ljags rkyong ba dang / 'dzum pa mdzad pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / de lta bu rnam pa mang du yod pa las 'di yang snga rtags su bstan pa ste / 'dis ni gsung tshul go ba'o // tshangs pa'i gsung zhes pa bcom ldan 'das nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: This is one of the signs, and it is taught that this indicates the manner of his speech.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas de skad bya ba'am yang na lha tshangs pa'i gsung ni snyan la sgro ba nyams dga' pa yin la de ni 'jig rten gsum du thos pas gsung che ba yang yin no //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas de skad bya ba'am yang na lha tshangs pa'i gsung ni snyan la sgro ba nyams dga' pa yin la de ni 'jig rten gsum du thos pas gsung che ba yang yin no //
translated: His speech is Brahma's speech, because the Lord has abandoned the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, or else because Brahma's speech is pleasant, melodious and delightful, and it is great speech because it is heard in the three worlds.

original: gsung gcig la don du ma byung pas gsung de yon tan che ba yang yin te /
analyzed: gsung gcig la don du ma byung pas gsung de yon tan che ba yang yin te /
translated: It is also great in terms of its qualities, because it is the source of many meanings in a single statement.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung yang snyan cing nyams su bde ba 'jig rten gsum dang drug na bzhugs pa lha'i bu'i gsung 'byung ba thams cad kyis thos pas gsung che ba yang yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung yang snyan cing nyams su bde ba 'jig rten gsum dang drug na bzhugs pa lha'i bu'i gsung 'byung ba thams cad kyis thos pas gsung che ba yang yin /
translated: Likewise, the speech of the Bhagavat is pleasant and easy to listen to. It is great speech because it is heard by all the gods of the three or six worlds.

original: gsung gis don du ma nus pas gsung de ni yon tan che ba yang yin /
analyzed: gsung gis don du ma nus pas gsung de ni yon tan che ba yang yin /
translated: That speech is also of great value because it is able to accomplish many purposes.

original: dper na mdo sde spring sangs rgyas kyi lo rgyus bzhin te bcom ldan 'das kyis nad pa cig gi sgo phug tu thad phri zhes pa'i spring pa gcig mdzad /
analyzed: dper na mdo sde spring sangs rgyas kyi lo rgyus bzhin te bcom ldan 'das kyis nad pa cig gi sgo phug tu thad phri zhes pa'i spring pa gcig mdzad /
translated: For example, it is like the Buddha's letter in the Sutra of the Letter. The Bhagavat wrote a letter to a sick person that said:

original: @74a * // nad pas /
analyzed: @74a * // nad pas /
