original: rin chen srog dang ma bral na //
analyzed: rin chen srog dang ma bral na //
translated: If I do not lose my precious life,

original: sgyu ma'i nor ni btsal kyang rnyed //🔽zer bar go //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i nor ni btsal kyang rnyed // zer bar go //
translated: I will search for illusory wealth and find it.

original: nad pa'i byan mos /
analyzed: nad pa'i byan mos /
translated: The sick person's nurse thought,

original: phyi ma gar 'gro cha med kyis //
analyzed: phyi ma gar 'gro cha med kyis //
translated: I do not know where I will go in the next life,

original: snga ma de la nan tan bskyed //
analyzed: snga ma de la nan tan bskyed //
translated: so I will strive in the practice of the former.

original: bya bar go / sman pas /
analyzed: bya bar go / sman pas /
translated: The doctor thought,

original: nor gyi sdong po snying rje yin //
analyzed: nor gyi sdong po snying rje yin //
translated: Compassion is the root of wealth.

original: snying rje ba dang ma bral mdzod //🔽zer bar go ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: snying rje ba dang ma bral mdzod //🔽zer bar go ba lta bu'o //
translated: Do not be separated from compassion.

original: des ni tshig gi khyad par go'o //
analyzed: des ni tshig gi khyad par go'o //
translated: This shows the difference in words.

original: lag na rdo rje ni gong du bshad do //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje ni gong du bshad do //
translated: Vajrapāṇi was explained above.

original: stobs ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mthu stobs gcig tu bsdus pa'i bdag nyid gnod sbyin gsang ba'i dbang phyug de la slar sangs rgyas kyi tshig 'og ma 'di rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: stobs ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mthu stobs gcig tu bsdus pa'i bdag nyid gnod sbyin gsang ba'i dbang phyug de la slar sangs rgyas kyi tshig 'og ma 'di rnams gsungs te /
translated: Strength is the essence of the combined power of all buddhas.

original: 'dis ni gsung go ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni gsung go ba'o //
translated: This shows the meaning of speech.🔽What is the essence of the speech that is to be spoken?

original: gsung rgyu don gyi ngo bo gang gsungs snyam pa la 'jam dpal ye shes kyi rgyu dang 'brel zhing mtshan nas brjod pas don che ba gcig khyod la legs par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gsung rgyu don gyi ngo bo gang gsungs snyam pa la 'jam dpal ye shes kyi rgyu dang 'brel zhing mtshan nas brjod pas don che ba gcig khyod la legs par bstan par bya'o //
translated: It is the great meaning that is related to the cause and result of Mañjuśrījñānasattva.

original: khyod snod skyon med pa'i sgo nas sems rtse gcig pas nyon cig ces rna ba gtad par bskul ba ste /
analyzed: khyod snod skyon med pa'i sgo nas sems rtse gcig pas nyon cig ces rna ba gtad par bskul ba ste /
translated: Listen with one-pointed mind through a faultless vessel.

original: snying rje zhes pa thabs thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas 'gro ba rnams la phan pa'i don du khyod la 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: snying rje zhes pa thabs thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas 'gro ba rnams la phan pa'i don du khyod la 'dri ba ste /
translated: Compassion means that because of possessing the method of great compassion, you are asked for the benefit of migrating beings.

original: kye dpal ldan rdo rje 'chad khyod legs so //
analyzed: kye dpal ldan rdo rje 'chad khyod legs so //
translated: Oh, glorious Vajra Teacher, you are excellent.

original: kye lag na rdo rje 'chang khyod legs so zhes legs pa gnyis byin te /
analyzed: kye lag na rdo rje 'chang khyod legs so zhes legs pa gnyis byin te /
translated: O Vajrapani, you are excellent-he gave him two kinds of excellence.

original: de la legs pa gong ma ni gzhan don gyi legs pa 'og ma rang don no //
analyzed: de la legs pa gong ma ni gzhan don gyi legs pa 'og ma rang don no //
translated: The higher excellence is for the sake of others, the lower for one's own sake.

original: de yang ci'i phyir legs na /🔽ye shes lus can 'jam dpal gyi //
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir legs na / ye shes lus can 'jam dpal gyi //
translated: Why is it excellent?🔽The body of wisdom is Manjushri

original: zhes 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i sku dang 'brel pa yin /
analyzed: zhes 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i sku dang 'brel pa yin /

original: mtshan brjod pa ni nga la nyan par brtson pa ni khyod legs so //
analyzed: mtshan brjod pa ni nga la nyan par brtson pa ni khyod legs so //
translated: The recitation of the name is those who strive to listen to me are excellent.

original: gsang ba'i bdag po legs pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir khyod la nges legs par phye ste bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po legs pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir khyod la nges legs par phye ste bstan par bya'o //
translated: O Lord of Secrets, for that reason, I will teach you the excellent definitive meaning.

original: khyod snod zhabs rdol dang / kha sbub dang mi gtsang ba'i skyon de gsum med par gyis la sems rtse gcig gis ma yengs par nyon cig ce'o //
analyzed: khyod snod zhabs rdol dang / kha sbub dang mi gtsang ba'i skyon de gsum med par gyis la sems rtse gcig gis ma yengs par nyon cig ce'o //
translated: You should be a vessel without the three faults of a leaky bottom, an upside-down vessel, and an unclean vessel, and listen with a one-pointed mind without distraction.

original: 'o na bstan rgyu chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bstan rgyu chos gang zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the Dharma to be taught?

original: don che ba zhes pa ste /
analyzed: don che ba zhes pa ste /
translated: It is of great meaning.

original: ci'i phyir don che zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir don che zhe na /
translated: Why is it of great meaning?

original: dag par byed cing sdig sel ba ste /
analyzed: dag par byed cing sdig sel ba ste /
translated: It purifies and removes misdeeds.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni lha'i dkyil 'khor du bsgoms pas rgya che ba'i sgo nas dag par byed la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni lha'i dkyil 'khor du bsgoms pas rgya che ba'i sgo nas dag par byed la /
translated: The afflictive obstructions are purified by the extensive side of meditation on the deity mandala.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa ni zab pas sel to //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa ni zab pas sel to //
translated: The obstructions to omniscience are removed by the profound.

original: yang na ye shes phun sum tshogs @74b pas nyon mongs pa'i sdig pa sel to //
analyzed: yang na ye shes phun sum tshogs @74b pas nyon mongs pa'i sdig pa sel to //
translated: Or, the afflictive obstructions are removed by the perfection of pristine awareness.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni bos pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni bos pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One is the one who is addressed.

original: de ltar ston pa ni legs so //
analyzed: de ltar ston pa ni legs so //
translated: The teacher is excellent in that way.

original: de ltar bgyi lags so zhes khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bgyi lags so zhes khas blangs pa'o //
translated: I will do it that way is the promise.

original: slar gsungs pa'i le'u ste gnyis ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: slar gsungs pa'i le'u ste gnyis ba rdzogs so /
translated: The second chapter of the explanation is complete.

original: // / de nas zhes pa de ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: // / de nas zhes pa de ma thag pa ste /
translated: Then is immediately after.

original: slar gsungs pa'i rjes de ma thag kho nar bya ba gzhan gyis par mchod par rigs drug la gzigs shing bzhugs so zhe'o //
analyzed: slar gsungs pa'i rjes de ma thag kho nar bya ba gzhan gyis par mchod par rigs drug la gzigs shing bzhugs so zhe'o //
translated: Immediately after the explanation, the Blessed One, looking at the six classes of beings, remained in the state of worship.

original: de yang gang gis gzigs pa la bcom ldan 'das rkang gnyis kyi mchog tu gyur pa lha dang mi'i ston pa sha'kya thub pas gzigs so //
analyzed: de yang gang gis gzigs pa la bcom ldan 'das rkang gnyis kyi mchog tu gyur pa lha dang mi'i ston pa sha'kya thub pas gzigs so //
translated: Moreover, by whom is it seen? The Blessed One, the best of two-legged beings, the teacher of gods and humans, Shakyamuni, saw it.

original: de la rigs drug po gang snyam pa la slob dpon sgeg pa'i rdo rje'i 'grel pa'am man ngag gi dbang du byas te ming 'dogs na rigs bsdus dang / las kyi rigs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang / padma'i rigs dang / rdo rje'i rigs dang /
analyzed: de la rigs drug po gang snyam pa la slob dpon sgeg pa'i rdo rje'i 'grel pa'am man ngag gi dbang du byas te ming 'dogs na rigs bsdus dang / las kyi rigs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang / padma'i rigs dang / rdo rje'i rigs dang /
translated: If we were to name them according to the commentary or esoteric instructions of Master Lalitavajra, they would be the condensed family, the karma family, the tathāgata family, the lotus family, the vajra family,

original: byang sems rdo rje'i rigs dang rin po che'i rigs dang drug go //
analyzed: byang sems rdo rje'i rigs dang rin po che'i rigs dang drug go //
translated: and the bodhisattva vajra family and jewel family.

original: mdo'i rang gzhung gis /
analyzed: mdo'i rang gzhung gis /
translated: The sūtra’s own text says:

original: gsang sngags rigs chen thams cad dang // gsang sngags rig sngags 'chang ba'i rigs //
analyzed: gsang sngags rigs chen thams cad dang // gsang sngags rig sngags 'chang ba'i rigs //
translated: The great family of secret mantra, the family of the holders of secret mantra and awareness mantra,

original: rigs gsum gyi sngags dang / 'jig rten gzigs pa'i rigs dang / 'jig rten snang byed kyi rigs dang / phyag rgya chen po'i rigs mchog gi dang / rigs chen gtsug tor gyis gzigs te gong ma rnams la rim pa bzhin ming gdags so //
analyzed: rigs gsum gyi sngags dang / 'jig rten gzigs pa'i rigs dang / 'jig rten snang byed kyi rigs dang / phyag rgya chen po'i rigs mchog gi dang / rigs chen gtsug tor gyis gzigs te gong ma rnams la rim pa bzhin ming gdags so //
translated: the mantra of the three families, the family that sees the world, the family that illuminates the world, the supreme family of the great seal, and the great family that sees the uṣṇīṣa.

original: de la rigs bsdus pa ci'i phyir gsang sngags rigs chen bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la rigs bsdus pa ci'i phyir gsang sngags rigs chen bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the condensed family called the great family of secret mantra?

original: gsang sngags zhes pa ni mantra zhes pa'i sgra mantra ni yantra tra sa na skyob pa ste nyon mongs pa can gyi yid skyob pa'am /
analyzed: gsang sngags zhes pa ni mantra zhes pa'i sgra mantra ni yantra tra sa na skyob pa ste nyon mongs pa can gyi yid skyob pa'am /
translated: The term “mantra” is a transliteration of the Sanskrit word mantra, which means “protection” (trāṇa) because it protects the afflicted mind.

original: m'a na zhes pa ste shes bya la rigs bsdus pa rnam snang chen po des nyon mongs pa spyir skyob pas gsang sngags kyi rigs so //🔽chen po ni thams cad kyis bsgrubs te /
analyzed: m'a na zhes pa ste shes bya la rigs bsdus pa rnam snang chen po des nyon mongs pa spyir skyob pas gsang sngags kyi rigs so // chen po ni thams cad kyis bsgrubs te /
translated: Or it means “mind” (manas), and since the great Vairocana is the collection of the types of objects of knowledge, he protects the afflictions in general.🔽“Great” means that all the others are included in it.

original: rigs thams cad bsdus pas na chen po'o //
analyzed: rigs thams cad bsdus pas na chen po'o //
translated: Since all the types are included in it, it is “great.”

original: de la cher gzigs nas ;
analyzed: de la cher gzigs nas ;
translated: Having seen that,

original: tshig gi bdag pos tshigs su bcad de /
analyzed: tshig gi bdag pos tshigs su bcad de /
translated: the Lord of Speech spoke in verse.

original: rigs bsdus kyi mtshan 'di ltar sangs rgyas la sogs pa brgyad cu rtsa drug gi tshig bcad bcu bzhi pa la 'og nas gsungs so zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: rigs bsdus kyi mtshan 'di ltar sangs rgyas la sogs pa brgyad cu rtsa drug gi tshig bcad bcu bzhi pa la 'og nas gsungs so zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: This name of the collection of types is connected with the fourteen verses of the eighty-six buddhas and so forth that will be taught below.

original: gsang sngags rig sngags 'chang ba'i rigs //
analyzed: gsang sngags rig sngags 'chang ba'i rigs //
translated: The type of the holders of mantra and knowledge mantras.

original: zhes pa ci'i phyir las kyi @75a * //🔽rigs la de skad bya zhe na /
analyzed: zhes pa ci'i phyir las kyi @75a * // rigs la de skad bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the karma family called that?

original: las kyi rigs khyad par du byas pa ste /
analyzed: las kyi rigs khyad par du byas pa ste /
translated: It is distinguished as the karma family.

original: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes ni khyad par gzhan don byed pas de la yid skyob ces bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes ni khyad par gzhan don byed pas de la yid skyob ces bya'o //
translated: The gnosis of successful activities is called the protection of the mind because it performs special activities for the benefit of others.

original: 'o na ye shes gzhan gyis gzhan don mi byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ye shes gzhan gyis gzhan don mi byed dam zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “Do the other gnoses not perform activities for the benefit of others?”

original: byed de yon tan phyogs re 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: byed de yon tan phyogs re 'dogs pa'o //
translated: They do, but they are only partial qualities.

original: rig sngags zhes pa gzungs la bya ste /
analyzed: rig sngags zhes pa gzungs la bya ste /
translated: The term “vidya-mantra” refers to the dharanis.

original: tshig dang don dang sngags phyag rgya'i gzungs rnams zhes 'dzin pa'am 'chang ba ste /
analyzed: tshig dang don dang sngags phyag rgya'i gzungs rnams zhes 'dzin pa'am 'chang ba ste /
translated: They are the dharanis of words, meanings, mantras, and seals.

original: 'di gzungs kyi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di gzungs kyi rigs so //
translated: This is the family of the dharanis.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'byung bas sam 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung bas sam 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Because they are the source or because they hold.

original: don grub gtso bor gyur pa'i tshe 'di'i skyabs sbyin gyi phyag na rgya gram bsnams pa byin 'khor rnams kyang rgya gram bsnams pa ste /
analyzed: don grub gtso bor gyur pa'i tshe 'di'i skyabs sbyin gyi phyag na rgya gram bsnams pa byin 'khor rnams kyang rgya gram bsnams pa ste /
translated: When Amoghasiddhi is the principal one, he holds a swastika in his hand, which grants protection in this life, and the members of his retinue also hold swastikas.

original: de ni de'i rigs 'dzin pa'i 'byung ba yang rgya gram gnyis su gyur pa las des na kun des bskyed pas 'byung bas rigs so //
analyzed: de ni de'i rigs 'dzin pa'i 'byung ba yang rgya gram gnyis su gyur pa las des na kun des bskyed pas 'byung bas rigs so //
translated: That is the source of the family that holds that family, and because it is generated by that, it is a family because it is a source.

original: rigs de la cher gzigs nas tshigs su bcad de /
analyzed: rigs de la cher gzigs nas tshigs su bcad de /
translated: Having seen that family as great, he spoke in verse.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis rtogs bya pa ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis rtogs bya pa ;
translated: The object of realization of all buddhas.

original: / zhes pa nas mar tshigs bcad bco lnga 'og nas gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: / zhes pa nas mar tshigs bcad bco lnga 'og nas gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: The remaining fifteen verses are stated below.

original: des bsgres te rigs dang tshigs bcad kun la sbyar ro //
analyzed: des bsgres te rigs dang tshigs bcad kun la sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to all the families and verses by analogy.

original: rigs gsum zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la bya ste /
analyzed: rigs gsum zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la bya ste /
translated: The three families are the tathāgata family.

original: ci'i phyir rigs gsum zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rigs gsum zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called the three families?

original: sku gsungs thugs gsum 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku gsungs thugs gsum 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the nature of the union of the three: body, speech, and mind.

original: de la gzigs nas /
analyzed: de la gzigs nas /
translated: With regard to that, it is said:

original: sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad che //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad che //
translated: The buddha is the great Vairocana.

original: zhes pa nas mar tshig rkang gcig ma tshang pa'i tshigs bcad nyi shu rtsa lnga gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa nas mar tshig rkang gcig ma tshang pa'i tshigs bcad nyi shu rtsa lnga gsungs so //
translated: The remaining twenty-four verses, one line short, are stated below.

original: 'jig rten gzigs pa zhes pa padmas khyad par du byas pa'i rigs te padma'i rigs la 'jig rten gzigs pa zhes ci'i phyir bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzigs pa zhes pa padmas khyad par du byas pa'i rigs te padma'i rigs la 'jig rten gzigs pa zhes ci'i phyir bya zhe na /
translated: The lotus-distinguished family is called the “family that sees the world.” Why is the lotus family called the “family that sees the world”?

original: thugs rjes 'jig rten la gzigs /
analyzed: thugs rjes 'jig rten la gzigs /
translated: It sees the world with compassion.

original: ye shes kyis 'das pa la gzigs te /
analyzed: ye shes kyis 'das pa la gzigs te /
translated: It sees the transcendent with wisdom.

original: spyan de gnyis kyis rtag tu gzigs pas 'di ni spyan ras gzigs kyi rigs la bya'o //
analyzed: spyan de gnyis kyis rtag tu gzigs pas 'di ni spyan ras gzigs kyi rigs la bya'o //
translated: Since those two eyes always see, this is called the family of Avalokitesvara.

original: rigs ni 'byung ba dang 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: rigs ni 'byung ba dang 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Family means origin and holder.

original: de la gzigs nas /
analyzed: de la gzigs nas /
translated: Having seen that,

original: yang dag bdag med ces pa nas mar tshigs bcad zhe gnyis gsungs zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: yang dag bdag med ces pa nas mar tshigs bcad zhe gnyis gsungs zhes 'brel to //
translated: the forty-two verses beginning with “the perfect absence of self” are spoken.

original: 'jig rten snang byed ces pa rdo rje'i rigs me long lta bu'i ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten snang byed ces pa rdo rje'i rigs me long lta bu'i ye shes la bya ste /
translated: Illuminator of the World is the vajra family, the mirrorlike gnosis.

original: ci'i phyir de skad bya na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de skad bya na /
translated: Why is it called that?

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes de la chos thams cad kyi @75b gzugs brnyan 'char zhing snang bar byed la /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes de la chos thams cad kyi @75b gzugs brnyan 'char zhing snang bar byed la /
translated: In that mirrorlike gnosis, the reflections of all phenomena arise and are illuminated.

original: snang yang snang ngo snyam pa'i rtog pa med /
analyzed: snang yang snang ngo snyam pa'i rtog pa med /
translated: Even though they appear, there is no thought that thinks, “They appear.”

original: med kyang snang ba rgyun mi 'chad pas de la de skad bya /
analyzed: med kyang snang ba rgyun mi 'chad pas de la de skad bya /
translated: Even though they do not exist, the appearance is uninterrupted. Therefore it is called that.

original: rigs ni 'dzin pa dang / 'byung ba chen po ni sku dang gsung la ltos nas chen po ste thugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs ni 'dzin pa dang / 'byung ba chen po ni sku dang gsung la ltos nas chen po ste thugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The family is the holder, and the great elements are great in relation to the body and speech, because they are the mind.

original: de la gzigs nas rdo rje 'jigs byed nas mar tshig rkang gcig lhag pa'i tshigs bcad bcu gsungs pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de la gzigs nas rdo rje 'jigs byed nas mar tshig rkang gcig lhag pa'i tshigs bcad bcu gsungs pa dang 'brel to //
translated: In response to that, he spoke ten verses, ending with one line, beginning with “vajra-Bhairava.”

original: phyag rgya chen po ni byang sems rdo rje'i rigs la bya ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ni byang sems rdo rje'i rigs la bya ste /
translated: The great seal is the bodhisattva vajra family.

original: ci'i phyir de skad bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de skad bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called that?

original: phyag rgya ni 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya ni 'debs pa ste /
translated: A seal is something that is impressed.

original: byang chub kyi sems stong pa'i rnag bzhin des gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar 'das pa la rgyas btab ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems stong pa'i rnag bzhin des gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar 'das pa la rgyas btab ste /
translated: The bodhicitta of the nature of emptiness seals form, feeling, and so on up to omniscience.

original: thams cad kyang rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because all of them are empty of their own entity.

original: chen po ni khyab byed ces pa ste des ma khyab pa med do //
analyzed: chen po ni khyab byed ces pa ste des ma khyab pa med do //
translated: Great is the pervader, and there is nothing that is not pervaded by it.

original: rigs ni byang sems rdo rje de gtso bor gyur pa'i tshe rigs bsdus kyi lha rnams de'i thugs ka nas sbrul pa 'byung ba'i don gyi'am de'i cha 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: rigs ni byang sems rdo rje de gtso bor gyur pa'i tshe rigs bsdus kyi lha rnams de'i thugs ka nas sbrul pa 'byung ba'i don gyi'am de'i cha 'dzin pas so //
translated: Family means that when the bodhisattva vajra is the principal deity, the deities of the family are emanated from his heart. It is so called because they hold his attributes.

original: mchog ni byang sems stong pa dang skye med kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: mchog ni byang sems stong pa dang skye med kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: The supreme is the essence of emptiness and non-arising of the bodhicitta.

original: de la gzigs nas rigs bsdus kyi mtshan tsho yang gsungs so zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de la gzigs nas rigs bsdus kyi mtshan tsho yang gsungs so zhes 'brel to //
translated: Having seen that, the names of the families are also taught.

original: rigs chen zhes pa 'di'i rigs ni rin chen rigs sangs rgyas ni rin chen 'byung ba /
analyzed: rigs chen zhes pa 'di'i rigs ni rin chen rigs sangs rgyas ni rin chen 'byung ba /
translated: Here, the family is the jewel family, the buddha is Ratnasambhava,

original: ye shes ni mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: ye shes ni mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: and the gnosis is equanimity.

original: de ci'i phyir rin chen gtsug tor zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir rin chen gtsug tor zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the jewel crest?

original: 'di ni yon tan gyi rigs kyis khyad par du byas pas rigs chen no //
analyzed: 'di ni yon tan gyi rigs kyis khyad par du byas pas rigs chen no //
translated: Since it is distinguished by the family of qualities, it is the great family.

original: 'di nyid rin po che'i gtsug tor gyi dbu rgyan du thams cad kyi dbu la byung bas gtsug tor chen po'i rigs zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid rin po che'i gtsug tor gyi dbu rgyan du thams cad kyi dbu la byung bas gtsug tor chen po'i rigs zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: Since this very [family] appears on the head of all as a crown ornament of the jewel crest, it is also called the great crest family.

original: yang na rigs ni rin chen 'byung ldan gtso bor gyur pa'i tshe 'khor gyi lha lnga bcu rtsa gnyis rin po cher gyur pa las byung bas na rigs so //
analyzed: yang na rigs ni rin chen 'byung ldan gtso bor gyur pa'i tshe 'khor gyi lha lnga bcu rtsa gnyis rin po cher gyur pa las byung bas na rigs so //
translated: Alternatively, when Ratnasambhava is the principal one, the family is the one that arises from the fifty-two retinue deities becoming jewels.

original: phyag mtshan yang de nyi tshe 'dzin pas de nyid kyi rigs so //
analyzed: phyag mtshan yang de nyi tshe 'dzin pas de nyid kyi rigs so //
translated: Since the hand implements also hold just those, they are the family of just those.

original: de la sangs rgyas sh'akya thub kyis cher gzigs nas /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas sh'akya thub kyis cher gzigs nas /
translated: The Buddha Shakyamuni saw this and

original: tshig gi bdag po des tshigs su bcad de rin chen rigs kyi mtshan //
analyzed: tshig gi bdag po des tshigs su bcad de rin chen rigs kyi mtshan //
translated: the Lord of Speech spoke these verses, the name of the jewel family,

original: 'dod pa'i don grub dam pa ste //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don grub dam pa ste //
translated: the supreme accomplishment of the desired goal,🔽and so forth, up to the thirty-four verses that are one verse short.

original: zhes pa nas mar tshig rkang gcig ma tshang ba'i tshigs bcad nyi // shu rtsa bzhi gsungs so zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes pa nas mar tshig rkang gcig ma tshang ba'i tshigs bcad nyi // shu rtsa bzhi gsungs so zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: This is the connection.

original: gzigs pa'i rim pa rnam par @76a * //🔽phye ba ste le'u gsum pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gzigs pa'i rim pa rnam par @76a * // phye ba ste le'u gsum pa rdzogs so /
translated: The stages of seeing are complete.

original: // / gong ma'i tshig zhabs kyi nas zhes pa ni tshigs bcad kyi dbang du song ba ste /
analyzed: // / gong ma'i tshig zhabs kyi nas zhes pa ni tshigs bcad kyi dbang du song ba ste /
translated: The word then in the above verse is from the perspective of the verse.

original: de nas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ste /
translated: Then🔽means immediately after the stages of seeing, without any other activity in between, the Blessed One Shakyamuni, the Lord of Speech, with perfect knowledge,

original: gzigs pa'i rim pa'i de ma thag kho nar bya ba gzhan gyis bar mchod par sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa man ngag gi rim pa 'di tshig gi bdag po ni so sor yang dag par rig pas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas
analyzed: gzigs pa'i rim pa'i de ma thag kho nar bya ba gzhan gyis bar mchod par sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa man ngag gi rim pa 'di tshig gi bdag po ni so sor yang dag par rig pas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas
translated: taught this stage of esoteric instruction, the manifest perfect enlightenment by the net of illusion.

original: tsheg bar bdun par tshigs su bcad de gsungs zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: tsheg bar bdun par tshigs su bcad de gsungs zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: The verse is connected with the statement that the six awareness beings’ mantras and the twelve ālikāli are taught in the seventh chapter.

original: gsang sngags rgyal po badzra t'ikshna nas aa ra pa tsa la sogs kyi bar du ye shes sems dpa'i sngags drug dang a'a li bcu gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal po badzra t'ikshna nas aa ra pa tsa la sogs kyi bar du ye shes sems dpa'i sngags drug dang a'a li bcu gnyis gsungs so //
translated: The king of mantras is the awareness being’s mantra from Vajra Tīkṣṇa up to Arapacana.

original: de la rgyal po ni ye shes sems dpa' rnams chos kyi sku'i ngo bo yin pas de'i sngags la ni rgyal po zhes bya /
analyzed: de la rgyal po ni ye shes sems dpa' rnams chos kyi sku'i ngo bo yin pas de'i sngags la ni rgyal po zhes bya /
translated: The king is the awareness being because he is the essence of the dharmakāya. His mantra is called the king.

original: drug ni badzra t'ikshna nas aa ra pa tsa na'i bar du'o //
analyzed: drug ni badzra t'ikshna nas aa ra pa tsa na'i bar du'o //
translated: The six are from Vajra Tīkṣṇa up to Arapacana.

original: gnyis su med par zhes pa gsang ba 'dus pa las ;
analyzed: gnyis su med par zhes pa gsang ba 'dus pa las ;
translated: Nondual means that in the Guhyasamāja Tantra it says:

original: gang zhig dngos med shes rab ste //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos med shes rab ste //
translated: Wisdom is the absence of entity.

original: thabs ni dngos po'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: thabs ni dngos po'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Method is the nature of entity.

original: zer bas sngags kyi lugs kyi thabs shes rab gnyis med du 'dod la pha rol phyin pa'i lugs kyi gzung 'dzin gnyis su 'dod de /
analyzed: zer bas sngags kyi lugs kyi thabs shes rab gnyis med du 'dod la pha rol phyin pa'i lugs kyi gzung 'dzin gnyis su 'dod de /
translated: Thus, in the mantra system, method and wisdom are asserted to be nondual, whereas in the perfection vehicle system, method and wisdom are asserted to be dual.

original: gzung ba'i rang bzhin tsam la rang bzhin ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste ;
analyzed: gzung ba'i rang bzhin tsam la rang bzhin ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste ;
translated: The nature of the object is empty of its own entity.

original: de ltar gzung ba stong par rtogs pas gzung ba ldog la gzung ba log pas 'dzin pa rang bzhin gyis ldog go //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba stong par rtogs pas gzung ba ldog la gzung ba log pas 'dzin pa rang bzhin gyis ldog go //
translated: Thus, by realizing that the object of apprehension is empty, the object of apprehension is reversed. By reversing the object of apprehension, the apprehender is naturally reversed.

original: 'dir yang gnyis med pas shes la rang rig rang stong pa nyid rang 'byung ngo zhes so //
analyzed: 'dir yang gnyis med pas shes la rang rig rang stong pa nyid rang 'byung ngo zhes so //
translated: Here, too, by nonduality, the self-knowing, self-empty wisdom arises by itself.

original: de gang la rang zhes bya ci rig na rang gi rang bzhin skye med du rig pas mi skye chos can 'di gsungs so zhes so //
analyzed: de gang la rang zhes bya ci rig na rang gi rang bzhin skye med du rig pas mi skye chos can 'di gsungs so zhes so //
translated: What is the self that is said to know itself? It is the unborn nature of mind.

original: aa a'a zhes pa la sogs pa ni rje btsun 'jam dpal te a'a li k'a li'i gzugs su snang nas kyang sems can gyi don byed /
analyzed: aa a'a zhes pa la sogs pa ni rje btsun 'jam dpal te a'a li k'a li'i gzugs su snang nas kyang sems can gyi don byed /
translated: The syllables a, ā, and so on are the venerable Mañjuśrī. Appearing in the form of ālikāli, he also acts for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de la a'a li bcu drug yod pa las 'dir bcu gnyis su 'byung ba ni sa bcu gnyis mtshon pa'i rtags su byung ba ste ;
analyzed: de la a'a li bcu drug yod pa las 'dir bcu gnyis su 'byung ba ni sa bcu gnyis mtshon pa'i rtags su byung ba ste ;
translated: There are sixteen ālikāli syllables. The twelve that appear here are the signs that indicate the twelve stages.

original: de yang slob dpon kha cig ni sa gnyis las so so skye bo'i mos ba spyod pa'i sas bsdus pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' slob pa'i sas bsdus pa'i sa bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa dang bcu gnyis su 'dod la slob dpon sgeg pa'i rdo rjes bzhed kyis sangs rgyas sa rang @76b la bcu gnyis su bzhed de /
analyzed: de yang slob dpon kha cig ni sa gnyis las so so skye bo'i mos ba spyod pa'i sas bsdus pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' slob pa'i sas bsdus pa'i sa bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa dang bcu gnyis su 'dod la slob dpon sgeg pa'i rdo rjes bzhed kyis sangs rgyas sa rang @76b la bcu gnyis su bzhed de /
translated: Master Lalitavajra asserts that there are twelve levels, including the level of buddhahood.

original: kun du 'od kyis dang / bdud rtsi'i 'od /
analyzed: kun du 'od kyis dang / bdud rtsi'i 'od /
translated: The twelve levels are the level of universal radiance,🔽the level of the radiance of nectar,

original: nam mkha'i 'od /
analyzed: nam mkha'i 'od /
translated: the level of the radiance of space,

original: rdo rje'i 'od /
analyzed: rdo rje'i 'od /
translated: the level of the radiance of the vajra,

original: rin po che'i 'od /
analyzed: rin po che'i 'od /
translated: the level of the radiance of the jewel,🔽the level of the radiance of the lotus,

original: padma'i 'od / las kyi 'od /🔽dpe med 'od /
analyzed: padma'i 'od / las kyi 'od / dpe med 'od /
translated: the level of the radiance of activity,

original: dpe ldan 'od /
analyzed: dpe ldan 'od /
translated: the level of the radiance of the unequaled,🔽the level of the radiance of the equaled,

original: shes rab 'od /
analyzed: shes rab 'od /
translated: the level of the radiance of wisdom,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'od /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'od /
translated: the level of the radiance of omniscience,

original: rnal 'byor ye shes kyi 'od kyi sa dang bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ye shes kyi 'od kyi sa dang bcu gnyis so //
translated: and the level of the radiance of the wisdom of yoga.

original: sa bcu gnyis po a'a li bcu gnyis po 'dis rim pa bzhin du mtshon to //
analyzed: sa bcu gnyis po a'a li bcu gnyis po 'dis rim pa bzhin du mtshon to //
translated: These twelve levels are respectively symbolized by the twelve vowels.

original: 'o na 'di rnams kho nas mtshon pa ci ste zer na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di rnams kho nas mtshon pa ci ste zer na /
translated: Why are they symbolized by these?

original: 'o na du bas me mtshon pa yang ci ste du ba me kho na las byung ba ste de las 'byung ba'i 'brel pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na du bas me mtshon pa yang ci ste du ba me kho na las byung ba ste de las 'byung ba'i 'brel pa yod do zhe na /
translated: Well, then, why is smoke an indicator of fire? Because smoke arises from fire. There is a relationship between them.

original: 'di rnams kyang mtshon bya mtshon byed kyi 'brel pa yod do //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang mtshon bya mtshon byed kyi 'brel pa yod do //
translated: Well, these [examples] also have a relationship of indicator and indicated.

original: 'o na de ltar shes na du ba yang de ltar ci shes /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar shes na du ba yang de ltar ci shes /
translated: Well, if one understands it in that way, why is smoke understood in that way?

original: tshang bang du khyab bya khyab byed du gtan la phab po zer na /
analyzed: tshang bang du khyab bya khyab byed du gtan la phab po zer na /
translated: Well, in a kitchen, the pervaded and the pervader are determined.

original: 'di rnams kyang lung gis gtan la phab ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang lung gis gtan la phab ste /
translated: Well, these [examples] are determined by scripture.

original: rdo rje snying po'i rgyan gyi rgyud las /
analyzed: rdo rje snying po'i rgyan gyi rgyud las /
translated: In the Vajra Essence Ornament Tantra,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa bcu gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa bcu gnyis gsungs te /
translated: the twelve buddha levels are taught.

original: kun du 'od kyi sa chen po de ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'dra /
analyzed: kun du 'od kyi sa chen po de ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'dra /
translated: That great level of universal light is like the orb of the sun.

original: bdud rtsi'i 'od zla ba 'dra /
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i 'od zla ba 'dra /
translated: The light of nectar is like the moon.

original: nam mkha'i 'od nam mkha' 'dra /
analyzed: nam mkha'i 'od nam mkha' 'dra /
translated: The light of space is like space.

original: rdo rje'i 'od yid dga' byed /
analyzed: rdo rje'i 'od yid dga' byed /
translated: The light of the vajra is delightful.

original: rin chen 'od dbang la gnas /
analyzed: rin chen 'od dbang la gnas /
translated: The light of the jewel abides in power.

original: padma'i 'od rang bzhin dag las kyi 'od gzhan don byed /
analyzed: padma'i 'od rang bzhin dag las kyi 'od gzhan don byed /
translated: The light of the lotus is pure by nature. The light of activity benefits others.

original: dpe med 'od dpe ni yod ma yin /
analyzed: dpe med 'od dpe ni yod ma yin /
translated: The light without example has no example.

original: dpe ldan kun rdzob tsam du dpe yis 'bigs /
analyzed: dpe ldan kun rdzob tsam du dpe yis 'bigs /
translated: The one endowed with examples is pierced by examples, merely relatively.

original: shes rab 'od bla na med /
analyzed: shes rab 'od bla na med /
translated: The light of wisdom is unsurpassed.

original: thams cad mkhyen ji snyed pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen ji snyed pa /
translated: The extent of omniscience.

original: rnal 'byor ye shes rab tu rdzogs /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ye shes rab tu rdzogs /
translated: The perfection of the wisdom of yoga.

original: so so rang rig go zhe'o //
analyzed: so so rang rig go zhe'o //
translated: It is said to be individually cognized by the self.

original: 'o na rgyud nas gsungs pa rang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyud nas gsungs pa rang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Well then, why is it taught in the tantras?

original: me las du ba 'ong ba rang ci'i phyir te /
analyzed: me las du ba 'ong ba rang ci'i phyir te /
translated: Why does smoke come from fire?

original: chos nyid kyis de ltar 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos nyid kyis de ltar 'byung ste /
translated: It arises like that by the nature of things.

original: de'i rigs pa las med do //
analyzed: de'i rigs pa las med do //
translated: There is no reasoning other than that.

original: 'o na sa de rnams la de skad ces ci'i phyir bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sa de rnams la de skad ces ci'i phyir bya zhe na /
translated: Well then, why are those stages called that?

original: nyi ma ni thams cad du snang zhing gsal /
analyzed: nyi ma ni thams cad du snang zhing gsal /
translated: The sun shines and illuminates everywhere.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang thams cad du snang zhing gsal ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang thams cad du snang zhing gsal ba ste /
translated: Likewise, the wisdom of omniscience shines and illuminates everywhere.

original: rdo rje nyi ma gsal ba che //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma gsal ba che //
translated: The vajra sun is greatly illuminating.

original: zer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it emits rays.

original: de'i phyir kun du 'od de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun du 'od de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the stage is called Universal Light.

original: de bzhin du yang zla ba ni dri ma med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang zla ba ni dri ma med pa ste /
translated: Likewise, the moon is stainless.

original: dag cing gsal la dri ma med //
analyzed: dag cing gsal la dri ma med //
translated: Pure, clear, and stainless.

original: ces 'byung bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la nyon mongs pa'i rtog pa'am dri ma med pa ste /🔽rdo rje zla ba dri med 'od //
analyzed: ces 'byung bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la nyon mongs pa'i rtog pa'am dri ma med pa ste / rdo rje zla ba dri med 'od //
translated: Thus, the gnosis of omniscience is without the concepts or stains of the afflictions.

original: ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽bdud rtsi'i @77a * //
analyzed: ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro // bdud rtsi'i @77a * //
translated: It is called the stainless light of the vajra.

original: 'od la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'od la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the light of nectar.

original: yang na nam mkha' ni thams cad du khyab cing rgya ma chad pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang rgya ma chad de /
analyzed: yang na nam mkha' ni thams cad du khyab cing rgya ma chad pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang rgya ma chad de /
translated: Or, just as space pervades everywhere and is not limited, likewise the gnosis of omniscience is not limited.

original: nam mkha' stong par go / stong pas sems go / sems kyis rang rig go / des na nam mkha'i 'od ces bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' stong par go / stong pas sems go / sems kyis rang rig go / des na nam mkha'i 'od ces bya'o //
translated: Space is understood as empty, emptiness as mind, and mind as self-awareness. Therefore, it is called the light of space.

original: yang na rdo rje ni bsam pa nang gi bstan pas /
analyzed: yang na rdo rje ni bsam pa nang gi bstan pas /
translated: Or, the vajra is explained as the inner teaching of intention.

original: rdo rje zhes su bshad pa ste //🔽zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rdo rje zhes su bshad pa ste // zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is explained as the vajra.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni nang gi sems bstan pas de dang dbyer mi phyed pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni nang gi sems bstan pas de dang dbyer mi phyed pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The gnosis of omniscience is inseparable from the inner teaching of the mind. Therefore, it is called that.

original: yang na rin po che ni mnyam pa nyid kyi sems nyid rin po che'i dbu rgyan du byung ste /
analyzed: yang na rin po che ni mnyam pa nyid kyi sems nyid rin po che'i dbu rgyan du byung ste /
translated: Alternatively, the jewel is the precious mind of equality, which arises as the crown ornament.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la dbang bskur ba'i rang bzhin du gnas pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la dbang bskur ba'i rang bzhin du gnas pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since it abides as the nature of the empowerment conferred on all buddhas, it is called that.

original: yang na padma ni 'dam nas skyes kyang des ma gos pa bzhin so sor rtog pa'i ye shes de yang 'khor ba'i 'dam gyis ma gos pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na padma ni 'dam nas skyes kyang des ma gos pa bzhin so sor rtog pa'i ye shes de yang 'khor ba'i 'dam gyis ma gos pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, just as a lotus is born from mud but is not sullied by it, likewise, that discerning wisdom is not sullied by the mud of samsara.

original: yang na las kyi 'od ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyis gzhan don byed pas las kyi 'od ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na las kyi 'od ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyis gzhan don byed pas las kyi 'od ces bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, the light of activity is the wisdom of accomplishing activities, which is called the light of activity because it benefits others.

original: dpe med 'od thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de la dpe med de /
analyzed: dpe med 'od thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de la dpe med de /
translated: Incomparable Light is the wisdom of omniscience, which is incomparable.

original: gal te dpe yod na 'dra ba'i dpe cig yod dam mi 'dra ba'i dpe cig yod /
analyzed: gal te dpe yod na 'dra ba'i dpe cig yod dam mi 'dra ba'i dpe cig yod /
translated: If there were a simile, would it be a simile of similarity or a simile of dissimilarity?

original: mi 'dra na dper mi rung /🔽'dra na phyogs gcig gis 'dra'am phyogs thams cad nas 'dra /
analyzed: mi 'dra na dper mi rung / 'dra na phyogs gcig gis 'dra'am phyogs thams cad nas 'dra /
translated: If it is dissimilar, it is not suitable as a simile.🔽If it is similar, is it similar in one aspect or in all aspects?

original: phyogs gcig nas 'dra zer na thams cad kyang dper 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig nas 'dra zer na thams cad kyang dper 'gyur te /
translated: If it is said to be similar in one aspect, then everything would be a simile.

original: dper na rna ba yod pas bong bu dang ba lang 'dra zer ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rna ba yod pas bong bu dang ba lang 'dra zer ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like saying that because they have ears, donkeys and oxen are similar.

original: thams cad kyis 'dra na dper mi 'grub ste don nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyis 'dra na dper mi 'grub ste don nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If all are similar, it is not established as an example, it becomes the very meaning.

original: des na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de la dpe med ces bya'o //
analyzed: des na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de la dpe med ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that wisdom of omniscience is said to be without example.

original: yang na dpe ldan ni kun rdzob tu chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dpe ldan ni kun rdzob tu chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, having an example is that all phenomena are like illusions and so forth on the relative level.

original: shes rab 'od ni thams cad kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid so sor ma 'dres par shes pa de la de skad bya'o /
analyzed: shes rab 'od ni thams cad kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid so sor ma 'dres par shes pa de la de skad bya'o /
translated: Prajñāpradīpa is the knowledge of the individual and general characteristics of all without confusion.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ni shes bya ji lta bu dang ji snyed pa mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni shes bya ji lta bu dang ji snyed pa mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Omniscience is the knowledge of the knowable as it is and in its extent.

original: 'o na shes rab dang khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na shes rab dang khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: Well then, what is the difference between prajñā and that?

original: yon tan phyogs re la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan phyogs re la dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is intended that [prajñā] is a quality of one aspect.

original: rnal 'byor ye shes kyis ni chos thams cad so sor rig cing chos kyi dbyings su rdzogs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ye shes kyis ni chos thams cad so sor rig cing chos kyi dbyings su rdzogs te /
translated: By the wisdom of yoga, all phenomena are individually cognized and perfected in the dharmadhātu.

original: ci rig na chos thams cad @77b sems su rig sems kyi rang bzhin rig rang bzhin cir yang ma grub pa ste sa bcu gnyis de la rdzogs so /
analyzed: ci rig na chos thams cad @77b sems su rig sems kyi rang bzhin rig rang bzhin cir yang ma grub pa ste sa bcu gnyis de la rdzogs so /
translated: What is known? All phenomena are known to be mind. The nature of mind is known. The nature is not established as anything at all. The twelve stages are complete in that.

original: // / de las bcu gnyis po de rnams kyang bsdu na ye shes lngar 'dus /
analyzed: // / de las bcu gnyis po de rnams kyang bsdu na ye shes lngar 'dus /
translated: Those twelve are also subsumed in the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: ye shes lnga yang gnyis med kyi ye shes gcig tu 'dus so //
analyzed: ye shes lnga yang gnyis med kyi ye shes gcig tu 'dus so //
translated: The five pristine consciousnesses are also subsumed in a single nondual pristine consciousness.

original: spro na yang gnyis med de las ldog pas byas pa'i ye shes lnga de la sa bcu gnyis don gyi ngo bo gcig go //
analyzed: spro na yang gnyis med de las ldog pas byas pa'i ye shes lnga de la sa bcu gnyis don gyi ngo bo gcig go //
translated: If expanded, the five pristine consciousnesses are created by reversing from that nonduality. The twelve stages are the single essence of the meaning.

original: de sthi to zhes pa nas bart'i n'am gyi par gyi sngags 'di la ni slob dpon aa sh'a ka ri la sogs pa kha cig sku bskyed pa'i rkyen gyi sngags su 'dod de /
analyzed: de sthi to zhes pa nas bart'i n'am gyi par gyi sngags 'di la ni slob dpon aa sh'a ka ri la sogs pa kha cig sku bskyed pa'i rkyen gyi sngags su 'dod de /
translated: Regarding this mantra from “sthita” to “vartani,” some, such as Ācārya Aśādhara, assert that it is the mantra of the condition of the creation of the body.

original: 'dir slob dpon sgeg pa'i rdo rje nyid ni sngags min par bzhed de /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon sgeg pa'i rdo rje nyid ni sngags min par bzhed de /
translated: Here, Ācārya Lalitavajra asserts that it is not a mantra.

original: de yang sthi to ni brtan pa /
analyzed: de yang sthi to ni brtan pa /
translated: “Sthita” means “firm.”

original: hri di thugs /
analyzed: hri di thugs /
translated: “Hṛdaya” means “heart.”

original: dzny'a na ye shes /
analyzed: dzny'a na ye shes /
translated: “Jñāna” means “pristine consciousness.”

original: m'urti ni spyi gtsug ra ham ni nga /
analyzed: m'urti ni spyi gtsug ra ham ni nga /
translated: “Mūrdhani” means “crown.” “Raha” means “I.”

original: buddho ni ra ham gi khyad par /
analyzed: buddho ni ra ham gi khyad par /
translated: The difference between Buddha and Rahu is as follows.

original: buddha ni sangs rgyas /
analyzed: buddha ni sangs rgyas /
translated: Buddha means “awakened one.”

original: n'am ni gnas /
analyzed: n'am ni gnas /
translated: Na means “abiding.”

original: tryadhva ni dus gsum /
analyzed: tryadhva ni dus gsum /
translated: Tryadhva means “three times.”

original: bart'i n'am ni bzhugs pa /
analyzed: bart'i n'am ni bzhugs pa /
translated: Varti means “to abide.”

original: dril bas dus gsum bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas la nga ni brtan par gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dril bas dus gsum bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas la nga ni brtan par gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: The whole means “I abide firmly in the buddhas of the three times.”

original: sngags ni min par bzhed do //
analyzed: sngags ni min par bzhed do //
translated: It is not asserted to be a mantra.

original: 'o na tshul ji ltar gnas sha na /
analyzed: 'o na tshul ji ltar gnas sha na /
translated: Well then, in what way does he abide?

original: don dam du sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ngo bo'am rang bzhin du gnas so //
analyzed: don dam du sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ngo bo'am rang bzhin du gnas so //
translated: In the ultimate, he abides as the essence or nature of all buddhas.

original: gal te mi bzhugs na lha la thugs med par thal te thugs med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te mi bzhugs na lha la thugs med par thal te thugs med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If he did not abide, it would follow that the deity would be mindless, but he is not mindless.

original: kun rdzob tu ni 'jam dpal sku gsum gyi ngo bor gnas te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni 'jam dpal sku gsum gyi ngo bor gnas te /
translated: In the relative, Mañjuśrī abides as the essence of the three kāyas.

original: de yang longs sku ni dang po'i sangs rgyas zhal lnga pa'i rang bzhin gyi gnas so //
analyzed: de yang longs sku ni dang po'i sangs rgyas zhal lnga pa'i rang bzhin gyi gnas so //
translated: Further, the saṃbhogakāya abides in the nature of the five faces of the primordial buddha.

original: sprul sku ni cir yang bzhugs te /
analyzed: sprul sku ni cir yang bzhugs te /
translated: The nirmāṇakāya abides in any way whatsoever.

original: gnas brtan rgan po dang gzhon lus gcig la sogs pa sna tshogs so //
analyzed: gnas brtan rgan po dang gzhon lus gcig la sogs pa sna tshogs so //
translated: He has various bodies, such as the body of an elder and the body of a youth.

original: chos sku'i gzugs brnyan ni kun rdzob tu rigs bdun gyi bye brag gis ye shes sems dpa' yang mdun du bzhugs te /
analyzed: chos sku'i gzugs brnyan ni kun rdzob tu rigs bdun gyi bye brag gis ye shes sems dpa' yang mdun du bzhugs te /
translated: The reflection of the dharmakāya is the gnosis being, who is present in front, in the relative sense, in the particular form of one of the seven buddha families.

original: aom badzra t'ikshna zhes pa padma'i rigs kyi sems dpa' snang ba mtha' yas kyi thugs ka na dmar po zhal gcig phyag gnyis g-yas na ral gri g-yon padma rdo rje rnon po zhes bya ba'i mtshan can gyi skus bzhugs so //
analyzed: aom badzra t'ikshna zhes pa padma'i rigs kyi sems dpa' snang ba mtha' yas kyi thugs ka na dmar po zhal gcig phyag gnyis g-yas na ral gri g-yon padma rdo rje rnon po zhes bya ba'i mtshan can gyi skus bzhugs so //
translated: The gnosis being of the lotus family is Amitābha, who is red, with one face and two arms, holding a sword in the right hand and a lotus in the left hand. He is present in the form of the one called “Vajra Sharpness” at the heart of Amitābha.

original: du: kha tstshe da rdo rje'i rigs mi bskyod pa'i thugs ka na sngon po /🔽phyag mtshan thams cad g-yas ral gri /
analyzed: du: kha tstshe da rdo rje'i rigs mi bskyod pa'i thugs ka na sngon po / phyag mtshan thams cad g-yas ral gri /
translated: The gnosis being of the vajra family is Akṣobhya, who is blue,

original: g-yon rang rtags zhal gcig pa /
analyzed: g-yon rang rtags zhal gcig pa /
translated: with all the hand implements as before, the right hand holding a sword and the left hand holding a vajra.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad nges par gcod pa'i gzugs kyis bzhugs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad nges par gcod pa'i gzugs kyis bzhugs so //
translated: He has one face and is present in the form of “Vajra Definitely Cutting All Suffering.”

original: pradzny'a ni @78a * //
analyzed: pradzny'a ni @78a * //
translated: The gnosis being of the jewel family is Ratnasaṃbhava, who is yellow,🔽with one face and two arms, holding a jewel in the right hand and a jewel-handled bell in the left hand. He is present in the form of “Vajra Wisdom Crown.”🔽The gnosis being of the tathāgata family is Vairocana, who is white,

original: shes rab ye shes kyi spyi gtsug ces pa'i mtshan no //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes kyi spyi gtsug ces pa'i mtshan no //
translated: with one face and four arms, holding a wheel, a jewel, a lotus, and a sword. He is present in the form of “Vajra Wisdom Body.”🔽The gnosis being of the action family is Amoghasiddhi, who is green,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi dzny'a na k'a ya ni ye shes kyi sku ste las kyi rigs kyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi dzny'a na k'a ya ni ye shes kyi sku ste las kyi rigs kyi'o //
translated: with one face and two arms, holding a sword in the right hand and a lasso in the left hand. He is present in the form of “Vajra Wisdom Crown.”

original: w'a g'i shva ra ni ngag gi dbang phyug ste rin po che'i rigs so //
analyzed: w'a g'i shva ra ni ngag gi dbang phyug ste rin po che'i rigs so //
translated: Vāgīśvara is the lord of speech, the jewel family.

original: aa ra pa tsa na zhes pa'i mtshan can ni byang sems rdo rje'i rigs kyi thugs ka nas dkar po zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa g-yas ral gri /
analyzed: aa ra pa tsa na zhes pa'i mtshan can ni byang sems rdo rje'i rigs kyi thugs ka nas dkar po zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa g-yas ral gri /
translated: The one named “Arapacana” is the bodhisattva Vajra, who resides in the heart of the vajra family. He is white, with one face and two arms, holding a sword in his right hand

original: g-yon rdo rje bsnams par bzhugs so //
analyzed: g-yon rdo rje bsnams par bzhugs so //
translated: and a vajra in his left.

original: ya te na ma: gang yin pa de na ma: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ya te na ma: gang yin pa de na ma: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Ya te namaḥ means “to you I pay homage.”

original: 'di gnyis kyi gong ma drug gi zhabs la sbyor /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi gong ma drug gi zhabs la sbyor /
translated: These two are added to the end of the previous six.

original: sngags de rnams dril ba ni rigs bsdus pa'i ye shes sems dpa' zhes bya ba rnam snang chen po'i thugs ka na zhal drug phyag gnyis pa g-yas ral gri /
analyzed: sngags de rnams dril ba ni rigs bsdus pa'i ye shes sems dpa' zhes bya ba rnam snang chen po'i thugs ka na zhal drug phyag gnyis pa g-yas ral gri /
translated: The combined mantra is called the “jñānasattva of the gathered families.” He is Mahāvairocana, who resides in the heart of the vajra family. He has six faces and two arms, holding a sword in his right hand

original: g-yon autpala'i steng du rgyal ba'i yum gyi bo ti bsnams nas bzhugs so //🔽de rnams dang / sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyan dang ldan //
analyzed: g-yon autpala'i steng du rgyal ba'i yum gyi bo ti bsnams nas bzhugs so // de rnams dang / sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyan dang ldan //
translated: and a book of the mother of the victors on a lotus in his left.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: And:🔽“The nirmāṇakāya is adorned with ornaments.”

original: sprul pa'i skus lus la btab pa'am /
analyzed: sprul pa'i skus lus la btab pa'am /
translated: The nirmāṇakāya is placed on the body.

original: yang na de nyid kyis sangs rgyas thams cad brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de nyid kyis sangs rgyas thams cad brgyan pa'o //
translated: Or, it is the ornament of all the Buddhas by that very fact.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa man ngag gi rim pa rnam par phye ba ste le'u bzhi pa rdzogs so //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa man ngag gi rim pa rnam par phye ba ste le'u bzhi pa rdzogs so //
translated: The chapter on the stage of the empowerment of the knowledge of the creation stage of the Magical Net, the fourth chapter of the commentary on the Secret Nucleus, the Finer Points of the Text, is completed.

original: //'di ltar zhes pa'i tshig rkang gnyis spro gzhi ye shes sems dpa'i mtshan brjod pa ste /
analyzed: //'di ltar zhes pa'i tshig rkang gnyis spro gzhi ye shes sems dpa'i mtshan brjod pa ste /
translated: The two lines beginning “In this way” mention the name of the wisdom being who is the basis of the emanation.

original: de yang mtshan gyi rnal 'byor rang don du bsgrub pa gcig gis bsrung ba mdor bsdus pa la sogs pa sngon du song ba gcig gis sum brtsegs bskyed pa'i thugs ka'i yi ge aa las rigs bsdus kyi mtshan chos 'di spro ba ste /
analyzed: de yang mtshan gyi rnal 'byor rang don du bsgrub pa gcig gis bsrung ba mdor bsdus pa la sogs pa sngon du song ba gcig gis sum brtsegs bskyed pa'i thugs ka'i yi ge aa las rigs bsdus kyi mtshan chos 'di spro ba ste /
translated: Moreover, one who has previously accomplished the yoga of the name for one’s own benefit, and who has practised the concise protection and so forth, emanates the name of the universal family from the letter A at the heart of the triple-being creation.

original: de la ye shes sems dpa'i mtshan nyid ci la zer /🔽gnas gang na gnas /
analyzed: de la ye shes sems dpa'i mtshan nyid ci la zer / gnas gang na gnas /
translated: What is the definition of the wisdom being?🔽Where is its location?

original: gnas lugs ji ltar gnas /
analyzed: gnas lugs ji ltar gnas /
translated: How does it abide?

original: de'i rgyu ci las byung /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ci las byung /
translated: What is its cause?

original: mtshan du dang ldan /
analyzed: mtshan du dang ldan /
translated: What are its attributes?

original: de bsgom na ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: de bsgom na ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
translated: How is it to be meditated upon?

original: mtshan nyid ni don gyi sgo nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs kyi rang bzhin nam ngo bo la bya la de'i mtshan nyid 'di yin /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni don gyi sgo nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs kyi rang bzhin nam ngo bo la bya la de'i mtshan nyid 'di yin /
translated: As for its characteristics, from the point of view of its meaning, it is the nature or essence of the enlightened mind of all buddhas.

original: rtags kyi sgo nas zhal phyag gi rnam pa can du bzhugs te /
analyzed: rtags kyi sgo nas zhal phyag gi rnam pa can du bzhugs te /
translated: From the point of view of its signs, it exists in the form of faces and arms.

original: de yang ma ki nas /
analyzed: de yang ma ki nas /
translated: And as the Hevajra Tantra says:

original: 'od bzang ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od //
analyzed: 'od bzang ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od //
translated: Beautiful light like the light of an autumn moon.

original: ces pa nas /
analyzed: ces pa nas /
translated: And continuing up to:

original: sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyan dang ldan //🔽zhes pa'i bar du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyan dang ldan // zhes pa'i bar du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emanated ornament of the buddhas.

original: gnas ni lha thams cad kyi thugs ka na gnas so //
analyzed: gnas ni lha thams cad kyi thugs ka na gnas so //
translated: As for its location, it is located in the heart of all deities.

original: lugs kyang @78b don gyi sgo nas don dam du lha thams cad kyi thugs yang dag pa'i ye shes su bzhugs pa rtags kyi sgo nas kun rdzob tu rigs bdun gyi gtso bo'i thugs ka na zhal phyag gi rnam pa can du gnas so //
analyzed: lugs kyang @78b don gyi sgo nas don dam du lha thams cad kyi thugs yang dag pa'i ye shes su bzhugs pa rtags kyi sgo nas kun rdzob tu rigs bdun gyi gtso bo'i thugs ka na zhal phyag gi rnam pa can du gnas so //
translated: And as for its system, from the point of view of its meaning, it exists in the ultimate truth as the utterly pure exalted wisdom in the mind of all deities. From the point of view of its signs, it exists in the relative truth in the form of faces and arms in the heart of the principal deity of the seven lineages.

original: de'i rgyu ni aa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni aa ste /
translated: As for its cause, it is the letter A.

original: de yang don gyi sgo nas don dam gyi ye shes sems dpa' de skye med kyi aas bskyed la /
analyzed: de yang don gyi sgo nas don dam gyi ye shes sems dpa' de skye med kyi aas bskyed la /
translated: And as for that, from the point of view of its meaning, that ultimate truth bodhicitta is generated by the unborn A.

original: rtags kyi ye shes sems dpa' ni kun rdzob kyi aa kha dog dang dbyibs can de gyur pa las bskyed do //
analyzed: rtags kyi ye shes sems dpa' ni kun rdzob kyi aa kha dog dang dbyibs can de gyur pa las bskyed do //
translated: The sign-gnosis hero is generated from the transformation of the relative A, which has color and shape.

original: ji ltar bsgom pa ni man ngag las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom pa ni man ngag las shes par bya'o //
translated: How to meditate on this should be learned from the esoteric instructions.

original: mtshan du dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan du dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics of the hero?

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya /
translated: He is called Buddha,

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya /
translated: Bhagavat,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya /
translated: Samyaksambuddha,

original: aa las byung ba zhes bya ste bzhi dang ldan no //
analyzed: aa las byung ba zhes bya ste bzhi dang ldan no //
translated: and A-originated.

original: de la ci'i phyir mtshan de skad bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir mtshan de skad bya zhe na /
translated: Why are these the characteristics?

original: 'di ltar zhes pa ni spros pa nye bar mngon sum du ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes pa ni spros pa nye bar mngon sum du ston pa'o //
translated: Thus is the direct demonstration of the elaboration.

original: sangs rgyas ni mkhyen pa la bya ste shes bya ji lta ba dang ji snyed pa mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni mkhyen pa la bya ste shes bya ji lta ba dang ji snyed pa mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Buddha is the knowledge of the knowable as it is and in its extent.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni bshad zin to ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni bshad zin to ;
translated: Bhagavat has been explained.

original: / rdzogs pa ni rang bzhin gyi don thams cad do //
analyzed: / rdzogs pa ni rang bzhin gyi don thams cad do //
translated: Perfect is the meaning of the nature of all things.

original: aa las byung ba ni don rtogs kyi sgo nas rgyu'o //
analyzed: aa las byung ba ni don rtogs kyi sgo nas rgyu'o //
translated: A-originated is the cause in terms of the realization of the meaning.

original: aa ni zhes pa'i tshig rkang gnyis kyis spro gzhi yi ge aa'i don brjod pa ste /
analyzed: aa ni zhes pa'i tshig rkang gnyis kyis spro gzhi yi ge aa'i don brjod pa ste /
translated: The two lines beginning “A is the ground of emanation” describe the meaning of the letter A, the ground of emanation.

original: de la aa'i dbye ba dang / sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / phrin las dang / ngo bo dang / sgom thabs dang ; 'bru bshad dang drug gis bstan te /
analyzed: de la aa'i dbye ba dang / sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / phrin las dang / ngo bo dang / sgom thabs dang ; 'bru bshad dang drug gis bstan te /
translated: This is taught by six topics: the divisions of A, the reason for using the term, its activity, its nature, the method of meditation, and the explanation of the syllables.

original: aa la dbye na du yod de ce na gnyis te /
analyzed: aa la dbye na du yod de ce na gnyis te /
translated: If one asks, “How many divisions are there of A?” there are two.

original: zab pa'i don dam ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: zab pa'i don dam ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: The profound ultimate A is emptiness.

original: kun rdzob rgya che ba'i aa ni kha dog dang dbyibs can gyi aa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob rgya che ba'i aa ni kha dog dang dbyibs can gyi aa'o //
translated: The relative A of vast appearance is the A that has color and shape.

original: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni /
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni /
translated: The reason for using the term is as follows.

original: yig 'bru kun gyi mchog ces bya ste /
analyzed: yig 'bru kun gyi mchog ces bya ste /
translated: It is called “the supreme of all syllables.”

original: a'a li k'a li thams cad kyi khong du aa zhugs shing srog tu gyur pas aa ni mchog go //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li thams cad kyi khong du aa zhugs shing srog tu gyur pas aa ni mchog go //
translated: A is supreme because it is the life-force and the inner core of all the Alikali.

original: aa'i phrin las ni don chen zhes bya ste /
analyzed: aa'i phrin las ni don chen zhes bya ste /
translated: The activity of A is called “great meaning.”

original: rgya che ba'i sgo nas sangs rgyas mchod pa dang sems can gyi don byed /
analyzed: rgya che ba'i sgo nas sangs rgyas mchod pa dang sems can gyi don byed /
translated: From the point of view of vast appearance, it is the offering to the buddhas and the benefit of sentient beings.

original: zab pa'i sgo nas rtog pa chung dus nyan thos kyi byang chub thob /
analyzed: zab pa'i sgo nas rtog pa chung dus nyan thos kyi byang chub thob /
translated: From the point of view of the profound, it is the attainment of the enlightenment of the śrāvakas by those with small concepts.

original: 'bring gis byang chub sems dpa' thob /
analyzed: 'bring gis byang chub sems dpa' thob /
translated: The middling one obtains the state of a bodhisattva.

original: rtog pa chen sangs rgyas thob /
analyzed: rtog pa chen sangs rgyas thob /
translated: The great one obtains buddhahood.

original: byang chub rnam gsum po de thob pas don chen no //
analyzed: byang chub rnam gsum po de thob pas don chen no //
translated: Since one obtains those three kinds of enlightenment, it is of great benefit.

original: ngo bo ni yi ge dam pa yin zhes te /
analyzed: ngo bo ni yi ge dam pa yin zhes te /
translated: The essence is the sublime syllable.

original: zab pa don dam gyi aa de ni ksha ra zhes pa'i sgra 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: zab pa don dam gyi aa de ni ksha ra zhes pa'i sgra 'gyur ba la /
translated: That profound, ultimate a is the verbal root kṣa ra.

original: aa ksha ra zhes pa aas bkag pas mi 'gyur ba la 'jug ste /
analyzed: aa ksha ra zhes pa aas bkag pas mi 'gyur ba la 'jug ste /
translated: A kṣa ra is a nonchanging because it is blocked by a.

original: zab pa don dam gyi aa ni ngo bo cing @79a * //🔽yang mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zab pa don dam gyi aa ni ngo bo cing @79a * // yang mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The profound, ultimate a is a nonchanging essence.

original: des na dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called sublime.

original: sgom thabs ni man ngag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sgom thabs ni man ngag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: The method of meditation should be understood from the esoteric instructions.

original: khong nas zhes pa'i tshigs bcad gcig spro rgyu yum bzhi'i mtshan brjod ston te /
analyzed: khong nas zhes pa'i tshigs bcad gcig spro rgyu yum bzhi'i mtshan brjod ston te /
translated: The one verse beginning “from within” teaches the names of the four mothers to be delighted.

original: de yang mtshan can yum bzhi po de'i so so'i mtshan nyid dang / bskyed pa'i rgyu dang / sku mdog dang / phyag mtshan gyi nges pa dang / yum gyi 'thad pa dang / thabs shes rab kyi 'brel pa dang / gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa dang /
analyzed: de yang mtshan can yum bzhi po de'i so so'i mtshan nyid dang / bskyed pa'i rgyu dang / sku mdog dang / phyag mtshan gyi nges pa dang / yum gyi 'thad pa dang / thabs shes rab kyi 'brel pa dang / gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa dang /
translated: Furthermore, the four mothers with signs are explained by seven topics:

original: sgom thabs dang bdun gyis bstan te /
analyzed: sgom thabs dang bdun gyis bstan te /
translated: the characteristics of each one, the cause of generation, the ascertainment of the color and implements, the logic of the mother, the connection between method and wisdom, the logic of the principal and retinue, and the method of meditation.

original: de la mtshan nyid ni gnyis te don rtogs so //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid ni gnyis te don rtogs so //
translated: The characteristics are twofold: the characteristic of the object and the characteristic of the object of knowledge.

original: don gyi sgo nas gnyis med kyi ye shes gcig ldog pa'i bye brag gis ye shes bzhir byas /🔽chos can ye shes bzhis bye brag tu byas pa'i stong pa bzhis ye shes bzhi la dgag bya rnam pa bzhis bkag nas rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi la yum bzhir 'dod de /
analyzed: don gyi sgo nas gnyis med kyi ye shes gcig ldog pa'i bye brag gis ye shes bzhir byas / chos can ye shes bzhis bye brag tu byas pa'i stong pa bzhis ye shes bzhi la dgag bya rnam pa bzhis bkag nas rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi la yum bzhir 'dod de /
translated: The characteristic of the object is the nondual pristine consciousness that is divided into four pristine consciousnesses by way of the different aspects.🔽The characteristic of the object of knowledge is the four emptinesses that are distinguished by the four pristine consciousnesses.

original: dngos po dang dmigs pa'i sgro 'dogs chod /
analyzed: dngos po dang dmigs pa'i sgro 'dogs chod /
translated: The four doors of liberation are asserted to be the four mothers because the four pristine consciousnesses are refuted by the four objects of refutation.

original: stong pa'i rnam par thar pa ste de la rdo rje sems ma byas /
analyzed: stong pa'i rnam par thar pa ste de la rdo rje sems ma byas /
translated: The emptiness door of liberation is Vajrasattva.

original: gnyis med de mtshan mas stong ste de'i sgro 'dogs chod pas mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis med de mtshan mas stong ste de'i sgro 'dogs chod pas mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar pa ste /
translated: Since the non-duality is empty of the sign of that, the superimposition on that is eliminated, and so there is the liberation of signlessness.

original: rin chen sems ma log pa'i smon pas stong pa de'i sgro 'dogs chod pas smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa ste /
analyzed: rin chen sems ma log pa'i smon pas stong pa de'i sgro 'dogs chod pas smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa ste /
translated: Since the emptiness of the precious mind-gem is empty of the superimposition of the aspiration, the superimposition on that is eliminated, and so there is the liberation of wishlessness.

original: chos kyi sems ma phyin ci log gi mngon par 'du byed pas stong pa sgro 'dogs de chod pa'i sgo nas las kyi sems ma /
analyzed: chos kyi sems ma phyin ci log gi mngon par 'du byed pas stong pa sgro 'dogs de chod pa'i sgo nas las kyi sems ma /
translated: Since the emptiness of the Dharma mind-gem is empty of the superimposition of the manifest formation, the superimposition on that is eliminated, and so there is the liberation of emptiness.

original: rtags kyi sgo nas kun rdzob tu lha mo'i rnam pa nu ma dang mo mtshan gyi khyad par du byas rang gi bdag pos dbu brgyan pa /
analyzed: rtags kyi sgo nas kun rdzob tu lha mo'i rnam pa nu ma dang mo mtshan gyi khyad par du byas rang gi bdag pos dbu brgyan pa /
translated: From the perspective of the signs, the goddesses have the form of goddesses with breasts and the special feature of a vagina, and they are crowned by their respective male consorts.

original: rdo rje la sogs pa'i sbubs na gnas pa /
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa'i sbubs na gnas pa /
translated: They abide in the interior of the vajra and so forth.

original: sku mdog dang phyag mtshan kyang phyogs dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sku mdog dang phyag mtshan kyang phyogs dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The colors and implements are the same as the male deities.

original: aa a'a aam aa:'i sku mdog phyag mtshan ni rim pa bzhin du rdo rje sems ma sngon mo rdo rje bsnams pa /
analyzed: aa a'a aam aa:'i sku mdog phyag mtshan ni rim pa bzhin du rdo rje sems ma sngon mo rdo rje bsnams pa /
translated: The colors and implements of the five mothers are as follows: Vajrarati is blue and holds a vajra.

original: rin chen bsnams ser /
analyzed: rin chen bsnams ser /
translated: Ratnarati is yellow and holds a jewel.

original: padma bsnams dmar /
analyzed: padma bsnams dmar /
translated: Padmarati is red and holds a lotus.

original: rgya gram bsnams ljang /
analyzed: rgya gram bsnams ljang /
translated: The mother is green and holds a crossed vajra.

original: yum gyi 'thad pa ni stong pa de bzhi spros pas de bzhi rig pa'i rig pa 'byung /
analyzed: yum gyi 'thad pa ni stong pa de bzhi spros pas de bzhi rig pa'i rig pa 'byung /
translated: The reason for the mother is that the four emptinesses arise from the vidyā of vidyā through proliferation.

original: stong pa de bzhi log na de rig pa'i rig pa ldog / stong pa de bzhi rig pa'i rig pa las de gshegs bzhi byas /
analyzed: stong pa de bzhi log na de rig pa'i rig pa ldog / stong pa de bzhi rig pa'i rig pa las de gshegs bzhi byas /
translated: If the four emptinesses are reversed, the vidyā of vidyā is reversed.

original: stong pa de bzhis bskyed pa'i phyir yum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa de bzhis bskyed pa'i phyir yum zhes bya'o //
translated: The four emptinesses are called “mother” because they generate the four tathāgatas.

original: thabs shes rab kyi 'brel /
analyzed: thabs shes rab kyi 'brel /
translated: The connection of method and wisdom

original: @79b pa ni bde gshegs bzhi thabs yum bzhis shes rab ste /
analyzed: @79b pa ni bde gshegs bzhi thabs yum bzhis shes rab ste /
translated: is as follows: The four tathāgatas are method, and the four mothers are wisdom.

original: phyogs mtshams kyi bzhugs gnas kyis 'brel to //🔽gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa rag las dang rag las pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs mtshams kyi bzhugs gnas kyis 'brel to // gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa rag las dang rag las pa ste /
translated: They are connected by the locations of the directions and the intermediate directions.🔽The reason for the retinue is dependence and dependence.

original: de yang spyi 'khor sgos 'khor gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang spyi 'khor sgos 'khor gnyis te /
translated: There are two: the general retinue and the specific retinue.

original: yum bzhi po 'di rnams nang gi spyi 'khor te /
analyzed: yum bzhi po 'di rnams nang gi spyi 'khor te /
translated: These four mothers are the inner general retinue.

original: rnam snang ni rnam pa bzhis bsdus pa'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid can yin la /
analyzed: rnam snang ni rnam pa bzhis bsdus pa'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid can yin la /
translated: Vairocana is the nature of the qualities subsumed by the four aspects.

original: gtso bo'i yon tan de log na 'khor gyi yon tan ldog pas rnam snang ni rag las par 'dug / lha mo bzhi rag las par 'dug pas gtso 'khor ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i yon tan de log na 'khor gyi yon tan ldog pas rnam snang ni rag las par 'dug / lha mo bzhi rag las par 'dug pas gtso 'khor ro //
translated: The four goddesses are dependent, so they are the retinue.

original: gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa ni rdo rje sems ma de ni mi bskyod pa'i sgos 'khor te /
analyzed: gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa ni rdo rje sems ma de ni mi bskyod pa'i sgos 'khor te /
translated: The rationale for principal and retinue is that Vajrasattva is the retinue of Akshobhya.

original: chos me long lta bu'i ye shes de yod pas de stong par shes pa'i shes pa 'byung /
analyzed: chos me long lta bu'i ye shes de yod pas de stong par shes pa'i shes pa 'byung /
translated: Since the mirror-like pristine awareness of phenomena exists, the consciousness that knows that emptiness arises.🔽If the mirror-like phenomena are reversed, the consciousness that knows that is reversed.

original: chos can me long lta bu de log na de shes pa'i shes pa ldog / de nas stong pa nyid de me long lta bu la rag las pas sems ma rdo rje ma rag las pas mi bskyod pa rag las pa'o ;
analyzed: chos can me long lta bu de log na de shes pa'i shes pa ldog / de nas stong pa nyid de me long lta bu la rag las pas sems ma rdo rje ma rag las pas mi bskyod pa rag las pa'o ;
translated: Then, since that emptiness is dependent on the mirror, Vajra Woman is dependent, so Akshobhya is dependent.

original: / des bsgres te 'og ma gsum la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: / des bsgres te 'og ma gsum la yang sbyar ro //
translated: Apply this to the other three below.

original: sgom thabs ni man ngag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sgom thabs ni man ngag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: The method of meditation should be understood from the esoteric instructions.

original: khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
analyzed: khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
translated: Arising from within is non-arising.

original: ces pa rdo rje sems ma'i rang bzhin yi ge aa thung du ste rkan dang mchu dang so la sogs pa gang la yang ma brten par khong nas 'byung la /
analyzed: ces pa rdo rje sems ma'i rang bzhin yi ge aa thung du ste rkan dang mchu dang so la sogs pa gang la yang ma brten par khong nas 'byung la /
translated: The short vowel a, which is the nature of Vajrasattva, is not dependent on anything such as the palate, lips, teeth, and so on, but arises from within.🔽Since its meaning abides as the nature of non-arising, it is the cause of the mirror-like pristine consciousness of the dharmadhatu.

original: de'i don skye med kyi rang bzhin du gnas pas chos kyi dbyings me long lta bu'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir yum sems ma rdo rje ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i don skye med kyi rang bzhin du gnas pas chos kyi dbyings me long lta bu'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir yum sems ma rdo rje ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The nature of the mother is called Vajra Woman.

original: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
translated: The abandonment of verbal expression🔽is the nature of Ratna Woman.

original: zhes pa de rin chen rdo rje ma ste de la tshig ni brjod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa de rin chen rdo rje ma ste de la tshig ni brjod pa ste /
translated: The word “expression” is verbal expression.

original: rin chen rdo rje ma ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pas chos thams cad mnyam nyid rtogs na brjod pa thams cad kyi tshig med pas de'i phyir rin chen sems ma la de skad bya'o //
analyzed: rin chen rdo rje ma ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pas chos thams cad mnyam nyid rtogs na brjod pa thams cad kyi tshig med pas de'i phyir rin chen sems ma la de skad bya'o //
translated: Since Ratna Woman is the nature of the pristine consciousness of uniformity, if all phenomena are realized to be uniform, all verbal expressions are absent. Therefore, the mother is called Ratna Woman.🔽The supreme cause of all expressions

original: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / ces pa chos kyi sems ma la de skad bya ste /
analyzed: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / ces pa chos kyi sems ma la de skad bya ste /
translated: is the nature of Dharma Woman.

original: brjod pa ni tshig ste shes bya ji snyed pa yod pas de brjod pa'i tshig 'byung ste /
analyzed: brjod pa ni tshig ste shes bya ji snyed pa yod pas de brjod pa'i tshig 'byung ste /
translated: Speech is the words, because there are as many objects of knowledge as there are words to express them.
