original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis mkhyen pas de ni brjod pa'i rgyu'i rkyen no //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis mkhyen pas de ni brjod pa'i rgyu'i rkyen no //
translated: Since it is known by the discriminating wisdom, it is the causal condition of expression.

original: tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: It illuminates all words.

original: ces pa las kyi sems ma la de skad bya ste /
analyzed: ces pa las kyi sems ma la de skad bya ste /
translated: This is the activity mind, and it is called that because

original: 'di ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas gzhan gyi don byed pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas gzhan gyi don byed pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: it is the nature of accomplishing the welfare of others through the wisdom of purposeful activity.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: @80a * // lha yi skad dang klu dang gnod sbyin skad //
analyzed: @80a * // lha yi skad dang klu dang gnod sbyin skad //
translated: The languages of the gods, nagas, and yakshas,🔽and so forth,

original: ces pa la sogs pa de skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la de'i skad kyis de dang des so sor gsal par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa de skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la de'i skad kyis de dang des so sor gsal par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are individually illuminated for those who are fortunate through those languages.

original: mchod pa chen po nas mar tshig rkang bcu gnyis 'jam dpal rigs lnga'i mtshan brjod ston to //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po nas mar tshig rkang bcu gnyis 'jam dpal rigs lnga'i mtshan brjod ston to //
translated: From the great offering onward, the next twelve lines teach the names of the five families of Manjushri.

original: de yang 'di rnams la go rims 'chol ba'i skyon spangs pa'am go rims nges pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / so so'i mtshan nyid dang / gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa dang / bzang ngan gyi khyad par dang / thabs shes rab kyi 'brel pa dang / phrin las kyi khyad par dang /🔽sgom thabs dang / 'bru bshad pa dang brgyad de /🔽de la go rims 'chol lo zhe na /🔽go rims 'chol pa'i skyon spang ba ni 'di rnams la 'chol ba'i skyon med 'di rnams ka ltar 'dod thog go //
analyzed: de yang 'di rnams la go rims 'chol ba'i skyon spangs pa'am go rims nges pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / so so'i mtshan nyid dang / gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa dang / bzang ngan gyi khyad par dang / thabs shes rab kyi 'brel pa dang / phrin las kyi khyad par dang / sgom thabs dang / 'bru bshad pa dang brgyad de / de la go rims 'chol lo zhe na / go rims 'chol pa'i skyon spang ba ni 'di rnams la 'chol ba'i skyon med 'di rnams ka ltar 'dod thog go //
translated: Furthermore, there are eight topics: the reason for the definite order, the individual characteristics, the feasibility of the retinue, the distinction between good and bad, the connection between method and wisdom, the distinction of activities,🔽the method of meditation, and the explanation of the syllables.🔽🔽If it is asked why there is a definite order, the reason for the definite order is that the order of the topics is not random.🔽

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽sngags chags pa'i lam pa yin te /🔽bde ba lam du khyer te de las mi byed rdo rje theg pa zhes bya /🔽de nas sangs rgyas snang ba mtha' yas 'di ni 'dod chags kyi sangs rgyas yin pas dang por smos so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽sngags chags pa'i lam pa yin te /🔽bde ba lam du khyer te de las mi byed rdo rje theg pa zhes bya /🔽de nas sangs rgyas snang ba mtha' yas 'di ni 'dod chags kyi sangs rgyas yin pas dang por smos so //
translated: Furthermore, there are eight topics: the reason for the definite order, the individual characteristics, the feasibility of the retinue, the distinction between good and bad, the connection between method and wisdom, the distinction of activities, the method of meditation, and the explanation of the syllables.

original: lung las kyang 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ces 'dod chags sna la smos so //
analyzed: lung las kyang 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ces 'dod chags sna la smos so //
translated: Also, in the scriptures, “attachment, aversion, and delusion” are mentioned, with attachment mentioned first.

original: de nas zhe sdang chen po mi bskyod pa smos pa ni sems can sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa sngags kyi lam la 'dzud pa'ang chos bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'dzud pa dang / drag shul gyi tshul gyis 'dzud pa las 'dir drag shul sbyar te /
analyzed: de nas zhe sdang chen po mi bskyod pa smos pa ni sems can sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa sngags kyi lam la 'dzud pa'ang chos bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'dzud pa dang / drag shul gyi tshul gyis 'dzud pa las 'dir drag shul sbyar te /
translated: Then, Akṣobhya of great aversion is mentioned, because sentient beings are introduced to the Buddha’s teaching, the path of mantra, by the method of teaching the Dharma and by the method of wrathful action. Here, wrathful action is applied

original: zhe sdang rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the family of Akṣobhya is aversion.

original: de nas gti mug rnam snang bstan pa ni sems can sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la tshud nas zab mo skye ba med pa'i don ston to //
analyzed: de nas gti mug rnam snang bstan pa ni sems can sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la tshud nas zab mo skye ba med pa'i don ston to //
translated: Then, Vairocana of delusion is taught, because sentient beings who have entered the Buddha’s teaching are taught the meaning of profound nonarising.

original: skye med ni 'byed pa med pa'i gti mug yin la de ston pas rnam snang 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye med ni 'byed pa med pa'i gti mug yin la de ston pas rnam snang 'byung ste /
translated: Nonarising is the undifferentiated delusion, and Vairocana arises from teaching that.

original: rnam snang ni chos kyi dbyings las bskrun pa gti mug gi rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam snang ni chos kyi dbyings las bskrun pa gti mug gi rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vairocana is the family of delusion, because he is created from the dharmadhātu.

original: de nas yon tan de ma bstan par de nas don yod grub pa bstan pa ni 'di bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas gzhan don byed pa brtson 'grus kyi bdag nyid de sems can rnams la lta ba zab mo'i don yod kyang ma bsgrubs na
analyzed: de nas yon tan de ma bstan par de nas don yod grub pa bstan pa ni 'di bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas gzhan don byed pa brtson 'grus kyi bdag nyid de sems can rnams la lta ba zab mo'i don yod kyang ma bsgrubs na
translated: Even though sentient beings have the profound meaning of the view, if they do not practice it,

original: 'tshang mi rgya las de la brtson 'grus dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tshang mi rgya las de la brtson 'grus dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they will not attain buddhahood.

original: de nas ser sna chen po'i rin 'byung bstan pa 'di ni yon tan gyi sangs rgyas @80b yin te /
analyzed: de nas ser sna chen po'i rin 'byung bstan pa 'di ni yon tan gyi sangs rgyas @80b yin te /
translated: Then, after that, Ratnasaṃbhava, who has great avarice, is taught. This is the buddha of qualities.

original: 'dras bu sangs rgyas gzhan don byed pa'i yon tan yod do //
analyzed: 'dras bu sangs rgyas gzhan don byed pa'i yon tan yod do //
translated: The qualities of the buddhas, who are the result, are for the sake of others.

original: des na rin chen 'byung ldan mjug tu bstan pa ste go rims 'chol ba'i skyon ni med do //
analyzed: des na rin chen 'byung ldan mjug tu bstan pa ste go rims 'chol ba'i skyon ni med do //
translated: Therefore Ratnasaṃbhava is taught last. There is no fault of a disordered sequence.

original: yang mtshan 'di rnams ni rigs lnga'i mtshan du 'jug pas 'jam dpal la ci phan zhe na /
analyzed: yang mtshan 'di rnams ni rigs lnga'i mtshan du 'jug pas 'jam dpal la ci phan zhe na /
translated: Again, since these names are the names of the five buddha families, what is the point of Mañjuśrī?

original: 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' de nyid rigs lngar 'byung bas 'jam dpal snang ba mtha' yas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can ni de rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / rtags kyi mtshan nyid de de'i don gyi mtshan nyid ni spyir chos thams cad sems su 'dus /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' de nyid rigs lngar 'byung bas 'jam dpal snang ba mtha' yas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can ni de rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / rtags kyi mtshan nyid de de'i don gyi mtshan nyid ni spyir chos thams cad sems su 'dus /
translated: The characteristic of the meaning of that is that in general, all phenomena are included in the mind.

original: sems nyid sna tshogs su shar te /
analyzed: sems nyid sna tshogs su shar te /
translated: The nature of the mind arises as a diversity.

original: gzhi med rkyen gyis cir yang shar /
analyzed: gzhi med rkyen gyis cir yang shar /
translated: Since it arises as anything due to the condition of being without a basis,🔽as will be explained below:

original: 'og nas / rnam rig sna tshogs gzugs don can //
analyzed: 'og nas / rnam rig sna tshogs gzugs don can //
translated: The various consciousnesses have the form of objects.

original: rnam shes sna tshogs rgyud dang ldan //
analyzed: rnam shes sna tshogs rgyud dang ldan //
translated: The various consciousnesses are endowed with a continuum.🔽That is the relative vastness.

original: zhes 'byung de ni kun rdzob kyi rgya che ba dang / sems kyi rang bzhin cir yang ma grub pas nam mkha' dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: zhes 'byung de ni kun rdzob kyi rgya che ba dang / sems kyi rang bzhin cir yang ma grub pas nam mkha' dang 'dra ste /
translated: Since the nature of the mind is not established as anything, it is similar to space.

original: zab pa'i mtshan nyid don dam mo //
analyzed: zab pa'i mtshan nyid don dam mo //
translated: The characteristic of the profound is the ultimate.

original: de gnyis brjod thabs sam bstan thabs de las ma grub pas gnyis su phyi'i rang gi mtshan nyid la dbyer med pa ste de nyid la 'jam dpal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyis brjod thabs sam bstan thabs de las ma grub pas gnyis su phyi'i rang gi mtshan nyid la dbyer med pa ste de nyid la 'jam dpal zhes bya ste /
translated: ter of the external. That is called Manjushri.

original: de rtogs na ni nam mkha'i lam la gnas pa ste 'og nas de skad 'byung /🔽de gang la rang bzhin rgyu bsgom pa lam 'bras bu mthar thug rgyu'i rgyud thabs kyi rgyud /
analyzed: de rtogs na ni nam mkha'i lam la gnas pa ste 'og nas de skad 'byung / de gang la rang bzhin rgyu bsgom pa lam 'bras bu mthar thug rgyu'i rgyud thabs kyi rgyud /
translated: If that is realized, one abides on the path of space.🔽That is applied to the path of the method tantra, the result tantra, the

original: 'bras bu'i rgyud la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyud la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: ultimate tantra, the cause tantra, and so on.🔽Since there are different

original: de gang la ldog pa'i bye brag gis lha lnga bcu rtsa gsum bzhag ste /
analyzed: de gang la ldog pa'i bye brag gis lha lnga bcu rtsa gsum bzhag ste /
translated: aspects of that, the fifty-three deities are presented.🔽Since there are

original: rigs kyi bye brag gis lnga bcu rtsa gsum tshan bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bye brag gis lnga bcu rtsa gsum tshan bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: different families, there are seven sets of fifty-three.🔽When summarized,

original: bsdu na gnyis med kyi ye shes gcig po der 'dus te /
analyzed: bsdu na gnyis med kyi ye shes gcig po der 'dus te /
translated: they are included in the single gnosis of nonduality.🔽The meaning is the

original: don gcig gnyis med chos kyi don //
analyzed: don gcig gnyis med chos kyi don //
translated: meaning of the nondual Dharma.

original: zhe'o // de la gnyis med gcig po de nyid la gsal la mi rtog pa'i ngos nas me long lta bu'i ye shes sangs rgyas mi bskyod pa rtags kyi sgo nas shar gyi rtsibs la sa gnon phyag rgya can sngon po zhal gcig phyag gnyis par gyur te /
analyzed: zhe'o // de la gnyis med gcig po de nyid la gsal la mi rtog pa'i ngos nas me long lta bu'i ye shes sangs rgyas mi bskyod pa rtags kyi sgo nas shar gyi rtsibs la sa gnon phyag rgya can sngon po zhal gcig phyag gnyis par gyur te /
translated: In that, the single nonduality is mirrorlike wisdom from the perspective of clarity and nonconceptuality. It becomes the buddha Akṣobhya, who is blue, with one face and two hands in the mudra of touching the earth, on the eastern spoke.

original: yang gnyis med de la bdag chos sems can gsum mnyam pas gnyis med der shes pas mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang gnyis med de la bdag chos sems can gsum mnyam pas gnyis med der shes pas mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Again, in that nonduality, the three—self, phenomena, and sentient beings—are equal, and since they are recognized as nondual, there is equality.

original: rtags sangs rgyas rin chen 'byung ldan de nyid de'i mtshan nyid mtshon /
analyzed: rtags sangs rgyas rin chen 'byung ldan de nyid de'i mtshan nyid mtshon /
translated: The symbol of that is the buddha Ratnasambhava.

original: lho'i rtsibs la mchog sbyin ser po zhal gcig phyag gnyis rdo rje'i skyil mo krung ngo //🔽gnyis med gcig po de kho @81a * //
analyzed: lho'i rtsibs la mchog sbyin ser po zhal gcig phyag gnyis rdo rje'i skyil mo krung ngo // gnyis med gcig po de kho @81a * //
translated: He is yellow, with one face and two hands in the mudra of supreme generosity, in the vajra posture, on the southern spoke.

original: nas sems can so sor phye nas chos nyid so sor mkhyen so sor rtogs /
analyzed: nas sems can so sor phye nas chos nyid so sor mkhyen so sor rtogs /
translated: From that single nonduality, sentient beings are differentiated, and the dharmatā is individually cognized.

original: sangs rgyas snang ba mtha' yas rtags nub kyi rtsibs la ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya can /
analyzed: sangs rgyas snang ba mtha' yas rtags nub kyi rtsibs la ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya can /
translated: The buddha Amitābha is on the western spoke, with the mudra of meditative equipoise.

original: dmar po zhal gcig phyag gnyis rdo rje'i skyil mo krung ngo //
analyzed: dmar po zhal gcig phyag gnyis rdo rje'i skyil mo krung ngo //
translated: The red one has one face and two hands in the vajra posture.

original: gnyis med gcig po nyid kyis gzhan don byed nus /
analyzed: gnyis med gcig po nyid kyis gzhan don byed nus /
translated: The one without duality is able to benefit others.

original: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes nyid sangs rgyas don grub tu 'byung /
analyzed: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes nyid sangs rgyas don grub tu 'byung /
translated: The wisdom of successful action itself arises as Buddha Amoghasiddhi.

original: rtags kyi mtshan nyid de kun rdzob tu byang gi rtsibs la skyabs sbyin phyag rgya can /
analyzed: rtags kyi mtshan nyid de kun rdzob tu byang gi rtsibs la skyabs sbyin phyag rgya can /
translated: The characteristic of the sign is all of that on the northern petal, with the mudra of granting refuge.

original: ljang gu zhal gcig phyag gnyis rdo rje'i skyil mo krung byas /
analyzed: ljang gu zhal gcig phyag gnyis rdo rje'i skyil mo krung byas /
translated: The green one has one face and two hands in the vajra posture.

original: de ni don gyi mtshan nyid des sra ba'i mtshan nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni don gyi mtshan nyid des sra ba'i mtshan nyid bzhin no //
translated: That is the characteristic of the meaning, like the characteristic of solidity.

original: ye shes gzugs can min pa las gzugs su sgom mo zhe'o //
analyzed: ye shes gzugs can min pa las gzugs su sgom mo zhe'o //
translated: The wisdom is not a form, but it is meditated on as a form.

original: ye shes de bzhi la phyin ci log gi sgro 'dogs dgag bya rnam pa bzhi bkag nas rnam thar bzhi la yum bzhi bya ste gong du bstan no //
analyzed: ye shes de bzhi la phyin ci log gi sgro 'dogs dgag bya rnam pa bzhi bkag nas rnam thar bzhi la yum bzhi bya ste gong du bstan no //
translated: Those four wisdoms are the four mothers of the four gates of liberation, which are the refuges from the four objects of negation, the four misconceptions.

original: gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa ni gang zag gcig sangs rgyas pa'i ye shes la gtso 'khor du 'ong pa ci ste zhe na /
analyzed: gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa ni gang zag gcig sangs rgyas pa'i ye shes la gtso 'khor du 'ong pa ci ste zhe na /
translated: The reason for the principal and retinue is this: If it is asked why the wisdoms of a single person becoming a buddha come as the principal and retinue,

original: gtso bo ni yon tan thams cad sdud pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: gtso bo ni yon tan thams cad sdud pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: The principal one is the nature of the collection of all qualities.

original: 'khor ni yon tan gyi bye brag yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ni yon tan gyi bye brag yin no //
translated: The retinue is the particularities of the qualities.

original: des gtso bo dang 'khor gyi bye brag las 'khor du grags so //
analyzed: des gtso bo dang 'khor gyi bye brag las 'khor du grags so //
translated: Since there is a distinction between the principal one and the retinue, the retinue is renowned.

original: 'o na de ltar 'ong ba ste ci ste zhe na /🔽gtso bo ni rag las sa 'khor ni rag las pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na de ltar 'ong ba ste ci ste zhe na / gtso bo ni rag las sa 'khor ni rag las pa'o //
translated: If it is asked, “Why is that so?”🔽The principal one is the dependent, and the retinue is the dependence.

original: gtso bo ni rten sa 'khor ni brten pa'o //🔽yang na bzang ngan gyi khyad par ni gang zag gcig sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mi bzang ngan med na /🔽'dir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor bzang /
analyzed: gtso bo ni rten sa 'khor ni brten pa'o // yang na bzang ngan gyi khyad par ni gang zag gcig sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mi bzang ngan med na / 'dir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor bzang /
translated: The principal one is the support, and the retinue is the supported.

original: longs spyod kyi lha rnams bzang ngan byung ba ci ste zhe na /
analyzed: longs spyod kyi lha rnams bzang ngan byung ba ci ste zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “If there is no good or bad in the pristine consciousness of a buddha, why do the retinue of buddhas and bodhisattvas arise as good, and the retinue of the gods of enjoyments arise as bad?”

original: 'di ni gang zag gcig dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'i dus su lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa go ba'i dgos pa ste /🔽'bras bu ni sangs rgyas lnga /
analyzed: 'di ni gang zag gcig dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'i dus su lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa go ba'i dgos pa ste / 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas lnga /
translated: This is the purpose of understanding the path and the result when a person enters the maṇḍala.

original: sku lnga / rigs lnga /
analyzed: sku lnga / rigs lnga /
translated: The result is the five buddhas, the five kāyas, the five families,

original: ye shes lnga /
analyzed: ye shes lnga /
translated: and the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: spyan lngas bsdus pa'i sangs rgyas kyi slob ma yin par go la /
analyzed: spyan lngas bsdus pa'i sangs rgyas kyi slob ma yin par go la /
translated: You can understand that they are the Buddha’s disciples in the sense of being included among the five classes of disciples.🔽

original: byang chub sems dpas ni lam du go ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ni lam du go ste /
translated: The Bodhisattvas understand them as the path,

original: lam slob pas bsdus par go'o //
analyzed: lam slob pas bsdus par go'o //
translated: because they are included in the path of training.

original: longs spyod kyi lha mo rnams ni tshul khrims la sogs pa lam gyi grogs su go'o //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi lha mo rnams ni tshul khrims la sogs pa lam gyi grogs su go'o //
translated: The goddesses of enjoyment understand them as the aids to the path, such as morality and so forth.

original: thabs shes kyi 'brel pa ni rigs kyi sangs rgyas thabs rgya che ba badzri ma bzhi zab pa ste gnyis gnyis 'brel lo //
analyzed: thabs shes kyi 'brel pa ni rigs kyi sangs rgyas thabs rgya che ba badzri ma bzhi zab pa ste gnyis gnyis 'brel lo //
translated: The connection between method and wisdom is that the Buddhas of the families are the four Vajrī mothers, who are the extensive method and the profound wisdom, respectively.

original: phrin las ni sangs rgyas mchod pa dang / sems @81b can gyi don byed pa ste /
analyzed: phrin las ni sangs rgyas mchod pa dang / sems @81b can gyi don byed pa ste /
translated: The activity is the worship of the Buddhas and the performance of the aims of sentient beings.

original: thun mong du dug lnga cha mnyam pa'i don bye brag tu padma 'dod chags can de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: thun mong du dug lnga cha mnyam pa'i don bye brag tu padma 'dod chags can de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: In general, the five poisons are the aims, and in particular, the lotus is for those with passion.

original: man ngag sgom thabs su shes so //
analyzed: man ngag sgom thabs su shes so //
translated: One should understand the method of meditation as the esoteric instruction.

original: de la mchod pa chen po zhes pa gnyis kyis 'jam dpal rdo rje chen po'i 'od dpag tu med pa'i mtshan nyid du ston to //
analyzed: de la mchod pa chen po zhes pa gnyis kyis 'jam dpal rdo rje chen po'i 'od dpag tu med pa'i mtshan nyid du ston to //
translated: Therein, the phrase great worship indicates the characteristic of the great Mañjuvajra Amitābha.

original: rje btsun 'jam dpal la mchod pa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rje btsun 'jam dpal la mchod pa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: The worship of the venerable Mañjuśrī is called great.

original: ci'i phyir de skad bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de skad bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas mchod pa rgya mtsho sprul nas sangs rgyas mchod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas mchod pa rgya mtsho sprul nas sangs rgyas mchod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because, through the door of discriminating knowledge, he emanates an ocean of offerings and worships the Buddhas.

original: de bzhin du rgol tshig gzhan la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgol tshig gzhan la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same is to be applied to the other objections.

original: 'jam dpal 'dod chags chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal 'dod chags chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: Mañju, means great passion,

original: thugs rjes sems can gyi don la chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rjes sems can gyi don la chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of his passion for the welfare of sentient beings through compassion.

original: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: This is the praise in terms of his own characteristics.

original: sems can thams cad zag med kyi bde bas dga' zhing mgu ba ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad zag med kyi bde bas dga' zhing mgu ba ni /
translated: The joy and delight of all sentient beings

original: phrin las kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: phrin las kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: is the praise in terms of his activity.

original: mchod pa chen po gnyis mi bskyod pa'i mtshan te /
analyzed: mchod pa chen po gnyis mi bskyod pa'i mtshan te /
translated: The name of Akṣobhya is great offering,

original: mchod pa chen po ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi mchod pa'i sprin rgya mtsho sprul nas sangs rgyas mchod pa'i phyir rje btsun la de skad ces bya'o //🔽zhe sdang ni rang ka ma'i zhe sdang 'dul te /
analyzed: mchod pa chen po ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi mchod pa'i sprin rgya mtsho sprul nas sangs rgyas mchod pa'i phyir rje btsun la de skad ces bya'o // zhe sdang ni rang ka ma'i zhe sdang 'dul te /
translated: because he emanates an ocean of offering-clouds through the mirror-like knowledge and worships the Buddhas. The Lord is called thus.🔽Hatred is hatred in its own nature,

original: de la zhe sdang ba'am /
analyzed: de la zhe sdang ba'am /
translated: and he is the one who tames it.

original: mtshan ma la zhe sdang ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma la zhe sdang ba ste /
translated: and hatred of signs.

original: de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is what it is called.

original: nyon mongs kun ni drug go //
analyzed: nyon mongs kun ni drug go //
translated: All afflictions are six.

original: de'i gshed ma byed pa ni phrin las te /
analyzed: de'i gshed ma byed pa ni phrin las te /
translated: Its executioner is action.

original: 'jam dpal de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, that is what it is called.

original: mchod pa chen po'i tshig gnyis kyis gti mug 'jam dpal rnam snang gi mtshan te /
analyzed: mchod pa chen po'i tshig gnyis kyis gti mug 'jam dpal rnam snang gi mtshan te /
translated: The two words “great worship” are the name of Vairocana Mañjuśrī of delusion.

original: mchod pa chen po ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi mchod pa'i sprin rgya mtsho sprul nas sangs rgyas mchod pas 'jam dpal la de skad bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi mchod pa'i sprin rgya mtsho sprul nas sangs rgyas mchod pas 'jam dpal la de skad bya'o //
translated: Great worship is the cloud of worship of the wisdom of the realm of phenomena, emanating an ocean of emanations, worshipping the buddhas. Therefore, Mañjuśrī is called that.

original: chod dbyings de mi phyed pas gti mug ste /
analyzed: chod dbyings de mi phyed pas gti mug ste /
translated: That realm is undifferentiated. Therefore, it is delusion.

original: rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: From the perspective of its own essence, it is called that.

original: gti mug chen po des rang dga' ma'i gti mug sel ba'i phyir phrin las kyi sgo nas bstod pa'i //
analyzed: gti mug chen po des rang dga' ma'i gti mug sel ba'i phyir phrin las kyi sgo nas bstod pa'i //
translated: Because that great delusion clears away the delusion of self-enjoyment, it is praised from the perspective of action.

original: mchod pa chen po'i tshig gnyis ni 'jam dpal don grub kyi mtshan te /
analyzed: mchod pa chen po'i tshig gnyis ni 'jam dpal don grub kyi mtshan te /
translated: The two words “great worship” are the name of Amoghasiddhi Mañjuśrī.

original: mchod pa ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi mchod pa'i sprin rgya mtsho sprul nas sangs rgyas mchod pa'i phyir de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi mchod pa'i sprin rgya mtsho sprul nas sangs rgyas mchod pa'i phyir de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Worship is so called because he emanates clouds of worship, oceans of the gnosis of successful action, and worships the Buddhas.

original: khro bo ni gzung 'dzin la khro bo ste /
analyzed: khro bo ni gzung 'dzin la khro bo ste /
translated: Wrath is so called because he is wrathful toward the subject-object dichotomy.

original: rang gi ngo bo bas de la de skad bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo bas de la de skad bya'o //
translated: His very essence is wrath, so he is so called.

original: khro ba chen po yang dag pa'i khro ba ste /🔽dngos po la phrag dog @82a * //
analyzed: khro ba chen po yang dag pa'i khro ba ste / dngos po la phrag dog @82a * //
translated: Great wrath is the true wrath,

original: pas des tha mal gyi gnyen po byed pa'i phyir na phrin las te de la de skad bya /
analyzed: pas des tha mal gyi gnyen po byed pa'i phyir na phrin las te de la de skad bya /
translated: and he is so called because he is the activity of the Buddhas, the antidote to the ordinary man's envy of things.

original: mchod pa chen po'i tshig gnyis ni 'jam dpal snang ba'i bdag nyid rin chen 'byung ldan gyi mtshan nas bstod pa ste /
analyzed: mchod pa chen po'i tshig gnyis ni 'jam dpal snang ba'i bdag nyid rin chen 'byung ldan gyi mtshan nas bstod pa ste /
translated: The two phrases great worship and great praise are the praise of the name of Ratnasaṃbhava, the nature of the light of Mañjuśrī.

original: mchod pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyis mchod pa'i sprin rgya mtsho sprul nas sangs rgyas mchod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchod pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyis mchod pa'i sprin rgya mtsho sprul nas sangs rgyas mchod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Worship is so called because he emanates clouds of worship, oceans of the worship of equality, and worships the Buddhas.

original: chen po rnams ni mchod pa yang yin chen po yang yin te yon tan gcig tu bsdus pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: chen po rnams ni mchod pa yang yin chen po yang yin te yon tan gcig tu bsdus pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: He is both great and worship, and he is the nature of the collection of one quality.

original: chags pa ni rin po che la chags pa ste /
analyzed: chags pa ni rin po che la chags pa ste /
translated: Attachment is attachment to jewels.

original: ser sna'i bdag nyid las rang gi ngo bo ste de la de skad bya'o //
analyzed: ser sna'i bdag nyid las rang gi ngo bo ste de la de skad bya'o //
translated: It is the essence of miserliness, and it is so called because of that.

original: chags pa thams cad ni rang rang gi ser sna de'i gnyen po yin pas 'jam dpal la de skad bya ste /
analyzed: chags pa thams cad ni rang rang gi ser sna de'i gnyen po yin pas 'jam dpal la de skad bya ste /
translated: Since all attachments are the antidotes to their respective miserlinesses, they are called Mañjuśrī.

original: phrin las kyi sgo nas bos shing bstod pa'o //
analyzed: phrin las kyi sgo nas bos shing bstod pa'o //
translated: This is the praise and invocation in terms of activity.

original: 'dod pa chen po nas mar tshig rkang bcu bzhis ye shes sems dpa' bcu drug gi mtshan ston te /
analyzed: 'dod pa chen po nas mar tshig rkang bcu bzhis ye shes sems dpa' bcu drug gi mtshan ston te /
translated: The next fourteen lines from “great desire” teach the names of the sixteen gnosis beings.

original: 'di rnams la yang so so'i mtshan nyid dang gcig / gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa dang gnyis /
analyzed: 'di rnams la yang so so'i mtshan nyid dang gcig / gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa dang gnyis /
translated: Here, too, there are five topics: the individual characteristics, the reason for the principal and retinue,

original: thabs shes rab kyi 'brel pa dang gsum /
analyzed: thabs shes rab kyi 'brel pa dang gsum /
translated: the connection of method and wisdom,

original: phrin las kyi khyad par dang bzhi /
analyzed: phrin las kyi khyad par dang bzhi /
translated: the particular activities,

original: lam gyi khyad par dang lnga /
analyzed: lam gyi khyad par dang lnga /
translated: the particular paths,

original: sgom thabs dang drug /'bru'i bshad pa dang bdun no //
analyzed: sgom thabs dang drug /'bru'i bshad pa dang bdun no //
translated: the method of meditation, and the explanation of the seed syllables.

original: de la 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid don gyi sgo nas dang rtags kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: de la 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid don gyi sgo nas dang rtags kyi sgo nas so //
translated: The characteristics of these are in terms of the meaning and in terms of the sign.

original: don gyi mtshan nyid ni stong pa bcu drug rtogs /
analyzed: don gyi mtshan nyid ni stong pa bcu drug rtogs /
translated: The definition of the meaning is the realization of the sixteen emptinesses.

original: dgag bya khegs pa'am /
analyzed: dgag bya khegs pa'am /
translated: The object of refutation is refuted,

original: sgro 'dogs bcu drug chod pa gcig la sems dpa' bcu drug ces bya ste /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs bcu drug chod pa gcig la sems dpa' bcu drug ces bya ste /
translated: or the sixteen superimpositions are eliminated.

original: de yang 'dod pa che zhes pa'i tshig gnyis kyis shar phyogs kyi sems dpa' bzhi ston /
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa che zhes pa'i tshig gnyis kyis shar phyogs kyi sems dpa' bzhi ston /
translated: The two phrases “great desire” and so on teach the four bodhisattvas of the east.

original: de la chos can me long lta bus bye brag tu byas pa'i chos nyid stong pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la chos can me long lta bus bye brag tu byas pa'i chos nyid stong pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four emptinesses that are qualified by the mirror-like dharmin.

original: gnyis med gcig po de dag la byin /
analyzed: gnyis med gcig po de dag la byin /
translated: The nondual one is given to them.

original: 'dzin pa'i bsam pas stong sgro 'dogs de chod pa'i sgo nas nang stong pa nyid /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i bsam pas stong sgro 'dogs de chod pa'i sgo nas nang stong pa nyid /
translated: The emptiness of inner is from the perspective of eliminating the superimposition of apprehending with the thought “It is mine.”

original: de bzhin du phyi gzung ba'i yul gyis stong pa'i phyir phyi stong pa nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi gzung ba'i yul gyis stong pa'i phyir phyi stong pa nyid /
translated: Similarly, the emptiness of outer is because the outer object of grasping is empty.

original: bar gyi dbang pos stong pas phyi nang stong pa nyid ;
analyzed: bar gyi dbang pos stong pas phyi nang stong pa nyid ;
translated: The emptiness of outer and inner is because the inner sense organ is empty.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten la lhag par chags pas stong pa chen po stong pa nyid /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten la lhag par chags pas stong pa chen po stong pa nyid /
translated: The emptiness of great emptiness is because of being empty of attachment to the world of the environment.

original: stong pa de bzhi la shar gyi rdo rje sems dpa' rgyal po /
analyzed: stong pa de bzhi la shar gyi rdo rje sems dpa' rgyal po /
translated: Those four emptinesses are the eastern Vajrasattva, the king.

original: chags pa legs pa bzhi bya /🔽rtags kyi mtshan nyid ni thun mong gi mtshan nyid sku mdog bzhugs tshul gdan padma zla ba rang gi bdag po'i @82b dbu rgyan rin po che'i rgyan zhal phyag gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chags pa legs pa bzhi bya / rtags kyi mtshan nyid ni thun mong gi mtshan nyid sku mdog bzhugs tshul gdan padma zla ba rang gi bdag po'i @82b dbu rgyan rin po che'i rgyan zhal phyag gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The four good qualities of attachment are:🔽The definition of the signs is the general definition: the color of the body, the mode of sitting, the seat, the lotus, the moon, the head ornament of one's lord, the ornaments of jewels, the characteristics of the faces and hands.

original: khyad par ni mtshan phyag mchan bzhugs pa'i go rims so //
analyzed: khyad par ni mtshan phyag mchan bzhugs pa'i go rims so //
translated: The special [definition] is the order of the major marks, the minor marks, and the faces and hands.

original: gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa ni /
analyzed: gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa ni /
translated: The appropriateness of the principal and retinue is

original: me long lta bu la rag las sa stong pa bzhi la rag las pa ste gong mas bsgres te shes par bya'o //
analyzed: me long lta bu la rag las sa stong pa bzhi la rag las pa ste gong mas bsgres te shes par bya'o //
translated: the four emptinesses that depend on the mirror-like [wisdom], and so forth. This should be understood by the method of addition.

original: thabs shes rab kyi 'brel pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa shes rab zab pa byams pa la sogs pa thabs te rgya che ba de gnyis zung du 'brel lo //
analyzed: thabs shes rab kyi 'brel pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa shes rab zab pa byams pa la sogs pa thabs te rgya che ba de gnyis zung du 'brel lo //
translated: The connection of method and wisdom is that Vajrasattva and so forth are the profound wisdom, and Maitreya and so forth are the vast method, and those two are connected in pairs.

original: gsang ldan nas shes rab bcu drug zer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang ldan nas shes rab bcu drug zer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the wisdom [consorts] are sixteen years old, and the method [consorts] are twelve years old.

original: phrin las kyi nges pa ni sangs rgyas mchod pa dang 'gro ba'i don bya'o //
analyzed: phrin las kyi nges pa ni sangs rgyas mchod pa dang 'gro ba'i don bya'o //
translated: The ascertainment of activity is to make offerings to the buddhas and to benefit migrating beings.

original: sems dpa' 'di rnams sangs rgyas yin pa la sems dpar 'byung ba'i 'thad pa ni 'bras bu'i ches lngas bsdus pa'i lam mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' 'di rnams sangs rgyas yin pa la sems dpar 'byung ba'i 'thad pa ni 'bras bu'i ches lngas bsdus pa'i lam mtshon pa ste /
translated: The reason for these bodhisattvas being buddhas and yet appearing as bodhisattvas is the path indicated by the fivefold greatness of the result.

original: de la las mtshon pa ni shar phyogs stong pa'i sems dpa'/
analyzed: de la las mtshon pa ni shar phyogs stong pa'i sems dpa'/
translated: The path is indicated by the deeds: the bodhisattva of the east is the bodhisattva of emptiness,

original: lho mtshan ma med pa /
analyzed: lho mtshan ma med pa /
translated: the bodhisattva of the south is the bodhisattva of signlessness,

original: nub gzhan don /
analyzed: nub gzhan don /
translated: the bodhisattva of the west is the bodhisattva of the benefit of others,

original: byang mchod pa'i sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang mchod pa'i sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: and the bodhisattva of the north is the bodhisattva of offering.

original: gang zag gcig 'tshang rgya ba'i thabs sam lam du stong pa nyid rtogs dgos /
analyzed: gang zag gcig 'tshang rgya ba'i thabs sam lam du stong pa nyid rtogs dgos /
translated: In order for a single person to become enlightened, it is necessary to realize emptiness as the method or path.

original: rtogs nas kyang mtshan ma med pa goms dgos /
analyzed: rtogs nas kyang mtshan ma med pa goms dgos /
translated: Having realized that, it is necessary to become familiar with signlessness.

original: mtshan ma med kyang gzhan don ma byas na 'tshang mi rgya bas gzhan don bya dgos /
analyzed: mtshan ma med kyang gzhan don ma byas na 'tshang mi rgya bas gzhan don bya dgos /
translated: Even though there are no signs, if one does not benefit others, one will not become enlightened, so it is necessary to benefit others.

original: gzhan don la gtsor dkon mchog mchod dgos te /
analyzed: gzhan don la gtsor dkon mchog mchod dgos te /
translated: In order to benefit others, it is necessary to make offerings to the Three Jewels.

original: de ni lam mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: de ni lam mtshon pa'o //
translated: That is the indication of the path.

original: sgom thabs man ngag tu shes so //
analyzed: sgom thabs man ngag tu shes so //
translated: The method of meditation is understood as the intimate instruction.

original: de la rdo rje sems dpa' la khyod ni 'dod pa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la rdo rje sems dpa' la khyod ni 'dod pa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: In that, Vajrasattva is called “the one with great desire.”

original: ci'i phyir de skad bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de skad bya zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rdo rje sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje rnams ni stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rtags yin la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje rnams ni stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rtags yin la /
translated: Vajrasattva and Vajrapani are signs of the realization of emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid ni don dam pa byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed pa yin la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni don dam pa byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed pa yin la /
translated: Emptiness is the ultimate generation of the thought of highest enlightenment.

original: sems bskyed kyi mtshan nyid 'dod cing 'dun pa ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed kyi mtshan nyid 'dod cing 'dun pa ste /
translated: The definition of the generation of the thought is desire and aspiration.

original: sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //🔽yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir // yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //
translated: The generation of the thought is for the sake of others.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: It is the desire for perfect complete enlightenment.

original: stong pa nyid de mngon sum du rtogs par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid de mngon sum du rtogs par 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is the desire to realize that emptiness directly.

original: bde ba che zhes pa rdo rje rgyal po la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba che zhes pa rdo rje rgyal po la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Great bliss is what Vajraraja is called.

original: ci'i phyir de skad bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de skad bya zhe na /
translated: Why is he called that?

original: rdo rje rgyal po ni lcags kyu mi gtong ba'i brda ste /
analyzed: rdo rje rgyal po ni lcags kyu mi gtong ba'i brda ste /
translated: Vajraraja is the sign of not letting go of the hook.

original: rdo rje sems dpas stong pa nyid rtogs te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpas stong pa nyid rtogs te /
translated: Vajrasattva realizes emptiness.

original: rgyal pos bsgoms 'dris par byas nas ma btang bas zag med kyi bde ba chen po skye bas de skad bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal pos bsgoms 'dris par byas nas ma btang bas zag med kyi bde ba chen po skye bas de skad bya'o //
translated: The king meditates and familiarizes himself with it and does not let go, so great uncontaminated bliss arises.

original: dga' ba chen po ni rdo rje chags pa la bya ste /
analyzed: dga' ba chen po ni rdo rje chags pa la bya ste /
translated: Great joy is what Vajraraga is called.

original: de ci'i phyir de skad bya @83a * //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir de skad bya @83a * //
translated: Why is it called that?

original: zhe na ; rdo rje rgyal po'i bde ba goms pa de la dga' ba chags pas de skad bya'o //
analyzed: zhe na ; rdo rje rgyal po'i bde ba goms pa de la dga' ba chags pas de skad bya'o //
translated: Because of attachment to the bliss of the vajra king, one is called that.

original: mgu ba ni 'bras bu mngon du gyur pa ste 'bras bu la mgu ba'o //🔽de ni rdo rje legs pa ste mgu ba'i rtags ni se gol ba rdeb pa'o //🔽gzugs chen lus kyang che ba ste //
analyzed: mgu ba ni 'bras bu mngon du gyur pa ste 'bras bu la mgu ba'o // de ni rdo rje legs pa ste mgu ba'i rtags ni se gol ba rdeb pa'o // gzugs chen lus kyang che ba ste //
translated: Satisfaction is the actualization of the result, being satisfied with the result.

original: kha dog che zhing lus bong che ;🔽/ zhes pa na mar tshig rkang bzhis lho phyogs kyi sems dpa' bzhi mtshon te /🔽de la yang so so'i mtshan nyid nas sgom thabs kyi bar du sbyar te /🔽so so'i mtshan nyid ni chos can mnyam pa nyid kyis bye brag tu byas pa'i chos nyid stong pa nyid bzhi ste /
analyzed: kha dog che zhing lus bong che ;🔽/ zhes pa na mar tshig rkang bzhis lho phyogs kyi sems dpa' bzhi mtshon te /🔽de la yang so so'i mtshan nyid nas sgom thabs kyi bar du sbyar te /🔽so so'i mtshan nyid ni chos can mnyam pa nyid kyis bye brag tu byas pa'i chos nyid stong pa nyid bzhi ste /
translated: That is the vajra good, and the sign of satisfaction is the snapping of the fingers.

original: gnyis med gcig po de la dgag byas stong par gzung ba dang / don dam du gzung ba dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs su gzung ba dang / ye shes kyi tshogs su gzung ba rnams kyis stong pa'i stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang /🔽'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid bzhi la lho phyogs kyi sems dpa' rdo rje rin chen /
analyzed: gnyis med gcig po de la dgag byas stong par gzung ba dang / don dam du gzung ba dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs su gzung ba dang / ye shes kyi tshogs su gzung ba rnams kyis stong pa'i stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid bzhi la lho phyogs kyi sems dpa' rdo rje rin chen /
translated: The four emptinesses of the south are the emptiness of the apprehended object, the emptiness of the apprehending subject, the emptiness of the object of refutation, and the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: rdo rje gzi brjid /🔽rdo rje rgyal mtshan /

original: yangs pa'i bar du thams cad du mtshams sbyar te de dang de nas bod pa'o //
analyzed: yangs pa'i bar du thams cad du mtshams sbyar te de dang de nas bod pa'o //
translated: From here on, all the names are connected with the name Mañjuśrī Amitābha, up to vast.

original: gnyis med gcig po la dgag bya sems can gyi don byed pa mtha' dag dang ldan par 'dod pas sems can 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma yod par 'dod pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba phung po lhag bcas dang / lhag med du 'dor bar 'dod pa dang /

translated: Since it is asserted that the single nondual state possesses all the activities for the benefit of sentient beings, the object of refutation is asserted to be the beginning and end of the saṃsāra of sentient beings, the assertion that the roots of virtue are discarded with and without remainder,🔽and the assertion that all phenomena are empty of conditions but not empty by nature.

original: chos thams cad rkyen gyis stong gi rang bzhin gyis mi stong par 'dod pa'i dgag bya de rnams dgag / sgro 'dogs chod par 'dod pa'i stong pa de bzhi la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyi dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang /

translated: Those objects of refutation are refuted in the four emptinesses that are asserted to be the elimination of superimpositions: the emptiness of that which is beyond extremes, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless,

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya /
translated: The emptiness of what is not to be discarded and the emptiness of the nature.

original: de bzhi la 'jam dpal rdo rje chos dang rnon po dang 'khor lo dang smra ba bzhi bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhi la 'jam dpal rdo rje chos dang rnon po dang 'khor lo dang smra ba bzhi bya ste /

original: don gzugs med la gzugs su bya ste /
analyzed: don gzugs med la gzugs su bya ste /

original: don dam gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: don dam gyi mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: rtags kyi mtshan nyid thun mong dang khyad par gong bzhin no //

original: gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa nas /
analyzed: gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa nas /

original: sgom thabs kyi bar du gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sgom thabs kyi bar du gong ma bzhin no //

analyzed: de la 'jam dpal rdo rje chos la 'jam dpal / shes rab mtshon chen 'chang ba po //
translated: Mañjuvajra Dharma is Mañjuśrī.

original: zhes pa bstod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa bstod pa ste /
translated: He is praised as “holding the great weapon of wisdom.”

original: ci'i phyir na de skad bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na de skad bya zhe na /
translated: Why is that so?

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi shes rab kyi mtshon 'chang ba dang / rdo rje 'dzin pas chos nyid rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi shes rab kyi mtshon 'chang ba dang / rdo rje 'dzin pas chos nyid rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he holds the weapon of the wisdom of discerning wisdom and because he is a vajra holder who causes the realization of dharmatā.

original: 'jam dpal rdo rje rnon po la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal rdo rje rnon po la /
translated: Mañjuvajra Sharp is Mañjuśrī.

original: nyon mongs @84a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs @84a * //
translated: He is praised as “the one who cuts the afflictions.”

original: lcags kyi che ba'i mchog / ces pa bstod pa ste /
analyzed: lcags kyi che ba'i mchog / ces pa bstod pa ste /
translated: The great iron hook,

original: ci'i phyir de skad byan /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de skad byan /
translated: Why is it so called?

original: gzhi bsgyur ba dang / spong ba dang / shes pa las 'dir shes rab kyi ye shes kyi lcags kyus nyon mongs pa chos nyid du shes pas gzhi shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhi bsgyur ba dang / spong ba dang / shes pa las 'dir shes rab kyi ye shes kyi lcags kyus nyon mongs pa chos nyid du shes pas gzhi shes pa ste /
translated: Here, the basis is known through the hook of the wisdom of wisdom, since afflictions are known as reality.

original: chen po yang yin mchog kyang yin pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: chen po yang yin mchog kyang yin pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is great and supreme, it is called that.

original: 'jam dpal 'khor lo la grags chen zhes bya /
analyzed: 'jam dpal 'khor lo la grags chen zhes bya /

original: khyod ni snyan grags chen po dang ldan no zhes bstod pa ste /
analyzed: khyod ni snyan grags chen po dang ldan no zhes bstod pa ste /
translated: You are endowed with great fame.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

analyzed: chos kyi 'khor los sems can smin par byed pa las phyir mi ldog pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since sentient beings are ripened by the wheel of dharma and do not turn back, it is so called.

original: 'o na phyin ci log gi grags pa gcig yin nam snyam na snyan pa'i grags pa ste /
analyzed: 'o na phyin ci log gi grags pa gcig yin nam snyam na snyan pa'i grags pa ste /
translated: If it is thought that this is a single fame of error, it is the fame of renown.

analyzed: dkyil 'khor rnam pa bdun gyi 'khor los sgyur bas /
translated: Since the wheel of the seven maṇḍalas is turned,

original: kun la khyab pas grags chen no //
analyzed: kun la khyab pas grags chen no //
translated: it is great fame because it pervades all.

original: 'jam dpal smra ba la khyod ni snang ba chen po zhes bya /
analyzed: 'jam dpal smra ba la khyod ni snang ba chen po zhes bya /

analyzed: gsal ba che zhes mtshan nyid kyi yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa ste /
translated: and the great clarity, praising him in terms of his good qualities of characteristics.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis 'jig rten gsum du khyab pa'i 'od dang ldan pas sems can gyi rgyud la snang bar byed pas de la de skad bya /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis 'jig rten gsum du khyab pa'i 'od dang ldan pas sems can gyi rgyud la snang bar byed pas de la de skad bya /
translated: Since he has light that pervades the three worlds with the dharmadhatu, he illuminates the mind streams of sentient beings, so he is called that.

original: tshig gi nyes pa grva zur chag pa dang / mi gsal ba med pas de la gsal ba che zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gi nyes pa grva zur chag pa dang / mi gsal ba med pas de la gsal ba che zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he has no faults of speech, such as broken or unclear words, he is called the great clarity.

original: mkhas pa zhes pa'i tshig rkang bzhis byang phyogs kyi sems dpa' bzhi'i mtshan 'chad de /
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes pa'i tshig rkang bzhis byang phyogs kyi sems dpa' bzhi'i mtshan 'chad de /
translated: The four lines beginning the wise explain the names of the four bodhisattvas of the north.

original: de yang so so'i mtshan nyid nas /
analyzed: de yang so so'i mtshan nyid nas /
translated: Moreover, they are applied from their individual characteristics

original: sgom thabs kyi bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: sgom thabs kyi bar du sbyar te /

analyzed: de la so so'i mtshan nyid ni chos can bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyis bye brag tu byas pa'i chos nyid stong pa bzhi ste /
translated: As for their individual characteristics, the four emptinesses are the dharmata distinguished by the wisdom of successful activity.

original: de yang gnyis med kyi ye shes gcig po la dgag bya sgro 'dogs sangs rgyas kyi mtshan dang / dpe byad dngos po'i ngo bor 'dod pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dngos po'i ngo bor 'dod pa dang /

translated: Furthermore, the following superimpositions are refuted: the major and minor marks of a buddha as the entity of an existent, all the qualities of a buddha, such as the powers and the fearlessnesses, as the entity of an existent,🔽the self of persons and the self of phenomena as the entity of an existent, and the statement that emptiness does not exist.

original: gang zag gi bdag dang / chos kyi bdag dngos po'i ngo bor 'dod pa dang / stong pa nyid med zer ba rnams dgag / sgro 'dogs de rnams chod pa la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid /
analyzed: gang zag gi bdag dang / chos kyi bdag dngos po'i ngo bor 'dod pa dang / stong pa nyid med zer ba rnams dgag / sgro 'dogs de rnams chod pa la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid /
translated: The four emptinesses—emptiness of its own characteristic,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid /🔽dngos po med pa stong pa nyid /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid /
translated: emptiness of all phenomena,🔽emptiness of nonthings, and emptiness of the entity of nonthings—are to be applied to the four: Mañjuvajra,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang bzhi de bzhi la 'jam dpal rdo rje las dang / srung ba dang / gnod sbyin dang khu tshur dang @84b bzhi bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang bzhi de bzhi la 'jam dpal rdo rje las dang / srung ba dang / gnod sbyin dang khu tshur dang @84b bzhi bya ste /
translated: protection, yakṣa, and fist.

original: gzugs med gzugs can byung ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs med gzugs can byung ba ste /
translated: The formless arises as form.

original: stong pa nyid de bzhi'i sems dpa' de bzhir 'byung /
analyzed: stong pa nyid de bzhi'i sems dpa' de bzhir 'byung /
translated: The four heroes are the four emptinesses.

original: sems dpa' de bzhi stong pa de'i mtshan nyid 'dzin te /
analyzed: sems dpa' de bzhi stong pa de'i mtshan nyid 'dzin te /
translated: The four heroes hold the characteristics of that emptiness.

original: de bzhin du lha thams cad la sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha thams cad la sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, apply this to all the deities.

original: rdo rje ni don gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje ni don gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The vajra is the characteristic of the meaning.

original: rtags ni thun mong dang bye brag ste gong du bstan to //
analyzed: rtags ni thun mong dang bye brag ste gong du bstan to //
translated: The signs are common and specific, as taught above.

original: gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa nas sgom thabs kyi bar du gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa nas sgom thabs kyi bar du gong ma bzhin no //
translated: From the feasibility of the principal and retinue up to the method of meditation, it is the same as above.

original: de la 'jam dpal rdo rje las la khyod ni mkhas pa che zhes sgyu 'phrul 'chang pa po zer /
analyzed: de la 'jam dpal rdo rje las la khyod ni mkhas pa che zhes sgyu 'phrul 'chang pa po zer /
translated: Regarding that, it is said in the Magical Emanation: You are the great expert in the activity of Manjushri Vajra.

original: bstod de ci'i phyir de la de skad bya na /🔽rdo rje las sangs rgyas mchod pa /
analyzed: bstod de ci'i phyir de la de skad bya na / rdo rje las sangs rgyas mchod pa /
translated: Why is he called that?🔽Vajra Karma is the nature of the activity of making offerings to the buddhas and generating merit for sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi bsod nams skyed pa'i phrin las kyi bdag nyid pas de la mkhas pas de skad bya la /
analyzed: sems can gyi bsod nams skyed pa'i phrin las kyi bdag nyid pas de la mkhas pas de skad bya la /
translated: Since he is an expert in that, he is called that.

original: sprul pa'i sgyu ma de 'chad pas de skad do //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sgyu ma de 'chad pas de skad do //
translated: Since he explains that magical emanation, he is called that.

original: rdo rje srung ba la /
analyzed: rdo rje srung ba la /
translated: Regarding Vajra Raksha,🔽it is said:

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po don grub pa //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po don grub pa //
translated: The great magical accomplishment of the meaning.

original: zhes bya / ci zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya / ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: mchod pa 'bul ba la spro bar byed pa'i phrin las kyi bdag nyid dang / rnal 'byor lam le lo can srung ba'o //
analyzed: mchod pa 'bul ba la spro bar byed pa'i phrin las kyi bdag nyid dang / rnal 'byor lam le lo can srung ba'o //
translated: The one with the nature of the activity of delighting in making offerings is the protector of the lazy ones on the path of yoga.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba des gzhan don 'grub pas de skad bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba des gzhan don 'grub pas de skad bya'o //
translated: The Net of Illusory Manifestations is so called because it accomplishes the welfare of others.

original: rdo rje gnod sbyin la /
analyzed: rdo rje gnod sbyin la /
translated: The praise of Vajrayaksha is:

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po dga' bas dga' //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po dga' bas dga' // zhes bya ste /
translated: Great illusion, delighting in joy.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rdo rje gnod sbyin ni dgra zab ste /
analyzed: rdo rje gnod sbyin ni dgra zab ste /

original: srung ba'i phrin las kyi bdag nyid yin pas mchod pa'i bar chad kyi bgegs zhi bar byed /
analyzed: srung ba'i phrin las kyi bdag nyid yin pas mchod pa'i bar chad kyi bgegs zhi bar byed /
translated: Since he has the nature of the activity of protection, he pacifies the obstacles of making offerings.

original: sgyu 'phrul mchod pa sprul /
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul mchod pa sprul /
translated: The illusion of offerings is emanated.

original: bgegs zhi bar spro bas kyang cher dga' ba 'byung bas de skad bya'o //
analyzed: bgegs zhi bar spro bas kyang cher dga' ba 'byung bas de skad bya'o //
translated: Since he delights in pacifying obstacles, he is called the one who is greatly delighted.

original: rdo rje khu tshur la /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur la /
translated: The praise of Vajramuh is:

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po mig 'phrul can //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po mig 'phrul can //
translated: Great illusion, the one with magical eyes.

original: zhes bstod de /
analyzed: zhes bstod de /
translated: What is that?

original: rdo rje khu tshur ni thams cad 'dus pa'i phrin las kyi bdag nyid de mchod pa de rnams stong par ro gcig par byed la /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur ni thams cad 'dus pa'i phrin las kyi bdag nyid de mchod pa de rnams stong par ro gcig par byed la /
translated: Vajramuh is the one with the nature of the activity of gathering everything. He makes those offerings into one taste in emptiness.

original: sgyu 'phrul ni mchod pa sprul /
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul ni mchod pa sprul /
translated: The illusion is the emanation of offerings.

original: chen po ni gcig tu bsdus pa /
analyzed: chen po ni gcig tu bsdus pa /
translated: The great one is the one that is gathered into one.

original: mig 'phrul ni yod pa 'jig pa med pa sprul pas de skad bya'o //
analyzed: mig 'phrul ni yod pa 'jig pa med pa sprul pas de skad bya'o //
translated: The magic is the destruction of existence and the emanation of nonexistence.

original: sbyin bdag ces pa nas mar tshig rkang bzhis sgeg mo la sogs pa gsang ba'i lha mo bzhi'i mtshan bstan te /
analyzed: sbyin bdag ces pa nas mar tshig rkang bzhis sgeg mo la sogs pa gsang ba'i lha mo bzhi'i mtshan bstan te /
translated: The four lines beginning with “the benefactor” indicate the names of the four secret goddesses, such as Lāsyā.

original: mtshan can de'i mtshan nyid thun mong dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid bcu'am bcu gcig brtsi /
analyzed: mtshan can de'i mtshan nyid thun mong dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid bcu'am bcu gcig brtsi /
translated: The characteristics of those with those names are considered to be the general characteristics and the eleven specific characteristics.

original: ci la zer na /
analyzed: ci la zer na /
translated: What are they?

original: kun rdzob tu rtags kyi sgo nas skra dang / nu ma dang / mtshan mas khyad par du byas pa'i sgo la sogs pa nang gi bzhi la shar lho nas rim pa bzhin @85a * //🔽du gnas te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rtags kyi sgo nas skra dang / nu ma dang / mtshan mas khyad par du byas pa'i sgo la sogs pa nang gi bzhi la shar lho nas rim pa bzhin @85a * // du gnas te /
translated: In terms of the relative, the four inner ones, distinguished by hair, breasts, and genitals, are in the southeast, southwest, northwest, and northeast, respectively.

original: 'di ni stobs kyi mtshan nyid de /🔽de rnams kyang sgeg mo ni byang chub kyi sems kyi mchod pa dang ldan pa'i nyams dang / de bzhin du phreng ba ma rin po ches /🔽glu ma glus /
analyzed: 'di ni stobs kyi mtshan nyid de / de rnams kyang sgeg mo ni byang chub kyi sems kyi mchod pa dang ldan pa'i nyams dang / de bzhin du phreng ba ma rin po ches / glu ma glus /
translated: This is the characteristic of strength.

original: gar ma gar gyi sa mchod pa'i nyams dang ldan pa ste rtags so //
analyzed: gar ma gar gyi sa mchod pa'i nyams dang ldan pa ste rtags so //
translated: Those are the characteristics of Lāsyā, who has the experience of possessing the offering of bodhicitta, and similarly, Mālya, who has the experience of offering jewels, Gītā, who has the experience of offering songs, and Nṛtyā, who has the experience of offering dances.

original: don gyi mtshan nyid ni 'dir sbyin pa la sogs pa bzhi btang ba las gong du 'bras bu 'di bzhir 'chad de /
analyzed: don gyi mtshan nyid ni 'dir sbyin pa la sogs pa bzhi btang ba las gong du 'bras bu 'di bzhir 'chad de /
translated: The characteristic of the object is explained here as the four results that arise from the four, such as generosity, and so on.

original: yon tan dang ldan no //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan no //
translated: The four goddesses are endowed with qualities.

original: yang na gnyis med gcig po de nyid la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa bzhi med pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gnyis med gcig po de nyid la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa bzhi med pa'o //
translated: Or, in that very nondual singularity, the four discordant factors, such as miserliness, do not exist.

original: ngos nas sbyin pa la sogs pa bzhir de nyid la lha mo l'a sya ma la sogs pa bzhi bya /
analyzed: ngos nas sbyin pa la sogs pa bzhir de nyid la lha mo l'a sya ma la sogs pa bzhi bya /
translated: From the perspective of the four, such as generosity, the four goddesses, such as Lāsyā, are generated in that very [nondual singularity].

original: bzhi po sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mtshan 'dzin te /
analyzed: bzhi po sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mtshan 'dzin te /
translated: The characteristic of the four, such as generosity, is the apprehension of characteristics.

original: de ni don gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni don gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is the characteristic of the object.

original: 'di rnams ni g-yog mo longs spyod kyi lha mo yin te /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni g-yog mo longs spyod kyi lha mo yin te /
translated: These are the goddesses of wealth, the retinue.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bzang ngan du 'ong ba'i nad ka ni ya kir 'bras bu'i chos la mtshon pa rigs lnga ste shin tu bzang /
analyzed: bzang ngan du 'ong ba'i nad ka ni ya kir 'bras bu'i chos la mtshon pa rigs lnga ste shin tu bzang /
translated: The five families are illustrated by the phenomena of the result, such as the very good and the bad.

original: de thob par byed pa'i lam byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i lam byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas are the path that obtains that.

original: longs spyod kyi lha mo rnams lam gyi grogs te /
analyzed: longs spyod kyi lha mo rnams lam gyi grogs te /
translated: The goddesses of wealth are the companions of the path.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa mi brtsi na des na 'dis lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa gcig go ba'i brda'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa mi brtsi na des na 'dis lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa gcig go ba'i brda'o //
translated: If one does not value morality and so on, then this is the sign that one has understood the path together with its result.

original: 'di rnams la gsang ba'i lha mor 'dogs pa'i 'thad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di rnams la gsang ba'i lha mor 'dogs pa'i 'thad pa ni /
translated: The justification for designating these as secret goddesses is this:

original: me tog la sogs pa phyi'i rdzas yin la /
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa phyi'i rdzas yin la /
translated: Flowers and so on are external substances,

original: 'di ni zag med sems kyi mchod pa de gzhan gyis mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zag med sems kyi mchod pa de gzhan gyis mi mthong ba'o //
translated: but this is an offering of the uncontaminated mind, which others cannot see.🔽The justification for the principal and retinue is this:

original: gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa ni spyi 'khor sum brtsegs pa'i spyi 'khor yin te /
analyzed: gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa ni spyi 'khor sum brtsegs pa'i spyi 'khor yin te /
translated: They are the retinue of the general retinue of the three tiers,

original: 'di rnams gnyis de'i yon tan gyi bye brag yin te /
analyzed: 'di rnams gnyis de'i yon tan gyi bye brag yin te /
translated: and these two are particular qualities of that.

original: sgos 'khor ni mi bskyod pa'i 'khor sgeg mo des bsgres te /
analyzed: sgos 'khor ni mi bskyod pa'i 'khor sgeg mo des bsgres te /
translated: The special retinue is the retinue of Akshobhya, and the special retinue is the retinue of Vairochana.

original: 'di rnams yon tan bye brag pa yin pas spyi la brten /
analyzed: 'di rnams yon tan bye brag pa yin pas spyi la brten /
translated: Since these are particular qualities, they are based on the general.

original: des na rten sa dang brten pas khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: des na rten sa dang brten pas khyad par du byas so //
translated: Therefore, they are distinguished by the basis, the stage, and the supported.

original: thabs shes rab kyi 'brel pa ni 'di la med de g-yog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs shes rab kyi 'brel pa ni 'di la med de g-yog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no connection between method and wisdom here because they are attendants.

original: phrin las ni 'phags pa mchod sems can pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod pa'o //
analyzed: phrin las ni 'phags pa mchod sems can pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod pa'o //
translated: The activity is to make offerings to the noble ones and establish sentient beings in the perfections.

original: sgom thabs gzhan du shes so //
analyzed: sgom thabs gzhan du shes so //
translated: The other methods of meditation are to be understood elsewhere.

original: de yang rang dga' bar bsgom pa ni mchog gi dngos grub tu mi rung gi thun mong man chad sgom du rung ste /
analyzed: de yang rang dga' bar bsgom pa ni mchog gi dngos grub tu mi rung gi thun mong man chad sgom du rung ste /
translated: Moreover, the meditation of one's own delight is not suitable for the supreme attainment, but is suitable for the meditation of the common and lower.

original: slob dpon sangs rgyas gsang ba ni bsgrub pa'i lha rigs lnga sems dpa' bcu @85b drug ste nyi shu rtsa gcig las med par bzhed do //
analyzed: slob dpon sangs rgyas gsang ba ni bsgrub pa'i lha rigs lnga sems dpa' bcu @85b drug ste nyi shu rtsa gcig las med par bzhed do //
translated: The Acarya Buddhaguhya asserts that there are no more than twenty-one deities to be accomplished, namely, the five families and the sixteen bodhisattvas.

original: slob dpon kun dga' snying po ni me tog gang la phog pa di sgom du bzhed do //
analyzed: slob dpon kun dga' snying po ni me tog gang la phog pa di sgom du bzhed do //
translated: The Acarya Nagar-harbha asserts that one should meditate on the deity on which the flower falls.

original: slob dpon sgeg pa'i rdo rje ni longs spyod kyi lha lugs la sgom pa snga ma bzhed do //
analyzed: slob dpon sgeg pa'i rdo rje ni longs spyod kyi lha lugs la sgom pa snga ma bzhed do //
translated: The Acarya Lalitavajra asserts that one should meditate on the deity of the enjoyment mandala as before.

original: de ltar lha mo bzhi po de la so so'i mtshan nyid gsang ba'i lha mor 'thad pa dang / g-yog dang gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa dang / phrin las dang / sgom thabs drug ce'o //🔽de la lha mo 'di rnams ming 'og tu bcug nas mnan te /
analyzed: de ltar lha mo bzhi po de la so so'i mtshan nyid gsang ba'i lha mor 'thad pa dang / g-yog dang gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa dang / phrin las dang / sgom thabs drug ce'o // de la lha mo 'di rnams ming 'og tu bcug nas mnan te /
translated: Thus, there are six topics for each of the four goddesses: the propriety of the secret goddess with her individual characteristics, the propriety of the retinue and the principal one, the activity, and the method of meditation.

original: yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod de /
analyzed: yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod de /
translated: Having placed the names of these goddesses below, one should praise them by way of their good qualities.

original: sgeg mo la khyod kyis sbyin bdag mo chen mo yin no zhes bstod de /🔽ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: sgeg mo la khyod kyis sbyin bdag mo chen mo yin no zhes bstod de / ji ltar zhe na /
translated: You are the great mistress of generosity,

original: dad pas sangs rgyas la sbyin pa dang / thugs rjes sems can la sbyin pa gtong ba'i bdag mo khyod yin pa'i phyir khyod de bskyed par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: dad pas sangs rgyas la sbyin pa dang / thugs rjes sems can la sbyin pa gtong ba'i bdag mo khyod yin pa'i phyir khyod de bskyed par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: because you are the mistress of giving gifts to the Buddha through faith and giving gifts to sentient beings through compassion.🔽Great means completely pure in the three spheres.

original: chen po ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: chen po ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: You are the chief of generosity,🔽because you are the mistress of giving gifts through the four kinds of generosity.🔽You are the great morality,

original: yang sgeg mo la gtso bo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang sgeg mo la gtso bo zhes bya ste /
translated: the supreme bearer,🔽because you are the mistress of giving gifts through the four kinds of generosity.🔽You are the great morality,🔽the supreme bearer,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: because you are the mistress of giving gifts through the four kinds of generosity.🔽You are the great morality,🔽the supreme bearer,

original: sbyin pa rnam pa bzhi gtong ba'i phyir de la dbang bas de skad bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam pa bzhi gtong ba'i phyir de la dbang bas de skad bya'o //
translated: because you are the mistress of giving gifts through the four kinds of generosity.🔽You are the great morality,

original: yang phreng ba ma tshul khrims chen po zhes bya /
analyzed: yang phreng ba ma tshul khrims chen po zhes bya /
translated: the supreme bearer,🔽because you are the mistress of giving gifts through the four kinds of generosity.🔽You are the great morality,

original: 'chang ba'i mchog ces bya /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'chang ba'i mchog ces bya / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: the supreme bearer,🔽because you are the mistress of giving gifts through the four kinds of generosity.

original: tshul khrims gsum las 'dir lus ngag yid sdom pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims gsum las 'dir lus ngag yid sdom pa ste /
translated: You are the great morality,🔽the supreme bearer,🔽because you are the mistress of giving gifts through the four kinds of generosity.🔽You are the great morality,🔽the supreme bearer,

original: de la 'khor gsum dag pa chen po 'chang ba ni de 'dzin pas de skad bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'khor gsum dag pa chen po 'chang ba ni de 'dzin pas de skad bya'o //
translated: because you are the mistress of giving gifts through the four kinds of generosity.🔽You are the great morality,🔽the supreme bearer,🔽because you are the mistress of giving gifts through the four kinds of generosity.🔽You are the great morality,

original: glu ma la /
analyzed: glu ma la /
translated: the supreme bearer,🔽because you are the mistress of giving gifts through the four kinds of generosity.🔽You are the great morality,🔽the supreme bearer,🔽because you are the mistress of giving gifts through the four kinds of generosity.🔽You are the great morality,

original: khyod ni bzod chen brtan pa po //
analyzed: khyod ni bzod chen brtan pa po //
translated: the supreme bearer,🔽because you are the mistress of giving gifts through the four kinds of generosity.🔽You are the great morality,

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: the supreme bearer,🔽because you are the mistress of giving gifts through the four kinds of generosity.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: bzod pa ni gsum las zab mo'i don la bzod cing sran tshugs pa ste /
analyzed: bzod pa ni gsum las zab mo'i don la bzod cing sran tshugs pa ste /
translated: Patience is from among the three, patience and endurance regarding the profound meaning.

original: de yang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa che'o //
analyzed: de yang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa che'o //
translated: Moreover, it is great because it is completely pure of the three spheres.

original: de'i don 'dzin pa ni 'chang ba brtan pa ni mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i don 'dzin pa ni 'chang ba brtan pa ni mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The meaning of that is holding it. Firm is unchanging.

original: gar ma la brtson 'grus chen po zhes pa dang brtul ba yin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gar ma la brtson 'grus chen po zhes pa dang brtul ba yin zhes bya ste /
translated: The one who is diligent in the dance is called one of great effort and one of firm practice.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: 'jig rten 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la spro zhing de rdzogs par byed la 'khor gsum dag pas chen po'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la spro zhing de rdzogs par byed la 'khor gsum dag pas chen po'o //
translated: It is delighting in the roots of virtue that are beyond the world and completing them. It is great because it is completely pure of the three spheres.

original: 'jig rten dang 'das pa'i dkar po'i yon tan thams cad la brtson 'grus kyis rdzogs par byed pas brtul ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'das pa'i dkar po'i yon tan thams cad la brtson 'grus kyis rdzogs par byed pas brtul ba'o //
translated: It is firm practice because it completes all the good qualities of virtue that are beyond the world and of the world through effort.

original: de'i phyir khyod la de skad bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod la de skad bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you are called that.

original: bsam gtan zhes pa'i tshig gnyis dang thabs che ba smon lam rnams kyis phyi'i lha mo bzhi'i mtshan bstan te /
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes pa'i tshig gnyis dang thabs che ba smon lam rnams kyis phyi'i lha mo bzhi'i mtshan bstan te /
translated: The two words “concentration” and “great method” and “prayer” indicate the names of the four outer goddesses.

original: shes rab dang go bsnur la bshad /
analyzed: shes rab dang go bsnur la bshad /
translated: Wisdom is explained as “pliancy.”

original: 'di rnams la'ang drug 'bru bshad pa dang bdun te /
analyzed: 'di rnams la'ang drug 'bru bshad pa dang bdun te /
translated: These are also six or seven,

original: mtshan nyid kun rdzob te @86a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kun rdzob te @86a * //
translated: the characteristics are conventional,

original: mtshan ma la sogs pa'i khyad par du byas pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma la sogs pa'i khyad par du byas pa'o //
translated: distinguished by signs and so forth.

original: bskal bzang gi grva bzhi'i shar lho nas rim pas spos me tog mar me dri chab bzhi /
analyzed: bskal bzang gi grva bzhi'i shar lho nas rim pas spos me tog mar me dri chab bzhi /
translated: In the four corners of the fortunate aeon, from the southeast, in order, are the four: incense, flowers, lamps, and perfume.

original: de bzhis mchod pa'i nyams dang ldan pa'i lha mo //
analyzed: de bzhis mchod pa'i nyams dang ldan pa'i lha mo //
translated: These four are goddesses endowed with the experience of worship.

original: shes rab chen po lus 'chang ba //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan can du byung la /
analyzed: shes rab chen po lus 'chang ba // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan can du byung la /
translated: Having a body of great wisdom and so forth.

original: don gyi sgo nas 'dir de bzhis sangs rgyas mchod pas 'bras bu de bzhir shar te yon tan yar ldan no //
analyzed: don gyi sgo nas 'dir de bzhis sangs rgyas mchod pas 'bras bu de bzhir shar te yon tan yar ldan no //
translated: In terms of meaning, here the four results arise from worshiping the Buddha with those four, and the qualities are successively higher.

original: de bzhi der byung ba de'i mtshan nyid 'dzin no //
analyzed: de bzhi der byung ba de'i mtshan nyid 'dzin no //
translated: Those four arise there, and they hold the characteristics of that.

original: yang na gnyis med gcig po de la shes rab 'chang ba dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / thabs chung ba dang ; log pa'i smon lam la sogs pa med de /
analyzed: yang na gnyis med gcig po de la shes rab 'chang ba dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / thabs chung ba dang ; log pa'i smon lam la sogs pa med de /
translated: Or, in that nondual unity, there is no holding of wisdom, no distraction, no small means, no perverse aspirations, and so forth.

original: de bzhi'i gnyen por shes rab bsam gtan thabs yang dag pa'i smon lam rnams su 'byung la de bzhi la lha mo bzhi bya /
analyzed: de bzhi'i gnyen por shes rab bsam gtan thabs yang dag pa'i smon lam rnams su 'byung la de bzhi la lha mo bzhi bya /
translated: The four goddesses are the antidotes to those four.

original: de bzhi de'i mtshan nyid 'dzin te don gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhi de'i mtshan nyid 'dzin te don gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: They are called goddesses because they hold the characteristics of those four, which are the characteristics of the objects.

original: longs spyod kyi lha dang / phyi'i lha mor bzhag pa dang / las med de longs spyod yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi lha dang / phyi'i lha mor bzhag pa dang / las med de longs spyod yin no //
translated: The goddesses of enjoyment and the goddesses outside are not included because they are not antidotes.

original: gtso 'khor dang / sgom thabs rnams gong dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gtso 'khor dang / sgom thabs rnams gong dang 'dra'o //
translated: The method of meditation and the principal and retinue are the same as above.

original: de la lha mo dh'uppe ma la khyod ni /
analyzed: de la lha mo dh'uppe ma la khyod ni /
translated: To the goddess Dhūpā, you are praised as having the following qualities:

original: shes rab chen po lus 'chang ba //🔽zhes pa'i yon tan dang ldan no zhes bstod de /
analyzed: shes rab chen po lus 'chang ba // zhes pa'i yon tan dang ldan no zhes bstod de /
translated: You hold the body of great wisdom.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyis chos thams cad rab tu 'byed pa'i lus can ni dh'uppe ma yin la /
analyzed: shes rab kyis chos thams cad rab tu 'byed pa'i lus can ni dh'uppe ma yin la /
translated: Dhūpā has a body that thoroughly distinguishes all phenomena through wisdom.

original: shes rab de 'chang ba'i shes rab kyi gnyen po yin pas chen po yang yin no //
analyzed: shes rab de 'chang ba'i shes rab kyi gnyen po yin pas chen po yang yin no //
translated: That wisdom is great because it is the antidote to wisdom.

original: de'i lus 'dzin pas na dh'uppe ma de la de skad bya'o //
analyzed: de'i lus 'dzin pas na dh'uppe ma de la de skad bya'o //
translated: Dhūpā is so called because she holds that body.

original: me tog ma la /
analyzed: me tog ma la /
translated: To the goddess Puṣpā, you are praised as having the following qualities:

original: bsam gtan chen po ting 'dzin gnas //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan chen po ting 'dzin gnas // zhes bya ste /
translated: Great meditation, the state of samadhi.🔽This is what it says.
