original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: me tog ma khyod ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsam gtan gyi ngo bo rnam g-yeng gi gnyen por 'dug ste /
analyzed: me tog ma khyod ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsam gtan gyi ngo bo rnam g-yeng gi gnyen por 'dug ste /
translated: You, Puspe, are the essence of supramundane meditation, the antidote to distraction.

original: chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gong ma de mi gtong ba'i phyir du pushpe ma la de skad bya'o //
analyzed: chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gong ma de mi gtong ba'i phyir du pushpe ma la de skad bya'o //
translated: You are called Puspe because you do not give up the great samadhi that is above.

original: mar me ma la thabs che zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mar me ma la thabs che zhes bya ste /
translated: To Alokini, the method is great.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: thabs ma lus pas sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: thabs ma lus pas sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa rdzogs par byed de /
translated: With all the methods, you fulfill the wishes of all sentient beings.

original: thabs chung ba'i mi mthun pa med cing de'i gnyen po bas de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: thabs chung ba'i mi mthun pa med cing de'i gnyen po bas de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: You are called Alokini because you are the antidote to the discordant factor of having a small method.

original: dri chab ma la bsam pa'i zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dri chab ma la bsam pa'i zhes bya ste /
translated: To Gandhe, the intention.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsam pa ni smon lam la bya la /
analyzed: bsam pa ni smon lam la bya la /
translated: The intention is aspiration.

original: yang dag pa'i smon lam gyis phyin ci log gi smon pa'i @86b gnyen por gyur pa'i cha nas de skad bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i smon lam gyis phyin ci log gi smon pa'i @86b gnyen por gyur pa'i cha nas de skad bya'o //
translated: You are called Gandhe because you are the antidote to the aspiration of error through the aspect of the correct aspiration.

original: stobs po che la zhes bya ba /
analyzed: stobs po che la zhes bya ba /
translated: To Mahabala, the power.

original: ye shes rgya mtsho zhes pa sgo ba bzhi'i mtshan ston te /
analyzed: ye shes rgya mtsho zhes pa sgo ba bzhi'i mtshan ston te /
translated: The “ocean of pristine consciousness” indicates the names of the four gatekeepers.

original: 'di rnams mtshan nyid ni lcags kyu la sogs pa sgo ba bzhi thun mong dang / bye brag gi sgo nas kun rdzob ste rtags kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di rnams mtshan nyid ni lcags kyu la sogs pa sgo ba bzhi thun mong dang / bye brag gi sgo nas kun rdzob ste rtags kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The common and specific characteristics of the four gatekeepers, such as the hook, are the conventional characteristics of the signs.

original: don gyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: don gyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The ultimate characteristics are as follows:🔽Here, the four—faith, effort, mindfulness, and samādhi—are cultivated.

original: 'dir dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang bzhi rnams bsgoms pas gong du tshogs lam /
analyzed: 'dir dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang bzhi rnams bsgoms pas gong du tshogs lam /
translated: The qualities of the four—the path of accumulation,

original: sbyor lam / mthong lam /
analyzed: sbyor lam / mthong lam /
translated: the path of preparation, the path of seeing,

original: bsgom lam bzhi'i yon tan yar ldan du 'byung /
analyzed: bsgom lam bzhi'i yon tan yar ldan du 'byung /
translated: and the path of cultivation—arise in succession.

original: de la sgo ba bzhi 'byung /
analyzed: de la sgo ba bzhi 'byung /
translated: The four gatekeepers arise from that.

original: de'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'am /
translated: Their characteristics are held to be🔽or, alternatively, the four—faith, effort, mindfulness, and samādhi—are cultivated on the two paths of preparation, heat, and peak.

original: yang na sbyor lam gyi drod rtse mo gnyis la dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / de rnams bsgoms pas sems ma dad pa /
analyzed: yang na sbyor lam gyi drod rtse mo gnyis la dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / de rnams bsgoms pas sems ma dad pa /
translated: Since those are cultivated, the mind is not faithful,🔽lazy,

original: le lo // mi dran pa /🔽rnam g-yeng ba'i phyogs su 'dug la /
analyzed: le lo // mi dran pa / rnam g-yeng ba'i phyogs su 'dug la /
translated: unmindful,🔽and distracted.

original: des dad pa /
analyzed: des dad pa /
translated: Faith,🔽effort,🔽mindfulness,

original: brtson 'grus / dran pa /
analyzed: brtson 'grus / dran pa /
translated: and samādhi🔽are the four gatekeepers.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi gnyen po bzhi kha drag par 'dug pas de rnams kyi dus na ni dbang po bzhi zhes bya la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi gnyen po bzhi kha drag par 'dug pas de rnams kyi dus na ni dbang po bzhi zhes bya la /
translated: Since the four antidotes of concentration are strong, at the time of those, they are called the four faculties.

original: bzod pa dang chos mchog gi dus na ma dad pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa med de /
analyzed: bzod pa dang chos mchog gi dus na ma dad pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa med de /
translated: At the time of acceptance and the supreme mundane state, there is no lack of faith and so on, which are incompatible.

original: gnyen po dad pa la sogs pa bzhi po sha stag tu 'dug pas dad pa la sogs pa stobs bzhi'o //
analyzed: gnyen po dad pa la sogs pa bzhi po sha stag tu 'dug pas dad pa la sogs pa stobs bzhi'o //
translated: Since only the four antidotes, faith and so on, are present, they are the four powers of faith and so on.

original: de bzhi la sgo bzhi bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhi la sgo bzhi bya ste /
translated: Those four are called the four doors.

original: mtshan gnyis las med kyang don bzhi chang tshang ste /
analyzed: mtshan gnyis las med kyang don bzhi chang tshang ste /
translated: Although there are only two genders, the four meanings are complete.

original: stobs dang / dad pa tshogs lam gyi ye shes sgo ba lcags kyu /
analyzed: stobs dang / dad pa tshogs lam gyi ye shes sgo ba lcags kyu /
translated: Faith is the power of the wisdom of the path of accumulation, the door guardian is the iron hook.

original: de bzhin du brtson 'grus sbyor lam gyi ye shes sgo ba zhags pa /🔽dran pa mthong lam gyi ye shes sgo ba lcags sgrog ting nge 'dzin stobs /
analyzed: de bzhin du brtson 'grus sbyor lam gyi ye shes sgo ba zhags pa / dran pa mthong lam gyi ye shes sgo ba lcags sgrog ting nge 'dzin stobs /
translated: Similarly, diligence is the wisdom of the path of application, the door guardian is the lasso.

original: bsgom lam gyi ye shes /🔽sgo ba ni dril bu zhes bya'o //🔽rdo rje ni don gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bsgom lam gyi ye shes /🔽sgo ba ni dril bu zhes bya'o //🔽rdo rje ni don gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Mindfulness is the wisdom of the path of seeing, the door guardian is the chain, and concentration is the power.

original: gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa nas sgom thabs kyi bar du snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa nas sgom thabs kyi bar du snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The explanation of the retinue, the reason for the principal one, and so on, up to the method of meditation are the same as before.

original: byams chen rang bzhin zhes pa nas mar tshig rkang drug gis thabs kyi bskal bzang gi sems dpa'i mtshan te /
analyzed: byams chen rang bzhin zhes pa nas mar tshig rkang drug gis thabs kyi bskal bzang gi sems dpa'i mtshan te /
translated: The six lines beginning with “the nature of great love” are the names of the bodhisattvas of the method good eon.

original: 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid kun rdzob kyi sgo nas ni thun mong khyad par gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid kun rdzob kyi sgo nas ni thun mong khyad par gnyis te /
translated: The characteristics of these [bodhisattvas] are the general and specific characteristics from the perspective of the relative.

original: de la mtshan ni phyag mtshan rang rang bdag pos dbu brgyan /
analyzed: de la mtshan ni phyag mtshan rang rang bdag pos dbu brgyan /
translated: The name is the hand implement, and the crown is the individual master.

original: sku mdog ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: sku mdog ni khyad par ro //
translated: The color of the body is the specific [characteristic].

original: bzhugs tshul gdan rgyan phrin las rnams thun mong ste /🔽phyogs kyi sku mdog dang / phyogs kyi phyag mtshan @87a * //
analyzed: bzhugs tshul gdan rgyan phrin las rnams thun mong ste / phyogs kyi sku mdog dang / phyogs kyi phyag mtshan @87a * //
translated: The mode of sitting, ornaments, and activity are general.

original: sngon po dang / rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang / rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: The color of the body of the direction and the hand implement of the direction are blue and the vajra, and so on.

original: don gyi mtshan nyid ni gnyis med kyi ye shes gcig la ldog pa'i bye brag gis ye shes lnga /
analyzed: don gyi mtshan nyid ni gnyis med kyi ye shes gcig la ldog pa'i bye brag gis ye shes lnga /
translated: The characteristic of the meaning is the five pristine consciousnesses in one nondual pristine consciousness.

original: de la ldog pa'i bye brag gis stong pa bcu drug / de la shes rab kyi sems dpa' bcu drug bya la /
analyzed: de la ldog pa'i bye brag gis stong pa bcu drug / de la shes rab kyi sems dpa' bcu drug bya la /
translated: The sixteen emptinesses are distinguished by their different aspects.

original: bskal bzang 'di rnams ni stong pa bcu drug la dmigs pa'i rig pa ste /
analyzed: bskal bzang 'di rnams ni stong pa bcu drug la dmigs pa'i rig pa ste /
translated: The sixteen wisdom beings are the wisdom beings, and the sixteen good kalpas are the method beings.🔽The sixteen wisdom beings are the wisdom beings, and the sixteen good kalpas are the method beings.🔽The wisdom beings are the sixteen from the wisdom of inner emptiness to the wisdom of the emptiness of the essential nature of nonthings.🔽The method beings are the sixteen from the good kalpa of the first to the good kalpa of the sixteenth.

original: nang stong pa nyid rig pa nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid rig pa'i bar du bcu drug la thabs kyi sems dpa' bcu drug gzhag / rig pa de rnams der byung ste /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid rig pa nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid rig pa'i bar du bcu drug la thabs kyi sems dpa' bcu drug gzhag / rig pa de rnams der byung ste /
translated: The wisdoms arise from those.

original: de nyid de'i mtshan nyid 'dzin de ni don dam gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid de'i mtshan nyid 'dzin de ni don dam gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is the definition of that.

original: gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa dang / lam brtson pa dang / phrin las kyi khyad par dang / sgom thabs rnams gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gtso 'khor gyi 'thad pa dang / lam brtson pa dang / phrin las kyi khyad par dang / sgom thabs rnams gong ma bzhin no //
translated: The reason for the principal and retinue, the path, the diligence, the special activities, and the method of meditation are the same as above.

original: thabs shes rab kyi 'brel pa ni /
analyzed: thabs shes rab kyi 'brel pa ni /
translated: The connection between method and wisdom is as follows.

original: shes rab kyi sems dpa' bcu drug la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi sems dpa' bcu drug la /
translated: The sixteen wisdom beings are the wisdom beings.

original: thad kha thad khar dmigs shing 'brel lo //
analyzed: thad kha thad khar dmigs shing 'brel lo //
translated: They are connected with and focus on the sixteen good kalpas.

original: byams chen zhes pa nas mar sems can bde ba la dgod pa'o //
analyzed: byams chen zhes pa nas mar sems can bde ba la dgod pa'o //
translated: The sixteen good kalpas are the method beings.🔽The sixteen good kalpas are the method beings.

original: rang bzhin ni de'i dus su skye med du rtogs shing dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni de'i dus su skye med du rtogs shing dmigs pa'o //
translated: Nature is the realization and observation of non-arising at that time.

original: dpag tu med pa ni skye med du dmigs shing 'jig rten thams cad la bu gcig pa ltar byams pa rgyun mi gcod de des na byams pa la de skad bya'o //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa ni skye med du dmigs shing 'jig rten thams cad la bu gcig pa ltar byams pa rgyun mi gcod de des na byams pa la de skad bya'o //
translated: Immeasurable is the observation of non-arising and the uninterrupted love for all worlds like a single child. Therefore, love is called that.

original: snying rje chen po zhes pa 'jam dpal ni mi dmigs pa'i thabs thugs rje chen pos sems can gyi don byed pas rgya che ba dang / blo'i mchog ces pa skye med kyi blos gnyis med du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po zhes pa 'jam dpal ni mi dmigs pa'i thabs thugs rje chen pos sems can gyi don byed pas rgya che ba dang / blo'i mchog ces pa skye med kyi blos gnyis med du rtogs pa ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, great compassion is called vast due to the great compassion of non-apprehending means accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings, and supreme mind is the realization of non-duality with the mind of non-arising.

original: khyod ni zab pa dang rgya che ba'i mtshan nyid can no zhes bstod do //
analyzed: khyod ni zab pa dang rgya che ba'i mtshan nyid can no zhes bstod do //
translated: You are praised as having the characteristics of profundity and vastness.

original: shes rab chen po blo chen ldan zhes pa spos kyi glang po la de skad bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab chen po blo chen ldan zhes pa spos kyi glang po la de skad bya ste /
translated: Great wisdom, possessing great mind is calling to the elephant of incense.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyod ni chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab kyi bdag nyid la de skad bya la /
analyzed: khyod ni chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab kyi bdag nyid la de skad bya la /
translated: You are called that in the nature of wisdom that thoroughly differentiates all phenomena.

original: de'i khyod ni blo chen po dang ldan pa zhes kyang bstod do //
analyzed: de'i khyod ni blo chen po dang ldan pa zhes kyang bstod do //
translated: You are also praised as having great intelligence.

original: khyod ni mkhas pa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: khyod ni mkhas pa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: You are called a great scholar.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: dbang po rab 'bring tha ma'i sgo nas sems can 'dul ba'i thabs la mkhas pas de skad bya la /
analyzed: dbang po rab 'bring tha ma'i sgo nas sems can 'dul ba'i thabs la mkhas pas de skad bya la /
translated: You are called that because you are skilled in the means of training sentient beings from the point of view of their superior, middling, and inferior faculties.

original: nyon mongs pa bag la nyal dang mthun pa'i chos ston pas thabs che ba zhes kyang bstod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bag la nyal dang mthun pa'i chos ston pas thabs che ba zhes kyang bstod do //
translated: You are also praised as having great skillful means because you teach the Dharma in accordance with the latent afflictions.

original: bzang skyong la /🔽rdzu 'phrul chen po stobs dang ldan //
analyzed: bzang skyong la / rdzu 'phrul chen po stobs dang ldan //
translated: To Bhadrapāla,

original: zhes bstod de /
analyzed: zhes bstod de /
translated: you are praised as having great magical power and strength.

original: rkang mtheb sen mos tshangs pa'i @87b g-yul sa gnon pa la sogs pa'i stobs sam rdzu 'phrul de mnga' ba'i phyir de skad bya'o //
analyzed: rkang mtheb sen mos tshangs pa'i @87b g-yul sa gnon pa la sogs pa'i stobs sam rdzu 'phrul de mnga' ba'i phyir de skad bya'o //
translated: You are called that because you possess the strength or magical power of pressing the battlefield of Brahmā with your toenail.🔽To Mahāmati,

original: blo gros chen po la mgyogs pa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po la mgyogs pa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: you are called Mahājava, the great speed,

original: sangs rgyas mchod pa dang srid zhu'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams du mar bskyod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mchod pa dang srid zhu'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams du mar bskyod pa'i phyir /
translated: because you travel to many world systems to worship the buddhas and to serve them.

original: shugs chen zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: shugs chen zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are you called Mahāvega, the great force?

original: ye shes kyi shugs drag pos 'gro ba'i phyir de skad bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi shugs drag pos 'gro ba'i phyir de skad bya'o //
translated: He is called that because he goes with the power of knowledge.

original: blo gros mi zad pa la rdzu 'phrul chen po zhes bstod de /
analyzed: blo gros mi zad pa la rdzu 'phrul chen po zhes bstod de /
translated: Akṣayamati is praised as having great magical power.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig rten dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he perfects the accumulations of merit and knowledge of the world, of the śrāvakas, and of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: khyod ni cher grags pa zhes kyang bya ste ;
analyzed: khyod ni cher grags pa zhes kyang bya ste ;
translated: He is also called the greatly renowned one.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽spobs pa brtsegs pa la khyod ni /🔽stobs chen pha rol gnon pa po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro // spobs pa brtsegs pa la khyod ni / stobs chen pha rol gnon pa po //
translated: Because he perfects the accumulations of merit and knowledge of the buddhas.🔽Pratibhānakūṭa is called

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: the one with great strength, the one with great power.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa la sogs pa stobs bcu nyan thos la sogs ba zil gyis gnon phyir de skad bya'o //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa la sogs pa stobs bcu nyan thos la sogs ba zil gyis gnon phyir de skad bya'o //
translated: Because he surpasses the śrāvakas and so forth with the ten powers such as the knowledge of what is possible and impossible.🔽Mahāstamat

original: mthu chen thob la /🔽srid pa'i ri bo chen po 'joms //
analyzed: mthu chen thob la / srid pa'i ri bo chen po 'joms //
translated: is called

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: the one who destroys the great mountain of existence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: srid pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga 'jig dka' bas brag ri dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: srid pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga 'jig dka' bas brag ri dang 'dra ste /
translated: The five aggregates appropriated in cyclic existence are like a rocky mountain, difficult to destroy.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes thob nas 'joms pa ste /🔽khyod ni de dang ldan pa'i phyir de skad ces brjod do //🔽ngan song kun 'dren la /🔽mkhregs shing rdo rje chen po 'chang //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes thob nas 'joms pa ste / khyod ni de dang ldan pa'i phyir de skad ces brjod do // ngan song kun 'dren la / mkhregs shing rdo rje chen po 'chang //
translated: But once you attain authentic wisdom, you destroy them.

original: zhes bstod de /🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bstod de / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: You are praised as “Vajra Holder” because you possess that wisdom.

original: khyod ni kun du bzang po'i ye shes kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: khyod ni kun du bzang po'i ye shes kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa ste /
translated: You are praised as “Universal Good” because you are the vajra holder of the wisdom of universal goodness.

original: de yang gzung 'dzin gyis mi phyed pas sra ba'i lus dang ldan pas na mkhregs zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de yang gzung 'dzin gyis mi phyed pas sra ba'i lus dang ldan pas na mkhregs zhes brjod de /
translated: You are praised as “Great Fierce One” because you have a body that is solid and holds the vajra.

original: mya ngan dang mun pa thams cad 'joms pa'i blo gros la drag po chen po zhes bya ste /🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽khyod ni gdul dka' ba'i gdul bya la khro bor sprul pa'i phyir de skad bya la /
analyzed: mya ngan dang mun pa thams cad 'joms pa'i blo gros la drag po chen po zhes bya ste / ci'i phyir zhe na / khyod ni gdul dka' ba'i gdul bya la khro bor sprul pa'i phyir de skad bya la /
translated: You are praised as “Great Fierce One” because you have a mind that destroys all sorrow and darkness.🔽You are praised as “Great Fierce One” because you emanate as wrathful deities for those to be tamed who are difficult to tame.🔽You are praised as “Great Fierce One” because you tame through the fierceness of your wrath.

original: bcos pa'i drag shul gyis 'dul ba'i phyir ro //🔽dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: bcos pa'i drag shul gyis 'dul ba'i phyir ro //🔽dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: You are praised as “Great Fierce One” because you tame through the fierceness of your wrath.🔽You are praised as “Great Fierce One” because you tame through the fierceness of your wrath.🔽You are praised as “Great Fierce One” because you tame through the fierceness of your wrath.

original: 'jigs chen 'jigs par byed pa po //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jigs chen 'jigs par byed pa po // zhes bya ste /
translated: The great fear, the one who causes fear.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de yang 'jigs chen ni lha gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang 'jigs chen ni lha gsum ste /
translated: The great fear is the three gods:

original: tshangs pas sa bla ma h'a de bas sa steng khyab 'jug gis sa 'og 'jigs te /
analyzed: tshangs pas sa bla ma h'a de bas sa steng khyab 'jug gis sa 'og 'jigs te /
translated: Brahma is above the earth, Mahesha is on the earth, and Vishnu is below the earth.

original: khyod ni de gsum yang 'jigs par byed pa po yin pa'i phyir de skad brjod do //🔽zla @88a * //
analyzed: khyod ni de gsum yang 'jigs par byed pa po yin pa'i phyir de skad brjod do // zla @88a * //
translated: You are the one who causes fear to those three, hence the expression.

original: 'od gzhon nu la mgon po zhes bstod de /
analyzed: 'od gzhon nu la mgon po zhes bstod de /
translated: The youthful Candraprabha is praised as the protector.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gsang sngags kyi theg pa ni theg pa'i mchog ste /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi theg pa ni theg pa'i mchog ste /
translated: The mantra vehicle is the supreme vehicle,

original: sems can skyob pa'i phyir de skad bya la /
analyzed: sems can skyob pa'i phyir de skad bya la /
translated: because it protects sentient beings, hence the expression.

original: de la ni rigs mchog chen po zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: de la ni rigs mchog chen po zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: And it is also called the great supreme lineage,

original: dha ra zhes pa'i sgra rigs bzung ba dang 'chang ba dang 'dzin pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: dha ra zhes pa'i sgra rigs bzung ba dang 'chang ba dang 'dzin pa la 'jug ste /
translated: because the term dhara refers to lineage, holding, and upholding.

original: 'dir ni tshig don sngags phyag rgya gzhung bzhis sems can skyong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir ni tshig don sngags phyag rgya gzhung bzhis sems can skyong ba'i phyir /
translated: Here, it is called that because it protects sentient beings through the four texts of mantra, mudra, and meaning,

original: mchog dang chen po yang yin pas de skad brjod do //
analyzed: mchog dang chen po yang yin pas de skad brjod do //
translated: and because it is supreme and great.

original: 'od dpag med la bla ma zhes bstod de /
analyzed: 'od dpag med la bla ma zhes bstod de /
translated: He praises Amitabha as the Guru,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: saying, “Why is that?

original: khyod ni sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa'am dbang po rab 'bring dang sbyar nas /
analyzed: khyod ni sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa'am dbang po rab 'bring dang sbyar nas /
translated: You know the inclinations of all sentient beings, or their faculties, whether they are superior, middling, or inferior,

original: nyon mongs pa bag la nyal dang ji ltar 'tsham pa bzhin du shes nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bag la nyal dang ji ltar 'tsham pa bzhin du shes nas /
translated: and you know their afflictions, whether they are manifest or dormant,

original: de dang de'i lam nye bar ston pa'i phyir de skad bya la /
analyzed: de dang de'i lam nye bar ston pa'i phyir de skad bya la /
translated: and you teach them the path that is appropriate for each of them.

original: de yang skye med kyi rtog pa dang mi 'bral bas gsang sngags che ba'i mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang skye med kyi rtog pa dang mi 'bral bas gsang sngags che ba'i mchog ces bya'o //
translated: And you are never separate from the realization of the unborn, so you are the supreme of the great secret ones.”

original: nam mkha' mdzod la /🔽theg pa chen po'i tshul la gnas //
analyzed: nam mkha' mdzod la / theg pa chen po'i tshul la gnas //
translated: He praises Akashagarbha,

original: zhes bstod de /
analyzed: zhes bstod de /
translated: saying, “You abide in the way of the Mahayana.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyod ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa'i lam la gnas la tshul ni bgrod pa dang / bzhon pa dang / lam de la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir de skad brjod do //
analyzed: khyod ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa'i lam la gnas la tshul ni bgrod pa dang / bzhon pa dang / lam de la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir de skad brjod do //
translated: You abide in the path of the perfection vehicle, and the way is the vehicle, the mount, and the path that you abide in.

original: sgrib pa sel ba la /
analyzed: sgrib pa sel ba la /
translated: He praises Nivaranavishkambhin,

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi mchog / ces bstod de /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi mchog / ces bstod de /
translated: saying, “You are the supreme of the way of the Mahayana.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gsang sngags kyi theg pa ni theg pa'i mchog ste /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi theg pa ni theg pa'i mchog ste /
translated: The vehicle of the secret mantra is the supreme vehicle.

original: skye med kyi don zab mo rtogs pas 'khor 'das mi phyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye med kyi don zab mo rtogs pas 'khor 'das mi phyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it realizes the profound meaning of non-arising, samsara and nirvana are indivisible.

original: gzhi shes pas mchog go //
analyzed: gzhi shes pas mchog go //
translated: It is supreme because it knows the basis.

original: de lta bu'i don ni 'jam dpal sgrib pa sel ba nyid yin no zhes yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don ni 'jam dpal sgrib pa sel ba nyid yin no zhes yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: Such a meaning is Mañjuśrī himself, the Dispeller of Obstacles. Thus, it is praised in terms of its qualities.

original: de lta bu khyod lags so zhes kun la sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta bu khyod lags so zhes kun la sbyar ro //
translated: You are such a one is applied to all.

original: de la 'dir theg pa zer nas theg pa'i rnam pa gzhan cig kyang gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir theg pa zer nas theg pa'i rnam pa gzhan cig kyang gzhag ste /
translated: In that way, here it is called a vehicle, and another aspect of the vehicle is presented.

original: theg pa'i ngo bo ni shes rab kyi rtog pa'i khyad par dang / thugs rjes gzhan don byed mi byed dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: theg pa'i ngo bo ni shes rab kyi rtog pa'i khyad par dang / thugs rjes gzhan don byed mi byed dang sbyar ro //
translated: The essence of the vehicle is connected with the special realization of wisdom and whether or not the benefit of others is accomplished through compassion.

original: byed pa ni rgyu'i rang bzhin gyi theg pa dang rten nam thabs kyi rang bzhin de /
analyzed: byed pa ni rgyu'i rang bzhin gyi theg pa dang rten nam thabs kyi rang bzhin de /
translated: The agent is the vehicle of the nature of the cause and the support or method.

original: bskyed rim 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang rdzogs rim 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed rim 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang rdzogs rim 'das pa'o //
translated: The generation stage is the mundane samādhi, and the completion stage is the transcendent.

original: thob par bya ba dang dmigs pa'i yul de 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba dang dmigs pa'i yul de 'bras bu'o //
translated: The object of attainment and the object of observation are the result.

original: yang rgyu'am / gzhi /
analyzed: yang rgyu'am / gzhi /
translated: Again, the cause or basis is the vehicle of the cause.

original: lam / 'bras bu yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: lam / 'bras bu yang sbyar ro //
translated: The path and the result are also applied.

original: sgra 'jug pa'i @88b rgyu mtshan ni 'dis 'dod /
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i @88b rgyu mtshan ni 'dis 'dod /
translated: The reason for the usage of the term is that this is desired.

original: 'dir 'dod pas theg pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'dod pas theg pa'o //
translated: Since it is desired here, it is the vehicle.

original: chen po la dbye na phan pa chen po ster bas che ste /
analyzed: chen po la dbye na phan pa chen po ster bas che ste /
translated: When divided, it is great because it bestows great benefit.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: dmigs pa / bsgrub pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa / bsgrub pa /
translated: The great object, the great practice,

original: ye shes / brtson 'grus /
analyzed: ye shes / brtson 'grus /
translated: the great wisdom, the great diligence,

original: thabs / yang dag par bsgrub pa /
analyzed: thabs / yang dag par bsgrub pa /
translated: the great method, the great accomplishment,

original: phrin las che zhe'o //
analyzed: phrin las che zhe'o //
translated: and the great activity.

original: gzhan don dang rang don thams cad 'dir man ngag gi sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan don dang rang don thams cad 'dir man ngag gi sbyar ro //
translated: All the benefits for others and oneself are applied here.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i sgo nas byang chub kyi sems rdo rje mngon par brjod pa'am spros pa'i le'u ste tshig bcu bzhi pa'i le'u lnga pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i sgo nas byang chub kyi sems rdo rje mngon par brjod pa'am spros pa'i le'u ste tshig bcu bzhi pa'i le'u lnga pa rdzogs so /
translated: This is the chapter on the bodhicitta vajra, the fourteenth chapter of the extensive explanation of the Maṇḍala of the Vajra Realm.

original: // / sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad che //
analyzed: // / sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad che //
translated: The great Buddha Vairocana

original: zhes pa de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas 'jam dpal ye shes kyi sku la bstod pa ston te /
analyzed: zhes pa de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas 'jam dpal ye shes kyi sku la bstod pa ston te /
translated: This shows the praise to Mañjuśrī's jñānakāya from the perspective of the wisdom of the dharmadhātu.

original: de yang chos kyi dbyings kyi go ba ni mi rtog pa'i ngang du cog bzhag la bya ste /
analyzed: de yang chos kyi dbyings kyi go ba ni mi rtog pa'i ngang du cog bzhag la bya ste /
translated: Furthermore, the understanding of the dharmadhatu is to be applied to the unfettered equipoise in a nonconceptual state.

original: gnyis med kyi ye shes gcig po de la ldog pa'i bye brag gis ye shes lnga bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis med kyi ye shes gcig po de la ldog pa'i bye brag gis ye shes lnga bya ste /
translated: That single gnosis of nonduality is to be applied to the five gnoses by way of specific divisions.

original: chos kyi dbyings la gsal la mi rtog pa'i ngos nas chos kyi dbyings kyi me long lta bu la bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la gsal la mi rtog pa'i ngos nas chos kyi dbyings kyi me long lta bu la bya ste /
translated: From the perspective of clarity and nonconceptuality in the dharmadhatu, it is the mirror-like gnosis of the dharmadhatu.

original: chos can gzugs brnyan sna tshogs shar yang shar ro snyam pa'i rtog pa med /
analyzed: chos can gzugs brnyan sna tshogs shar yang shar ro snyam pa'i rtog pa med /
translated: Although various reflections of phenomena arise, there is no thought, “They have arisen.”

original: med kyang gzugs brnyan 'char ba /
analyzed: med kyang gzugs brnyan 'char ba /
translated: Although they do not exist, reflections arise.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pas gsal la mi rtog pas /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pas gsal la mi rtog pas /
translated: Since they are uninterrupted, they are clear and nonconceptual.

original: de la rgyun mi 'chad pas mi bskyod par byas so //
analyzed: de la rgyun mi 'chad pas mi bskyod par byas so //
translated: Since they are uninterrupted, they are made immovable.

original: de bzhin du mi rtog pa de'i ngang du bdag dang sems can chos rnams mnyam pas chos kyi dbyings kyi mnyam nyid de la rin chen 'byung ldan bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtog pa de'i ngang du bdag dang sems can chos rnams mnyam pas chos kyi dbyings kyi mnyam nyid de la rin chen 'byung ldan bya /
translated: Similarly, since oneself, sentient beings, and phenomena are equal in that nonconceptual state, that equality of the dharmadhatu is Ratnasambhava.

original: mi rtog pa'i ye shes de gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du chos can so sor phye ba'i chos nyid so sor mkhyen so sor rtog pa de la snang ba mtha' yas bya /
analyzed: mi rtog pa'i ye shes de gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du chos can so sor phye ba'i chos nyid so sor mkhyen so sor rtog pa de la snang ba mtha' yas bya /
translated: The wisdom of nonconceptuality is the knowledge of the individual dharmatās of the individual phenomena from form to omniscience. The individual realizations are Amitābha.

original: mi rtog pa de la gzhan don lhun grub tu gnas /
analyzed: mi rtog pa de la gzhan don lhun grub tu gnas /
translated: Nonconceptuality is the spontaneous presence for the benefit of others.

original: bya ba grub pa de la don grub gnas /
analyzed: bya ba grub pa de la don grub gnas /
translated: The activity that is accomplished is Amitābha.

original: de bzhin du de'i dgag bya dngos po dang mtshan ma log pa'i smon pa phyin ci log gi mngon par 'du byed pa bzhi bkag / rnam thar bzhi la yum bzhi byas /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i dgag bya dngos po dang mtshan ma log pa'i smon pa phyin ci log gi mngon par 'du byed pa bzhi bkag / rnam thar bzhi la yum bzhi byas /
translated: Similarly, the four volitions that are the opposite of the negatee, substantial entities and signs, are stopped, and the four mothers are the four gateways to liberation.

original: de'i chos can ye shes lnga la nang 'dzin pa'i sems kyis stong pas na stong pa nyid ma grub par 'dod kyi bar du dgag bya bcu drug bkag / stong pa bcu drug / de la shes rab kyi sems dpa' bcu drug byas /
analyzed: de'i chos can ye shes lnga la nang 'dzin pa'i sems kyis stong pas na stong pa nyid ma grub par 'dod kyi bar du dgag bya bcu drug bkag / stong pa bcu drug / de la shes rab kyi sems dpa' bcu drug byas /
translated: The five wisdoms that are the phenomena of that are asserted to be empty of the inner apprehending mind, and the sixteen negativities are stopped. The sixteen emptinesses are the sixteen bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa med pa'i sgo nas @89a * //🔽sbyin pa la sogs pa brgyad /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa med pa'i sgo nas @89a * // sbyin pa la sogs pa brgyad /
translated: Likewise, the gnosis of the sphere of reality is the eight such as generosity in the sense of the absence of its opposing factors, stinginess and so forth.

original: de la sgeg mo la sogs pa brgyad byas /
analyzed: de la sgeg mo la sogs pa brgyad byas /
translated: The eight such as the goddess of charm are posited as the eight of generosity and so forth.

original: ma dad pa la sogs pa bzhi med pas stobs bzhi de la sgo bzhi byas /
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa bzhi med pas stobs bzhi de la sgo bzhi byas /
translated: The four such as lack of faith are posited as the four doors of the four powers.

original: de'i nang stong pa la sogs pa bcu drug rig pa'i rig pa la thabs kyi sems dpa' bcu drug bya ste /
analyzed: de'i nang stong pa la sogs pa bcu drug rig pa'i rig pa la thabs kyi sems dpa' bcu drug bya ste /
translated: The sixteen such as inner emptiness are posited as the sixteen male bodhisattvas of method.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la ldog pa'i bye brag gis lha lnga bcu rtsa gnyis su gzhag go //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la ldog pa'i bye brag gis lha lnga bcu rtsa gnyis su gzhag go //
translated: Thus, by way of specific divisions of the gnosis of the sphere of reality, the fifty-two deities are posited.

original: de rnams kyang bsdu na chos kyi dbyings de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi sum brtseg bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang bsdu na chos kyi dbyings de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi sum brtseg bya'o //
translated: When those are condensed, the three tiers of the tathāgata family are posited on that sphere of reality.

original: de las sangs rgyas zhes pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: de las sangs rgyas zhes pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
translated: From that, the buddha is the enjoyment body.

original: gtsang ma'i gnas ni nyams dga' bar //
analyzed: gtsang ma'i gnas ni nyams dga' bar //
translated: In the pure abode, the delightful,

original: yang dag sangs rgyas der sangs rgyas //
analyzed: yang dag sangs rgyas der sangs rgyas //
translated: the perfect buddha attained buddhahood.

original: sprul pa po ni 'dir sangs rgyas //
analyzed: sprul pa po ni 'dir sangs rgyas //
translated: The emanator here is the Buddha.

original: zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This is stated.

original: 'og min du sangs rgyas pa de la de skad bya'o //
analyzed: 'og min du sangs rgyas pa de la de skad bya'o //
translated: The one who is enlightened in Akaniṣṭha is so called.

original: rnam par snang mdzad chen po ni chos sku la bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad chen po ni chos sku la bya ste /
translated: Great Vairocana is to be taken as the dharma body,🔽because it is said:🔽The consciousness of all sentient beings,🔽the great vajra of the realm of reality,

original: sems can kun gyi shes pa dang // chos dbyings rdo rje chen po dang // de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po gsum //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi shes pa dang // chos dbyings rdo rje chen po dang // de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po gsum //
translated: and the essence of the tathāgatas

original: thog ma tha ma med par bshad //
analyzed: thog ma tha ma med par bshad //
translated: are explained as being without beginning or end.

original: ces 'byung ste /
analyzed: ces 'byung ste /
translated: This is stated.

original: sam gra ha nas gsungs pa'i rnam snang chen po srid pa snod bcud dang zhi ba snod bcud kyis bsdus pa thams cad la khyab pa'i bdag nyid de la de skad bya'o //
analyzed: sam gra ha nas gsungs pa'i rnam snang chen po srid pa snod bcud dang zhi ba snod bcud kyis bsdus pa thams cad la khyab pa'i bdag nyid de la de skad bya'o //
translated: Great Vairocana, as stated in the Saṃgīti, is the identity that pervades all that is included in the world of the environment and inhabitants of existence and the world of the environment and inhabitants of peace.

original: thub pa chen po ni sprul pa'i sku la bya ste /🔽sh'akya'i rigs thub pa'am /
analyzed: thub pa chen po ni sprul pa'i sku la bya ste / sh'akya'i rigs thub pa'am /
translated: The Great Sage is to be taken as the emanation body,🔽because he is the sage of the Śākya family,

original: sku gsung thugs gsum dang gnas ngan len thub pas de skad bya'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs gsum dang gnas ngan len thub pas de skad bya'o //
translated: or he is the sage of body, speech, and mind, and the sage of taking up bad states.

original: de gsum mnyam par gzhag pas chen po yang yin no //
analyzed: de gsum mnyam par gzhag pas chen po yang yin no //
translated: He is also great because those three are equipoise.

original: thub chen ldan pa'i sngags kyi lugs la rig 'dzin yod pa bzhin du mu stegs la drang srod gnas 'jog dang / grog mkhar dang / mig dmar la sogs pa yod de /
analyzed: thub chen ldan pa'i sngags kyi lugs la rig 'dzin yod pa bzhin du mu stegs la drang srod gnas 'jog dang / grog mkhar dang / mig dmar la sogs pa yod de /
translated: Just as there are Vidyadharas in the system of the great sage's mantra, so too there are the Tirthikas, the Dran srogs, the Grogs mkhar, the Mig dmar, and so on.

original: de yang rje btsun nyid yin pas de skad bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rje btsun nyid yin pas de skad bya ste /
translated: And since he is the very Lord, he is called that.

original: de bas rje btsun 'jam dpal de la ni khyod ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa lags so zhes tshogs kyis bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de bas rje btsun 'jam dpal de la ni khyod ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa lags so zhes tshogs kyis bstod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, to that Lord Manjusri, you are the Buddha and so on.

original: gsang sngags tshul chen ni rdo rje theg pa chen po'i tshul lam rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gsang sngags tshul chen ni rdo rje theg pa chen po'i tshul lam rang bzhin te /
translated: The great way of mantra is the way or nature of the Great Vehicle of Vajra.

original: lam de la byung ba khyod ni de skad bya ba'i mtshan nyid can lags so zhes bstod pa'o //
analyzed: lam de la byung ba khyod ni de skad bya ba'i mtshan nyid can lags so zhes bstod pa'o //
translated: You who have arisen in that way are called by that name.

original: gsang sngags tshul chen bdag nyid can //
analyzed: gsang sngags tshul chen bdag nyid can //
translated: You are the very essence of the great way of mantra.

original: zhes pa 'bras bu thob nas de'i bdag nyid du gyur la khyod lags so zhe'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'bras bu thob nas de'i bdag nyid du gyur la khyod lags so zhe'o //
translated: Having attained the fruit, you have become its very essence.

original: pha rol phyin bcu thob @89b pa ste //
analyzed: pha rol phyin bcu thob @89b pa ste //
translated: You have attained the ten perfections.

original: zhes pa 'dir pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam gzhag bcu ni /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dir pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam gzhag bcu ni /
translated: Here, the ten perfections are set forth as follows.

original: spyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa dang / sngags kyi theg pa'i khyad la pandi ta grub mtha' mi mthun pa mang ste /
analyzed: spyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa dang / sngags kyi theg pa'i khyad la pandi ta grub mtha' mi mthun pa mang ste /
translated: In general, there are many different opinions among the learned ones as to the difference between the Pāramitāyāna and the Mantra Vehicle.

original: kha cig ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam stegs tsam las sangs rgyas kyi mthong lam mi skyed de /
analyzed: kha cig ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam stegs tsam las sangs rgyas kyi mthong lam mi skyed de /
translated: Some say that the path of the Pāramitāyāna is merely a stepping stone and that the path of seeing of buddhahood is not produced by it.

original: mthong khams dang po non pas ni dngos po gnas lugs sngar ma mthong ba cig da gdod mthong ba ste /
analyzed: mthong khams dang po non pas ni dngos po gnas lugs sngar ma mthong ba cig da gdod mthong ba ste /
translated: They say that when the first stage of the path of seeing is reached, one sees something about the abiding nature of things that one had not seen before.

original: ma mthong mthong phyir mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: ma mthong mthong phyir mthong ba'i lam //
translated: Because one sees what one had not seen before, it is called the path of seeing.

original: zer ro // kha cig ni pha rol tu phyin pas sangs rgyas bzang po yod zer te /
analyzed: zer ro // kha cig ni pha rol tu phyin pas sangs rgyas bzang po yod zer te /
translated: Some say that the buddhas of the Pāramitāyāna are good buddhas.🔽They say that when the buddhas of the Mantra Vehicle look at them, they see that the buddhas of the Pāramitāyāna are still on the path of learning.

original: sngags kyi sangs rgyas kyis bltas na pha rol tu phyin pa'i sangs rgyas ni da dung du slob pa'i lam par mthong zer ba dang / yang sangs rgyas la rang rgyud pa'i sangs rgyas bzang ngan gnyis med de /
analyzed: sngags kyi sangs rgyas kyis bltas na pha rol tu phyin pa'i sangs rgyas ni da dung du slob pa'i lam par mthong zer ba dang / yang sangs rgyas la rang rgyud pa'i sangs rgyas bzang ngan gnyis med de /
translated: Also, some say that there are two kinds of buddhas, good and bad, but that there is no good or bad in the buddhas themselves.

original: grub mtha' de ltar 'dod zer ba dang / sangs rgyas rang rgyud pa rang la kha sbyor la sogs pa longs spyod che chung bzang ngan yod zer ba dang / yang mthong lam skye ba la lam nye ring yod de des na khyad par med zer ba'i lugs mang po yod do //
analyzed: grub mtha' de ltar 'dod zer ba dang / sangs rgyas rang rgyud pa rang la kha sbyor la sogs pa longs spyod che chung bzang ngan yod zer ba dang / yang mthong lam skye ba la lam nye ring yod de des na khyad par med zer ba'i lugs mang po yod do //
translated: There are many other systems, such as the one that says, The tenets are asserted in that way, and the one that says, The Buddha is autonomous, and there is a difference in the greatness of enjoyment, such as the union with the consort, and so on.

original: 'dir ni rje btsun 'jam dpal de gsang sngags kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par snang la pha rol tu phyin ba'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas par snang bas rje btsun khyod ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu thob pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi sgo nas
analyzed: 'dir ni rje btsun 'jam dpal de gsang sngags kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par snang la pha rol tu phyin ba'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas par snang bas rje btsun khyod ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu thob pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi sgo nas
translated: Here, the venerable Manjusri appears in the path and result of secret mantra and appears in the path and result of the perfection vehicle. Therefore, the venerable one is praised from the perspective of qualities such as attaining the ten perfections.

original: bstod pa'o // de la pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbye ba ni bcu'o //
analyzed: bstod pa'o // de la pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbye ba ni bcu'o //
translated: The divisions of the perfections are ten.

original: de ltar yang byams pa'i chos dbus mtha' las /
analyzed: de ltar yang byams pa'i chos dbus mtha' las /
translated: Thus, Maitreya's Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes says:

original: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //
analyzed: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //
translated: Generosity, ethics, patience, and diligence,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: ming ni sbyin pa nas ye shes kyi bar du bcu'o //
analyzed: ming ni sbyin pa nas ye shes kyi bar du bcu'o //
translated: The names are from generosity to wisdom, which are ten.

original: zang zing dang chos dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa gsum pa bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zang zing dang chos dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa gsum pa bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: The three, material things, the Dharma, and fearlessness, make ten.

original: bsdu ba ni drug tu 'dus te /
analyzed: bsdu ba ni drug tu 'dus te /
translated: The six are included in the three:

original: bzhi shes rab kyi bye brag gis te drug kyang shes rab tu 'dus so //
analyzed: bzhi shes rab kyi bye brag gis te drug kyang shes rab tu 'dus so //
translated: The four are included in wisdom, and the six are included in wisdom.

original: gsum gsum du dbye ba de yang bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang / gzhan don dang gsum gsum mo //
analyzed: gsum gsum du dbye ba de yang bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang / gzhan don dang gsum gsum mo //
translated: The three divisions of three are the accumulation of merit, the accumulation of wisdom, and the three of benefit for others.

original: sa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: sa dang sbyar na /
translated: When applied to the levels,

original: sbyin pas dang po /
analyzed: sbyin pas dang po /
translated: generosity is on the first level.

original: de bzhin du rim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rim pa bzhin no //
translated: It is the same in order.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam ni /
translated: The path of the perfections

original: sbyin pas phyug po ster ba la sogs pa'o //🔽nges tshig p'a ra mi ta zhes pha rol de mya ngan @90a * //
analyzed: sbyin pas phyug po ster ba la sogs pa'o // nges tshig p'a ra mi ta zhes pha rol de mya ngan @90a * //
translated: is the bestowal of wealth through generosity and so forth.

original: las 'das pa'i skam sar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: las 'das pa'i skam sar phyin pa'o //
translated: The definition is that pāramitā is the dry land of nirvāṇa to which the other shore is gone.

original: de lta bu'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu thob pa ni 'jam dpal khyod lags so zhes bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu thob pa ni 'jam dpal khyod lags so zhes bstod pa'o //
translated: You, Mañjuśrī, have attained such ten perfections.

original: pha rol phyin pa bcu la gnas //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa bcu la gnas //
translated: Abiding in the ten perfections,

original: zhes pa rje btsun de la brten /
analyzed: zhes pa rje btsun de la brten /
translated: you rely on that venerable one.

original: de'i ngo bor 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i ngo bor 'dug pa ste /
translated: You exist in the nature of that.

original: rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dag pa ste zhes pa shes rab med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dgu ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dag pa ste zhes pa shes rab med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dgu ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi 'thob ste /
translated: The nine perfections without wisdom do not obtain the name perfection.

original: des gzung ba'i 'khor gsum stong pa nyid du dag pa de nyid rje btsun no //
analyzed: des gzung ba'i 'khor gsum stong pa nyid du dag pa de nyid rje btsun no //
translated: The purity of the emptiness of the three spheres of the object, agent, and action of that is the exalted mind.

original: pha rol phyin pa bcu yi tshul //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa bcu yi tshul //
translated: The ten perfections are the method.

original: zhes pa 'jig rten pa mos pa spyod pa bcu char sa dang po nas sa bcu pa'i bar du rim pa bzhin sa dang po'i shas che'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'jig rten pa mos pa spyod pa bcu char sa dang po nas sa bcu pa'i bar du rim pa bzhin sa dang po'i shas che'o //
translated: The ten worldly perfections of devoted conduct are the ten grounds from the first to the tenth, respectively.

original: sa bcu po de de nyid rtogs pa la ye shes che'o //
analyzed: sa bcu po de de nyid rtogs pa la ye shes che'o //
translated: The exalted wisdom of the ten grounds is the realization of suchness.

original: sa bcu po de nyid rtogs pa la khyad med de pha rol phyin pa bcu shas che bas khyad byas so //
analyzed: sa bcu po de nyid rtogs pa la khyad med de pha rol phyin pa bcu shas che bas khyad byas so //
translated: The ten grounds are not differentiated in the realization of suchness, but they are differentiated by the predominance of the ten perfections.

original: tshul ni thabs te /
analyzed: tshul ni thabs te /
translated: Method is the means.

original: de nyid du rje btsun nyid 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid du rje btsun nyid 'byung ngo //
translated: The exalted mind itself arises from that.

original: mgon pos bcu zhes pa 'dir sa'i rnam gzhag bcu ni sa'i nges tshig ni dkar po'i yon tan 'byung ba'i gzhir 'dug pas so //🔽dbye na tshogs kyi lam pa /🔽mos pa spyod pa /
analyzed: mgon pos bcu zhes pa 'dir sa'i rnam gzhag bcu ni sa'i nges tshig ni dkar po'i yon tan 'byung ba'i gzhir 'dug pas so // dbye na tshogs kyi lam pa / mos pa spyod pa /
translated: The definition of the levels is that they are the basis for the arising of positive qualities.

original: mthong lam yan chad slob pa'i sas bsdus pas bcu dang mi slob pa'i sa bcu gcig kun du 'od do //
analyzed: mthong lam yan chad slob pa'i sas bsdus pas bcu dang mi slob pa'i sa bcu gcig kun du 'od do //
translated: If they are classified, there are the ten levels that are included in the levels of training, from the path of accumulation up to the path of seeing, and the eleventh level, that of no more training, which is the level of Universal Illumination.

original: de las 'di ni slob pa'i sa bcu'o //
analyzed: de las 'di ni slob pa'i sa bcu'o //
translated: Of these, the present discussion concerns the ten levels of training.

original: ngo bo ni dngos gzhi dang rjes thob gnyis zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ngo bo ni dngos gzhi dang rjes thob gnyis zhes bya ste /
translated: As for their essence, there are two aspects: the actual meditative absorption and postmeditation.

original: sa dang po nas sa bcu'i bar du dngos po rang gi mtshan nyid la khyad med rjes thob mthu che chung la khyad yod de /
analyzed: sa dang po nas sa bcu'i bar du dngos po rang gi mtshan nyid la khyad med rjes thob mthu che chung la khyad yod de /
translated: From the first level up to the tenth, there is no difference in the actual meditative absorption, which is the experience of the nature of things as it is, but there is a difference in the postmeditation experience, in that the power of the experience increases.

original: sa dang po mthong lam pa dang gnyis pa la chos nyid mthong ba la khyad med de /
analyzed: sa dang po mthong lam pa dang gnyis pa la chos nyid mthong ba la khyad med de /
translated: There is no difference between the first and second levels in the experience of the nature of phenomena on the path of seeing.

original: de so so skye bo mos pa tsam dang ni khyad yod de /
analyzed: de so so skye bo mos pa tsam dang ni khyad yod de /
translated: There is a difference in that the first level is simply the interest of an ordinary individual, while the second is the interest of a spiritually advanced being.

original: so so skye bo mos pa tsam sa rnams kyi sngon du myong so so skye bos nges shes ma skyes /
analyzed: so so skye bo mos pa tsam sa rnams kyi sngon du myong so so skye bos nges shes ma skyes /
translated: The interest of an ordinary individual is simply a preliminary to the levels, for ordinary individuals have not given rise to certainty.

original: des 'khor bar 'khor /
analyzed: des 'khor bar 'khor /
translated: By that, one cycles in samsara.

original: 'on sa rnams chos nyid mngon du myong ba la khyad med na dang po nas sa bcu'i bar du khyad ci ste zhe na /
analyzed: 'on sa rnams chos nyid mngon du myong ba la khyad med na dang po nas sa bcu'i bar du khyad ci ste zhe na /
translated: If there is no difference in the experience of the reality of the stages, why is there a difference from the first stage to the tenth?

original: rjes thob mthu che chung yod do //
analyzed: rjes thob mthu che chung yod do //
translated: There is a difference in the power of the post-meditation.

original: sa dang pos sangs rgyas brgya mthong /
analyzed: sa dang pos sangs rgyas brgya mthong /
translated: The first stage sees a hundred buddhas.

original: sprul pa brgya 'jig rten gyi khams brgyar g-yo /
analyzed: sprul pa brgya 'jig rten gyi khams brgyar g-yo /
translated: One hundred emanations shake a hundred world systems.

original: sbyin pa mi mthun brgya 'gyed /🔽nyis brgya'am / stong ngam /
analyzed: sbyin pa mi mthun brgya 'gyed / nyis brgya'am / stong ngam /
translated: One gives a hundred gifts that are not in accord with the Dharma.

original: khri la sogs pa gong ma gong ma mthu che'o //
analyzed: khri la sogs pa gong ma gong ma mthu che'o //
translated: Two hundred, a thousand, ten thousand, and so on, are more powerful than the previous ones.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sa 'og ma 'og ma goms pa yun @90b thung ;
analyzed: sa 'og ma 'og ma goms pa yun @90b thung ;
translated: The lower stages are familiarized with for a short time.

original: gong ma gong ma yun ring ste /
analyzed: gong ma gong ma yun ring ste /
translated: The higher stages are familiarized with for a long time.

original: snye ma dang ljang bu yang dang po pas phyis mthu dang nus pa che ba bzhin no //
analyzed: snye ma dang ljang bu yang dang po pas phyis mthu dang nus pa che ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like a sprout and a shoot that are more powerful and capable later than at first.

original: de ltar yang pha rol tu phyin pa kun rdzogs shing zhe'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang pha rol tu phyin pa kun rdzogs shing zhe'o //
translated: Thus, all the perfections are completed.

original: de lta bu'i sa bcu gnas pa de yang rje btsun nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sa bcu gnas pa de yang rje btsun nyid do //
translated: The one who abides in those ten stages is the venerable one himself.

original: bcu gcig kun du 'od ni sa'i 'bras bu ste dbang phyug go ;
analyzed: bcu gcig kun du 'od ni sa'i 'bras bu ste dbang phyug go ;
translated: The eleventh stage, Total Illumination, is the result of the stages, the lord.

original: / de rnams ni sa'i rnam gzhag go //
analyzed: / de rnams ni sa'i rnam gzhag go //
translated: These are the presentations of the stages.

original: sa bcu la ni gnas pa po //
analyzed: sa bcu la ni gnas pa po //
translated: The one who abides on the ten stages

original: zhes pa gong ma bcu po de la rje btsun gnas so //
analyzed: zhes pa gong ma bcu po de la rje btsun gnas so //
translated: The one who abides on the ten stages above is the exalted one.🔽The one with the nature of the ten pure knowledges

original: shes bcu rnam dag bdag nyid can ni shes bcu ni chos shes pa dang / de bzhin du rjes su shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / kun rdzob dang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang /
analyzed: shes bcu rnam dag bdag nyid can ni shes bcu ni chos shes pa dang / de bzhin du rjes su shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / kun rdzob dang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang /
translated: The ten knowledges are the knowledge of phenomena, and similarly, the knowledge of subsequent realization, the knowledge of others' minds, the conventional, suffering, origin, cessation,

original: lam dang / zad pa mi skye ba rnam pa bcu po de shes pa ste /
analyzed: lam dang / zad pa mi skye ba rnam pa bcu po de shes pa ste /
translated: path, exhaustion, and nonarising.

original: spang bya bcu po de dag pa rje btsun no //
analyzed: spang bya bcu po de dag pa rje btsun no //
translated: The exalted one is pure of those ten objects of abandonment.🔽The one who bears the ten🔽The one who bears the ten pure knowledges that are the causes of purity is the exalted one.

original: 'chang ba po zhes zlos skyon spong ba ste /
analyzed: 'chang ba po zhes zlos skyon spong ba ste /
translated: The body is pure in the aggregates and so on.

original: dag rgyu mi mthun pa'i shes pa bcu po de dag pa phung po la sogs par rang sar dag lus phung po lnga sgyu mar shes pa la sogs pa glo bur gyi dri ma med de dag pa ni /
analyzed: dag rgyu mi mthun pa'i shes pa bcu po de dag pa phung po la sogs par rang sar dag lus phung po lnga sgyu mar shes pa la sogs pa glo bur gyi dri ma med de dag pa ni /
translated: The body is pure in the aggregates and so on, free from the stains of adventitious faults, such as knowing the five aggregates to be illusory.

original: rje btsun ye shes de lta bu 'chad zhe'o //
analyzed: rje btsun ye shes de lta bu 'chad zhe'o //
translated: The exalted one is said to be such knowledge.

original: dag rgyu de nyid dag pa'i ngo bor 'dug ste rtogs shing 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: dag rgyu de nyid dag pa'i ngo bor 'dug ste rtogs shing 'chang ba'o //
translated: The cause of purity is the essence of purity itself, which is realized and held.

original: rnam pa bcu po zhes pa bdag 'dzin rnam pa bcu ste /🔽gcig pur 'dzin pa dang ; rgyu ru 'dzin pa dang / za bar dang / byed pa po dang / rang dbang dang / bdag por dang / rtag par dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / ma grol ba dang /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po zhes pa bdag 'dzin rnam pa bcu ste / gcig pur 'dzin pa dang ; rgyu ru 'dzin pa dang / za bar dang / byed pa po dang / rang dbang dang / bdag por dang / rtag par dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / ma grol ba dang /
translated: The ten aspects are the ten ways of grasping at a self.

original: grol bar 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: grol bar 'dzin pa ste /
translated: They are grasping at being a single unit, grasping at being a cause, grasping at being an experiencer, grasping at being an agent, grasping at independence, grasping at being a master, grasping at permanence, grasping at being afflicted, grasping at being completely purified, and grasping at being neither liberated nor not liberated.

original: rje btsun nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag 'dzin bcur yang snang bas de la de skad bya la /
analyzed: rje btsun nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag 'dzin bcur yang snang bas de la de skad bya la /
translated: The ten aspects are also the ten ways of grasping at a self, which are discordant with the exalted state of the venerable Maitreya.

original: don bcu ni rtsa ba'i de kho nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi de kho na dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / 'bras bu dang / rgyu'i dang / rags pa'i dang / phra ba'i dang / grags pa'i dang / rnam dag dang / yul gyi dang /
analyzed: don bcu ni rtsa ba'i de kho nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi de kho na dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / 'bras bu dang / rgyu'i dang / rags pa'i dang / phra ba'i dang / grags pa'i dang / rnam dag dang / yul gyi dang /
translated: The ten topics are the suchness of the root, the suchness of the characteristics, the unmistaken, the result, the cause, the coarse, the subtle, the renowned, the pure, and the object.

original: bsdus pa'i dang / dbye ba'i de kho na nyid dang / mkhas pa'i de kho na nyid dang / bdag 'dzin bcu'i gnyen po dang / de yang rje btsun nyid do //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i dang / dbye ba'i de kho na nyid dang / mkhas pa'i de kho na nyid dang / bdag 'dzin bcu'i gnyen po dang / de yang rje btsun nyid do //
translated: The reality of the summary, the reality of the analysis, the reality of the expert, the antidotes to the ten self-habits, and that is the Lord himself.

original: de ltar mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po gnyis med du rtogs na des de la glags mi rnyed de /
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po gnyis med du rtogs na des de la glags mi rnyed de /
translated: Thus, if one realizes the nonduality of the two, the adverse and the antidote, then that [adverse] will not find an opportunity in him.

original: nam mkhas nam mkha' la glags mi rnyed pa bzhin du phung po la sogs pa rang ldog go //
analyzed: nam mkhas nam mkha' la glags mi rnyed pa bzhin du phung po la sogs pa rang ldog go //
translated: Just as space does not find an opportunity in space, so the aggregates, etc., are turned back on themselves.

original: thub dbang zhes pa @91a * //
analyzed: thub dbang zhes pa @91a * //
translated: The Lord of Sages

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la ltos na /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la ltos na /
translated: In comparison with the Disciples and the Self-Buddhas,

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob dka' ba des rje btsun gyis 'thob pa'i phyir de la de skad bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob dka' ba des rje btsun gyis 'thob pa'i phyir de la de skad bya'o //
translated: the Lord of Sages is so called because he has attained the difficult-to-attain perfect enlightenment.

original: stobs bcu ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa la sogs so //
analyzed: stobs bcu ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa la sogs so //
translated: The ten powers are the knowledge of the possible and impossible, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang rje btsun ldan la khyab bdag ni nam mkha' bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang rje btsun ldan la khyab bdag ni nam mkha' bzhin te /
translated: The Lord of Sages is endowed with the ten powers of the Tathagata, and the all-pervading Lord is like space.

original: yon tan yongs la khyab pa dang / rtsis las 'das pa'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid rje btsun no //
analyzed: yon tan yongs la khyab pa dang / rtsis las 'das pa'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid rje btsun no //
translated: The venerable one is the nature of qualities that are beyond reckoning and that pervade all things.

original: kun gyis ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byed pa 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: kun gyis ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byed pa 'jam dpal lo //
translated: The all-pervading one is Mañjuśrī, who acts for the welfare of all beings without exception.

original: rnam bcu dbang ldan zhes pa tshe la dbang ba dang / las dang / yo byad dang ; mos pa dang / smon lam dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / skye ba dang / chos dang / sems dang / ye shes la dbang ba dang / bcu ni rnam bcu'o //
analyzed: rnam bcu dbang ldan zhes pa tshe la dbang ba dang / las dang / yo byad dang ; mos pa dang / smon lam dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / skye ba dang / chos dang / sems dang / ye shes la dbang ba dang / bcu ni rnam bcu'o //
translated: The one who is powerful in the ten ways is powerful in ten ways: in life, in action, in possessions, in aspiration, in prayer, in magical power, in birth, in the Dharma, in mind, and in intuition.

original: de bcu dang ldan zhing de bcu la dbang thob pas gar yang bsgyur ba'i chos la mnga' brnyes pas chen po'o //
analyzed: de bcu dang ldan zhing de bcu la dbang thob pas gar yang bsgyur ba'i chos la mnga' brnyes pas chen po'o //
translated: The great one is so called because he has attained mastery over the Dharma, which is transformed into anything at all, by virtue of his possession of these ten powers and his attainment of power over them.

original: thog ma zhes pa skye ba med pa la spro ba ni phung po dang khams rnams rang gi ngo bos stong pas de med de nyid manydzu'o //
analyzed: thog ma zhes pa skye ba med pa la spro ba ni phung po dang khams rnams rang gi ngo bos stong pas de med de nyid manydzu'o //
translated: The one who is intent on the beginning is so called because he is intent on the unborn, which is not nonexistent, since the aggregates and elements are empty of their own nature.

original: de bzhin nyid ni mi 'gyur ba /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni mi 'gyur ba /
translated: Suchness is unchanging.

original: 'jam dpal de'i bdag nyid du gnas la de la glo bur gyi dri ma med pas dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal de'i bdag nyid du gnas la de la glo bur gyi dri ma med pas dag pa'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī abides in that nature, and is pure because he is free of adventitious contaminants.

original: bden par smra zhes pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa rten 'brel gyi rkyen gyis sna tshogs su snang ste rgyu rkyen du snang ba'i dus nyid ni stong par go //
analyzed: bden par smra zhes pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa rten 'brel gyi rkyen gyis sna tshogs su snang ste rgyu rkyen du snang ba'i dus nyid ni stong par go //
translated: The line Speak the truth means that suffering and so forth appear in various ways due to the conditions of interdependence. At the very time that they appear as causes and conditions, they are understood to be empty.

original: rkyen ni ngo bos ma grub rtag chad tsam du go //
analyzed: rkyen ni ngo bos ma grub rtag chad tsam du go //
translated: Conditions are understood to be merely without permanence or annihilation, not established by nature.

original: des stong pa go ba /
analyzed: des stong pa go ba /
translated: By that, emptiness is understood.

original: des rkyen dbang du ma song /
analyzed: des rkyen dbang du ma song /
translated: By that, one does not fall under the power of conditions.

original: sna tshogs kyis rgya che ba go //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyis rgya che ba go //
translated: The variety is understood to be vast.

original: de gnyis su med pa ni dngos po ma lus pa de bden na ni de'i don la ma yengs par grol lo //
analyzed: de gnyis su med pa ni dngos po ma lus pa de bden na ni de'i don la ma yengs par grol lo //
translated: If those two are not nondual, then all things are true, and one is liberated without distraction from that meaning.

original: de yang 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: de yang 'jam dpal lo //
translated: That is also Mañjuśrī.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las /🔽'di la bsal ba ci yang med //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las / 'di la bsal ba ci yang med //
translated: In the Ornament of Clear Realization it is said:🔽There is nothing at all to be removed

original: gzhag par bya ba cung zad med //🔽yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba cung zad med // yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
translated: and not the slightest thing to be added.🔽The real is to be seen as real.

original: yang dag mthong nas rnam par grol //🔽zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang dag mthong nas rnam par grol //🔽zhes 'byung ste /
translated: When the real is seen, one is liberated.

original: rje btsun de ni don de smra zhing tshig mi 'gyur te chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes ston cing de nyid kyi phyir tshig mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rje btsun de ni don de smra zhing tshig mi 'gyur te chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes ston cing de nyid kyi phyir tshig mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The Lord is one who speaks of that meaning and whose words are unchanging. He teaches that all phenomena are like illusions, and for that very reason his words are unchanging.

original: ji skad smras pa des sems can thams cad kyi don byed do zhe'o //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa des sems can thams cad kyi don byed do zhe'o //
translated: He does what he says, and thereby he accomplishes the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: gnyis su med pa zhes pa gzung 'dzin gnyis med pa ni manydzu'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa zhes pa gzung 'dzin gnyis med pa ni manydzu'o //
translated: Nonduality, the absence of the duality of percept and perceiver, is Mañju.

original: gnyis med de kun rdzob tu gzhan la yang ston no //
analyzed: gnyis med de kun rdzob tu gzhan la yang ston no //
translated: That nonduality is also taught to others in a conventional way.

original: yang dag @91b ces pa phyin ci log gi rtsa ba'i gzhi med pa ste manydzu'o //
analyzed: yang dag @91b ces pa phyin ci log gi rtsa ba'i gzhi med pa ste manydzu'o //
translated: Authenticity, the absence of a basis for the root of error, is Mañju.

original: de dang dbyer med pa'i phyir mtha' de'i rang bzhin du rje btsun gnas so zhe'o //
analyzed: de dang dbyer med pa'i phyir mtha' de'i rang bzhin du rje btsun gnas so zhe'o //
translated: Because he is inseparable from that, the Lord abides in the nature of that limit.

original: tshigs bcad dang slob ma la bshad na de bzhin nyid bdag ni gnyug ma ma bcos pa dag pa'i 'bras bu ste /🔽sangs rgyas kyi dag pa rang ni dri ma dang bcas la /
analyzed: tshigs bcad dang slob ma la bshad na de bzhin nyid bdag ni gnyug ma ma bcos pa dag pa'i 'bras bu ste / sangs rgyas kyi dag pa rang ni dri ma dang bcas la /
translated: If one explains the verse to the disciples, suchness is the natural, unfabricated, pure result.🔽The purity of the buddhas is itself contaminated.

original: sangs rgyas dri ma med de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dri ma med de /
translated: The buddhas are without contamination.

original: dri med de spyan drangs nas rang gi ma dag pa dag par byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: dri med de spyan drangs nas rang gi ma dag pa dag par byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: Having invited the stainless one, one's own impurity is purified by the consecration.

original: rang byin gyis rlob pa'i rdzogs rim dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang byin gyis rlob pa'i rdzogs rim dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to the perfection stage of self consecration.

original: de la seng ge'i sgra zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la seng ge'i sgra zhes pa ni /
translated: As for the lion's roar,

original: dper na seng ge'i sgras ri dags la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa bzhin du mtshan ma med pas bdag med /
analyzed: dper na seng ge'i sgras ri dags la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa bzhin du mtshan ma med pas bdag med /
translated: just as the lion's roar overpowers deer and so forth, likewise, the absence of signs overpowers the selflessness of the individual,

original: mi mthun pa dang bral bas bdag med /
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang bral bas bdag med /
translated: the absence of conflict overpowers the selflessness of phenomena,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pas bdag med /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pas bdag med /
translated: and the emptiness of intrinsic identity overpowers the selflessness of the ultimate.

original: de gsum ni seng ge'i sgra dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de gsum ni seng ge'i sgra dang 'dra ste /
translated: These three are like the lion's roar.

original: bdag med las 'das pa'i rgya mtshor 'jug pa'i mu stegs ngan pa /
analyzed: bdag med las 'das pa'i rgya mtshor 'jug pa'i mu stegs ngan pa /
translated: The bad extremists who enter the ocean of transcending the self

original: 'jigs / klad /
analyzed: 'jigs / klad /
translated: are frightened,🔽their heads split open,

original: 'gems / zil gyis gnon zhe'o //
analyzed: 'gems / zil gyis gnon zhe'o //
translated: and they are overpowered.

original: de yang rje btsun no //
analyzed: de yang rje btsun no //
translated: This is also the exalted one.

original: kun 'gro zhes pa reg pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams ni kun du 'gro zhes te /
analyzed: kun 'gro zhes pa reg pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams ni kun du 'gro zhes te /
translated: As for the omnipresent, contact, feeling and so forth are called omnipresent.

original: khams thams cad du 'gro //
analyzed: khams thams cad du 'gro //
translated: They go to all realms

original: sems can thams cad du 'gro ste de yang rje btsun no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad du 'gro ste de yang rje btsun no //
translated: and go to all sentient beings. This is also the exalted one.

original: yang na sprul sku ni kun du 'gro ste /
analyzed: yang na sprul sku ni kun du 'gro ste /
translated: Alternatively, the emanation body is omnipresent.

original: khyab par 'gro mi 'gag par 'gro'o //
analyzed: khyab par 'gro mi 'gag par 'gro'o //
translated: He goes everywhere, goes without obstruction.

original: don yod stobs zhes pa bcings pa med pa'o //
analyzed: don yod stobs zhes pa bcings pa med pa'o //
translated: He is Amoghasiddhi, unbound.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yid ltar mgyogs //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yid ltar mgyogs // zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Tathagata is swift as thought.

original: skad cig ma gcig la gzhal du med pa'i 'jig rten du 'gro ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la gzhal du med pa'i 'jig rten du 'gro ste /
translated: He goes to immeasurable worlds in a single instant.

original: des ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa mtshan so drug go //
analyzed: des ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa mtshan so drug go //
translated: This praises the thirty-six marks from the perspective of the gnosis of the dharmadhatu.

original: yang rje btsun de la rgyal ba ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nas bod do //
analyzed: yang rje btsun de la rgyal ba ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nas bod do //
translated: Again, the Bhagavat is praised by name, beginning with “the Victorious One.

original: nyon mongs pa las rgyal lo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las rgyal lo //
translated: He is victorious over the afflictions.

original: shes bya thams cad kyis rnam par rgyal lo //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad kyis rnam par rgyal lo //
translated: He is victorious over all objects of knowledge.

original: de gnyis dgra las rgyal ba gcig khyod lags so zhes bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis dgra las rgyal ba gcig khyod lags so zhes bstod pa'o //
translated: You alone are the Victorious One over both of those enemies.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba zhes pa la /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba zhes pa la /
translated: He is a universal monarch.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba ni ;
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba ni ;
translated: The supramundane universal monarch

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rigs drug gi 'khor los sgyur ba drug go //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rigs drug gi 'khor los sgyur ba drug go //
translated: is the six universal monarchs of the six families, Vajrasattva and so on.

original: 'jig rten pa'i gser dngul zangs lcags 'khor lo can /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i gser dngul zangs lcags 'khor lo can /
translated: The mundane universal monarchs are those with wheels of gold, silver, copper, and iron.

original: de dag gling gcig dang / gling gnyis dang / gsum dang bzhi la mas rim bzhin //
analyzed: de dag gling gcig dang / gling gnyis dang / gsum dang bzhi la mas rim bzhin //
translated: They are the four continents, two continents, three continents, and one continent, respectively.

original: phas bsu rang 'gro g-yul bshams dang // @92a * //
analyzed: phas bsu rang 'gro g-yul bshams dang // @92a * //
translated: They are met by the father, go by themselves, and prepare for battle.

original: mtshon brtsams pas rgyal gnod pa med //
analyzed: mtshon brtsams pas rgyal gnod pa med //
translated: They conquer without harm.

original: ces gsungs te /🔽de yang rje btsun no //
analyzed: ces gsungs te / de yang rje btsun no //
translated: This is the Exalted One.

original: de nyid kyi stobs dang ldan te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi stobs dang ldan te /
translated: He is powerful,

original: bdud bzhi'i yan lag 'joms /
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i yan lag 'joms /
translated: destroying the limbs of the four demons.

original: de yang rje btsun khyed lags so zhe'o //
analyzed: de yang rje btsun khyed lags so zhe'o //
translated: This is the Exalted One.

original: tshogs ni nyan thos rnams la 'tsham pa'i chos phyin ci ma log pa ston pas rje btsun ni slob dpon no //
analyzed: tshogs ni nyan thos rnams la 'tsham pa'i chos phyin ci ma log pa ston pas rje btsun ni slob dpon no //
translated: The Exalted One is the teacher of the assembly of disciples, because he teaches the Dharma in a way that is appropriate for them and is unmistaken.

original: tshogs ni rang rgyal rnams kyi gtso bos de la de skad bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs ni rang rgyal rnams kyi gtso bos de la de skad bya'o //
translated: The Exalted One is the chief of the assembly of solitary sages.

original: tshogs ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i rje'o //
analyzed: tshogs ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i rje'o //
translated: The Exalted One is the lord of the assembly of bodhisattvas.

original: tshogs ni sangs rgyas de'i bdag po de'o //
analyzed: tshogs ni sangs rgyas de'i bdag po de'o //
