translated: The Exalted One is the master of the assembly of buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas la bdag po ci dgos she na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la bdag po ci dgos she na /
translated: What need does a buddha have for a master?

original: de ni sangs rgyas byang chub sems kyi bdag nyid yin pas de skad bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas byang chub sems kyi bdag nyid yin pas de skad bya'o //
translated: He is called the master because he is the embodiment of the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: mthu chen zhes pa ste mthu ni nus pa ste /
analyzed: mthu chen zhes pa ste mthu ni nus pa ste /
translated: The term “great power” means great ability.

original: chen po yang de nyid pas nus pa des zab mo'i chos ma mnyams par byed ces sras su byed nor du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: chen po yang de nyid pas nus pa des zab mo'i chos ma mnyams par byed ces sras su byed nor du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Great power means that power is ability, and since it is great, it is the ability to not be disturbed by the profound Dharma.

original: tshul ni thabs chen po'i bdag nyid de zab mo'i chos la gzhan gyis 'phrog pa ni drin mnos pas mi 'jigs pa yang manydzu'o //
analyzed: tshul ni thabs chen po'i bdag nyid de zab mo'i chos la gzhan gyis 'phrog pa ni drin mnos pas mi 'jigs pa yang manydzu'o //
translated: Method means the nature of great skillful means. Since one is not disturbed by the profound Dharma, one is fearless.

original: rje btsun de la tshig rje la sogs pa'i bstod pa ste /
analyzed: rje btsun de la tshig rje la sogs pa'i bstod pa ste /
translated: The praise to the venerable one is lord of words and so on.

original: tshig rje ni don so so yang dag par rig pa ste ming thams cad do //
analyzed: tshig rje ni don so so yang dag par rig pa ste ming thams cad do //
translated: The lord of words is the knowledge of the individual meaning, all names.

original: de bzhin du tshig bdag ni nges pa'i tshig rig pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshig bdag ni nges pa'i tshig rig pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the master of words is the knowledge of etymology,

original: gzugs su rung ba'i phyir gzugs zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs su rung ba'i phyir gzugs zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: such as form because it is suitable as form.

original: smra mkhas ni chos rig pa thob ste /
analyzed: smra mkhas ni chos rig pa thob ste /
translated: The skilled speaker is the knowledge of Dharma,

original: thams cad skye med du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad skye med du rtogs pa'o //
translated: realizing everything as nonarisen.

original: tshig la dbang ba ni spobs pa rig pa ste ji lta ba'i lan dus su lon pa'o //
analyzed: tshig la dbang ba ni spobs pa rig pa ste ji lta ba'i lan dus su lon pa'o //
translated: The one with power over words is the knowledge of eloquence, answering appropriately in a timely way.

original: tshig mtha' yas pa ni sangs rgyas sems can thams cad kyi skad shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshig mtha' yas pa ni sangs rgyas sems can thams cad kyi skad shes pa'o //
translated: Infinite words are the knowledge of the languages of all buddhas and sentient beings.

original: tshig bden bden par smra ba ste //
analyzed: tshig bden bden par smra ba ste //
translated: Truthful words are spoken truthfully.

original: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos bstan pa /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos bstan pa /
translated: This is the Dharma teaching of the buddhas.

original: bden pa gnyis la yang dag brten //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la yang dag brten //
translated: It is based on the two truths.

original: zhes te kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshig la brten nas gzhan la bden pa de gnyis kyi chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: zhes te kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshig la brten nas gzhan la bden pa de gnyis kyi chos ston pa ste /
translated: Based on the words of the two truths of the relative and the ultimate, the Dharma of those two truths is taught to others.

original: de yang don dam pa gsum don dam pa ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de yang don dam pa gsum don dam pa ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: Moreover, the ultimate is threefold: the ultimate suchness,

original: stong pa nyid bsgrub pa don dam pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bsgrub pa don dam pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes te /
translated: the ultimate accomplishment of emptiness is authentic wisdom,

original: gnyis med thob par bya ba'i don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: gnyis med thob par bya ba'i don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: and the ultimate to be attained is the fruition of nirvana.

original: byang chub rnam gsum mtha' las 'das //
analyzed: byang chub rnam gsum mtha' las 'das //
translated: Enlightenment is threefold, beyond extremes.

original: don dang thob dang bsgrub pa dang // don dam rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: don dang thob dang bsgrub pa dang // don dam rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
translated: Meaning, attainment, and accomplishment are asserted as the three ultimates.

original: ce'o // kun rdzob kyang gsum ste /
analyzed: ce'o // kun rdzob kyang gsum ste /
translated: The relative is also threefold:

original: brtags pa'i kun @92b rdzob ni kun brtags pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i kun @92b rdzob ni kun brtags pa'o //
translated: the imputed relative is the imagined,

original: shes pa'i kun rdzob ni log shes thams cad do //
analyzed: shes pa'i kun rdzob ni log shes thams cad do //
translated: The conventional of cognition is all wrong cognitions.

original: brjod pa'i kun rdzob ni sgra dang brjod pas don dam pa ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa'i kun rdzob ni sgra dang brjod pas don dam pa ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The conventional of expression is the expression of the ultimate by means of words and expressions.

original: de yang dbus mtha' las /
analyzed: de yang dbus mtha' las /
translated: And about that, the Center and Extremes states:

original: brtags pa dang ni shes pa dang // de bzhin brjod pa rgya che yin //
analyzed: brtags pa dang ni shes pa dang // de bzhin brjod pa rgya che yin //
translated: The imputed, the cognition, and likewise the expression are extensive.

original: zha'o // de lta bu'i don gzhan la smra ba yang rje btsun no //
analyzed: zha'o // de lta bu'i don gzhan la smra ba yang rje btsun no //
translated: And the one who teaches others such a meaning is the Exalted One.

original: bden pa bzhi ni ston pa po //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ni ston pa po //
translated: The one who teaches the four truths

original: zhes pa ni kun 'byung ni rgyu /
analyzed: zhes pa ni kun 'byung ni rgyu /
translated: is the one who teaches the origin as the cause,🔽the one who teaches suffering as the effect,

original: sdug bsngal ni 'bras bu ste 'khor ba'i rgyu 'bras dang / lam ni rgyu /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni 'bras bu ste 'khor ba'i rgyu 'bras dang / lam ni rgyu /
translated: the one who teaches the path as the cause,

original: 'gog pa ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: and the one who teaches cessation as the effect.

original: myang 'das rgyu 'bras de gzhan la ston pa yang rje btsun khyod lags so zhe'o //
analyzed: myang 'das rgyu 'bras de gzhan la ston pa yang rje btsun khyod lags so zhe'o //
translated: The one who teaches others such a cause and effect of cyclic existence and such a cause and effect of nirvana is the Exalted One.

original: phyir mi ldog pa ni rje btsun sa brgyad la dbang thob pa dman pa'i byang chub ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ni rje btsun sa brgyad la dbang thob pa dman pa'i byang chub ste /
translated: The one who is irreversible is the Exalted One, who has attained power on the eighth ground, and who is not of lesser enlightenment.

original: nyan thos rang rgyal du mi ldog go //
analyzed: nyan thos rang rgyal du mi ldog go //
translated: He is not reversible to the states of the sravaka and pratyekabuddha.

original: phyir mi 'ong ni nyon mongs pa che 'bring dgu bsgoms pa'i ye shes dgus spangs pas mthong lam thob pa ste 'khor bar mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ni nyon mongs pa che 'bring dgu bsgoms pa'i ye shes dgus spangs pas mthong lam thob pa ste 'khor bar mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: The nonreturners are those who have attained the path of seeing by means of the nine kinds of gnosis that come from meditating on the nine levels of the afflictive states of greater, middling, and lesser degrees, and who will not return to samsara.

original: de yang bzod thob ngan song lhung mi srid //
analyzed: de yang bzod thob ngan song lhung mi srid //
translated: Moreover, those who have attained the level of patient acceptance will not fall into the lower realms.

original: rtse mor phyin nas rtsa mi nyams //
analyzed: rtse mor phyin nas rtsa mi nyams //
translated: And those who have reached the peak will not regress to lower levels.

original: zhe'o // 'dren pa rang rgyal tshogs na spyod pa ste /
analyzed: zhe'o // 'dren pa rang rgyal tshogs na spyod pa ste /
translated: The self-realized ones, the guides, are those who live in groups.

original: rma bya dang ne tso ltar khyus lding ba bse ru ni gcig par gnas pa'i tshul de yang rje btsun khyod nyid do zhe'o //
analyzed: rma bya dang ne tso ltar khyus lding ba bse ru ni gcig par gnas pa'i tshul de yang rje btsun khyod nyid do zhe'o //
translated: Like peacocks and parrots, they soar in flocks. The rhinoceros-like ones live alone. And it is you, O most venerable one, who are like that.

original: des 'byung sna tshogs las byung ba //
analyzed: des 'byung sna tshogs las byung ba //
translated: The various kinds of beings that appear

original: zhes pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i nges 'byung gang dang gang gis 'dul ba de'i gzugs cha sna tshogs su 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i nges 'byung gang dang gang gis 'dul ba de'i gzugs cha sna tshogs su 'byung ngo //
translated: are those who are to be guided by the various kinds of renunciation of the shravakas and others.

original: phyir mi ldog zer ba dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog zer ba dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: But this contradicts the statement that they do not return.

original: 'dul dbang la dgongs te skyon ni med do //
analyzed: 'dul dbang la dgongs te skyon ni med do //
translated: There is no fault, for this is intended to refer to those who are to be guided.

original: 'byung ba chen po zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po zhes pa ni /
translated: The great elements

original: bhu ta ko ta na zhes pa'i sgra 'byung ba chen po ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: bhu ta ko ta na zhes pa'i sgra 'byung ba chen po ni bzhi'o //
translated: The term “great element” means the four great elements.

original: rgyu ni gnyis med kyi ye shes su gcig ste de yang rje btsun no //
analyzed: rgyu ni gnyis med kyi ye shes su gcig ste de yang rje btsun no //
translated: The cause is the single one in nondual pristine consciousness, and that is the venerable one.

original: dge slong zhes pa bzhi ste /🔽slob pa'i don byed kyi dge slong ni nyis brgya lnga bcu rtsa gsum mam /
analyzed: dge slong zhes pa bzhi ste / slob pa'i don byed kyi dge slong ni nyis brgya lnga bcu rtsa gsum mam /
translated: “Bhikṣu” means four things.

original: sum brgya drug cu'i khrims dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sum brgya drug cu'i khrims dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The bhikṣu who acts for the sake of training is endowed with the rules of two hundred and fifty-three or three hundred and sixty.

original: khas len pa ni med par khas len pa'o //
analyzed: khas len pa ni med par khas len pa'o //
translated: The vow is the vow of nonexistence.

original: ming gi dge slong ni rtogs pa'o ;
analyzed: ming gi dge slong ni rtogs pa'o ;
translated: The nominal bhikṣu is the realization,

original: / de yang rje btsun no //
analyzed: / de yang rje btsun no //
translated: and that is the venerable one.

original: dgra bcom pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra'o //
translated: “Arhat” means the enemy of the afflictions.

original: zag pa zad ni dus gsum dang rtsa ba bzhi zad pa yang rje btsun no //
analyzed: zag pa zad ni dus gsum dang rtsa ba bzhi zad pa yang rje btsun no //
translated: “Having exhausted the outflows” means the exhaustion of the three times and the four roots.

original: 'dod chags bral ba ni mthong spang gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral ba ni mthong spang gi sgo nas so //
translated: “Free from desire” means through the elimination of the view of the transitory collection.

original: dbang po thul ni gzugs sdu gu la sogs pa la chags na 'ching ba la manydzus @93a * //
analyzed: dbang po thul ni gzugs sdu gu la sogs pa la chags na 'ching ba la manydzus @93a * //
translated: “Having subdued the faculties” means that when one is attached to beautiful forms, one is bound by desire.

original: de rang stong par mkhyen pas dbang po rangs po rang lag pas thul lo zhe'o //
analyzed: de rang stong par mkhyen pas dbang po rangs po rang lag pas thul lo zhe'o //
translated: Since one knows that to be empty, one has subdued the faculties with one’s own hand.

original: bde ba rnyed pa ni lus kyi las so //
analyzed: bde ba rnyed pa ni lus kyi las so //
translated: The attainment of bliss is the activity of the body.

original: 'jigs pa med pa ni ngag gi las te skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa ni ngag gi las te skyon med pa'o //
translated: Fearlessness is the activity of speech, which is faultless.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi me long lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rdo rje'i rigs mtshan so drug go //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi me long lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rdo rje'i rigs mtshan so drug go //
translated: The mirror of the dharmadhatu is the vajra family of the Tathagata family, the thirty-two marks.

original: bsil bar gyur pa rnyog pa med //
analyzed: bsil bar gyur pa rnyog pa med //
translated: Cool and unclouded

original: ces pa ni yid 'khrug pa med pas zhe mi sdang ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni yid 'khrug pa med pas zhe mi sdang ste /
translated: means that since the mind is undisturbed, there is no anger.

original: de ltar lus ngag yid gsum skyon med pas /
analyzed: de ltar lus ngag yid gsum skyon med pas /
translated: Thus, since the body, speech, and mind are faultless,

original: de la khyod ni rnyog pa med pa lags so zhes bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de la khyod ni rnyog pa med pa lags so zhes bstod pa'o //
translated: you are unclouded.

original: rig pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab mig dang 'dra bas /
analyzed: rig pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab mig dang 'dra bas /
translated: Knowledge is superior insight, which is like the eye.

original: dngos po'i gnas lugs kyi yang dag pa'i lta ba mngon sum dang 'dra bar rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i gnas lugs kyi yang dag pa'i lta ba mngon sum dang 'dra bar rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the realization of the correct view of the natural state of things, which is like direct perception.

original: rkang pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi rkang pa lta ba'i grogs te /
analyzed: rkang pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi rkang pa lta ba'i grogs te /
translated: The feet are the feet of superior discipline, which are the companions of the view.

original: dam tshig dang ldan pa'i rten gyi gang zag mtshan no //
analyzed: dam tshig dang ldan pa'i rten gyi gang zag mtshan no //
translated: They are the characteristics of the person who is the support of the commitments.

original: lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rkang pa bskyed rdzogs gnyis lam du bya bar mtshon /
analyzed: lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rkang pa bskyed rdzogs gnyis lam du bya bar mtshon /
translated: The two, development and completion, are the means of cultivating the legs of special samadhi.

original: de ltar rten gyi gang zag khyad par can gcig gis lam bskyed rdzogs gnyis la brten nas 'bras bu sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rten gyi gang zag khyad par can gcig gis lam bskyed rdzogs gnyis la brten nas 'bras bu sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, a single special person who is the basis of the path, by relying on the two paths of development and completion, attains the result, buddhahood.

original: bde gshegs zhes gsungs te /🔽spangs pa mthar thug pa ni /
analyzed: bde gshegs zhes gsungs te / spangs pa mthar thug pa ni /
translated: The sugata is so called because of the realization of the tathagatas and because of the speech of the tathagatas.

original: tsha ba'i nad sbyangs pa dang 'dra la /
analyzed: tsha ba'i nad sbyangs pa dang 'dra la /
translated: The ultimate abandonment is like the purification of a hot disease.

original: ye shes mthar thug pa ni bum pa gang ba dang 'dra ba de las bogs gdon du med pa thob po zhe'o //
analyzed: ye shes mthar thug pa ni bum pa gang ba dang 'dra ba de las bogs gdon du med pa thob po zhe'o //
translated: The ultimate wisdom is like a full vase, from which there is nothing more to be gained.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa rtogs pa dang / 'gro ba dang gsungs pas de skad bya'o //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa rtogs pa dang / 'gro ba dang gsungs pas de skad bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it is so called because of the realization of the tathagatas and because of the speech of the tathagatas.

original: 'jig rten rigs ni nyan thos kyi skal ba dang ldan pa nas sngags kyi theg pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i bar du rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rigs ni nyan thos kyi skal ba dang ldan pa nas sngags kyi theg pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i bar du rig pa'o //
translated: The family of the world is the knowledge of those who possess the fortune of the sravaka vehicle up to those who possess the fortune of the mantra vehicle.

original: mchog ni gang 'dzom pa'i lam de dgod pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni gang 'dzom pa'i lam de dgod pa'o //
translated: The supreme is the setting forth of that path which is complete.

original: gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the benefit of others is the perfection of the benefit of others.

original: bdag gir mi 'dzin zhes pa ni rig pa'i rgyas bshad de /
analyzed: bdag gir mi 'dzin zhes pa ni rig pa'i rgyas bshad de /
translated: The commentary on the knowledge is “not grasping at ‘mine.’”

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa'i lta ba de ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa'i lta ba de ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How is that right view to be realized by the knowledge?

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni ngar 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni ngar 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The grasping at “I” is the grasping at the object and subject.

original: ma bkag par gzung 'dzin gnyis med par bgyis pa'o //
analyzed: ma bkag par gzung 'dzin gnyis med par bgyis pa'o //
translated: Without blocking them, the two, object and subject, are made nondual.

original: bden pa gnyis ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob ste /
translated: The two truths are the ultimate and the conventional.

original: kun rdzob sna tshogs su snang tsam na de nyid btsal na cir mi rnyed kyang kun rdzob brtags tshod tsam rgyun mi 'chad do //
analyzed: kun rdzob sna tshogs su snang tsam na de nyid btsal na cir mi rnyed kyang kun rdzob brtags tshod tsam rgyun mi 'chad do //
translated: The conventional is merely the appearance of the various things. When one searches for their reality, nothing is found. Nevertheless, the conventional is uninterrupted, just as it is imputed.

original: tshul ni mtshan nyid la de gnyis su med de /
analyzed: tshul ni mtshan nyid la de gnyis su med de /
translated: The mode is the characteristic. Those two are nondual.

original: de ltar @93b rtogs par gyis she na //
analyzed: de ltar @93b rtogs par gyis she na //
translated: Thus, one should realize it.

original: de ltar lhag pa'i shes rab dang ldan yang /
analyzed: de ltar lhag pa'i shes rab dang ldan yang /
translated: Even though one has that kind of knowledge,

original: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rkang pa med na gang du yang mi phyin la /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rkang pa med na gang du yang mi phyin la /
translated: if one does not have the legs of moral discipline and concentration, one will not go anywhere.

original: spyod lam ting nge 'dzin dang / tshul khrims la'ang lta ba ste /
analyzed: spyod lam ting nge 'dzin dang / tshul khrims la'ang lta ba ste /
translated: The conduct is concentration and moral discipline.

original: shes rab kyi mig med na long ba dang 'dra bas lta spyod zung du 'brel dgos lam 'brel na phan yon ni med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig med na long ba dang 'dra bas lta spyod zung du 'brel dgos lam 'brel na phan yon ni med do //
translated: Without the eye of wisdom, one is like a blind person, so view and conduct must be united. If they are united, the benefit is that one will not be led to the extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: 'khor ba'i zhes pa nyon mongs pa lnga phung thams cad du khrid pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i zhes pa nyon mongs pa lnga phung thams cad du khrid pa ste /
translated: “Samsara” refers to being led to all the aggregates of the five afflictions.

original: dngos po'i mtha' pha rol tu phyin pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste dngos med kyi mtha'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtha' pha rol tu phyin pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste dngos med kyi mtha'o //
translated: “The other side of entities” is nirvana, the extreme of nonexistence.

original: son pa ni gnyis med kyi 'bras bu thob pa ste /
analyzed: son pa ni gnyis med kyi 'bras bu thob pa ste /
translated: “Having arrived” means attaining the nondual result.

original: de yang lta spyod lam gyi bya ba thams cad rgyun mi 'chad par byas pas /
analyzed: de yang lta spyod lam gyi bya ba thams cad rgyun mi 'chad par byas pas /
translated: Furthermore, since all the activities of view and conduct are uninterrupted,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i skam sa ste bde ba chen po'i gnas la gnas so zhe'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i skam sa ste bde ba chen po'i gnas la gnas so zhe'o //
translated: one abides in the dry land of nirvana, the place of great bliss.

original: de yang slob dpon sgeg pa'i rdo rje'i 'grel pas 'di ltar dbu ma ji lta bar bshad /
analyzed: de yang slob dpon sgeg pa'i rdo rje'i 'grel pas 'di ltar dbu ma ji lta bar bshad /
translated: Moreover, it is explained in this way in the commentary by Master Lalitavajra, in accordance with the Madhyamaka:

original: 'khor ba zhes pa /
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes pa /
translated: “Samsara”

original: kun rdzob tu 'khor ba dang / pha rol zhes pa kun rdzob tu mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su snang la /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu 'khor ba dang / pha rol zhes pa kun rdzob tu mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su snang la /
translated: appears as the two, samsara conventionally and nirvana conventionally, the other side.

original: don dam par ni gnyis gang du yang mi 'byed pa ni mthar phyin pa'am son pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni gnyis gang du yang mi 'byed pa ni mthar phyin pa'am son pa ste /
translated: In the ultimate sense, one does not distinguish between the two, and this is the culmination or arrival.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus,

original: mya ngan las 'das de nyid gang //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das de nyid gang //
translated: Nirvana is thatness.

original: 'khor ba'i mtha' yang de nyid do //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha' yang de nyid do //
translated: The limit of samsara is also thatness.

original: zhe'o // de ltar rtogs na ye shes 'ba' zhig ces pa /
analyzed: zhe'o // de ltar rtogs na ye shes 'ba' zhig ces pa /
translated: If one understands it in this way, it is said to be “pristine awareness alone.”

original: tha mal gyi shes pa ci skyes pa thams cad ye shes kyi bde bar 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: tha mal gyi shes pa ci skyes pa thams cad ye shes kyi bde bar 'byung ba'am /
translated: All that arises as ordinary mind arises as the bliss of pristine awareness,

original: yang na de las thams cad 'byung ngo zhe'o //
analyzed: yang na de las thams cad 'byung ngo zhe'o //
translated: or else everything arises from it.

original: de yang chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab ni mtshon rnon po dang 'dra ste nyon mongs pa thams cad gcod cing 'joms so //
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab ni mtshon rnon po dang 'dra ste nyon mongs pa thams cad gcod cing 'joms so //
translated: Moreover, the wisdom that thoroughly discerns all phenomena is like a sharp weapon, for it cuts and destroys all afflictive emotions.

original: de rnams kyis ni lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i chos gcig bstan to //
analyzed: de rnams kyis ni lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i chos gcig bstan to //
translated: With these, a single topic of the path together with its result has been taught.

original: dam chos zhes pa chos kyi rnam gzhag gi nges tshig ni dam pa sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam chos zhes pa chos kyi rnam gzhag gi nges tshig ni dam pa sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The definition of the term “sacred teachings” is that they are the teachings of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, who are sacred beings.

original: dbye na 'jig rten pa'i chos dang 'das pa'i chos so //
analyzed: dbye na 'jig rten pa'i chos dang 'das pa'i chos so //
translated: If classified, there are mundane and supramundane dharmas.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos ni dge ba bcu ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos ni dge ba bcu ste /
translated: Mundane dharmas are the ten virtues.

original: 'jig rten pa yi yang dag lta //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi yang dag lta //
translated: The correct view of the world

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and so on.

original: 'das pa'i chos ni gtso bo'i chos dang gtso bo ma yin pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'das pa'i chos ni gtso bo'i chos dang gtso bo ma yin pa'i chos so //
translated: Supramundane dharmas are primary dharmas and secondary dharmas.

original: gtso bo'i chos ni dam chos zhes te stong pa skye med la bya /🔽gtso bo ma yin pa'i chos ni chos @94a * //
analyzed: gtso bo'i chos ni dam chos zhes te stong pa skye med la bya / gtso bo ma yin pa'i chos ni chos @94a * //
translated: Primary dharmas are called “true dharma” and refer to emptiness and nonarising.

original: rgyal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyal zhes bya ste /
translated: Secondary dharmas are called “dharma of the king.”

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis theg pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis theg pa ni gsum ste /
translated: The scriptures are the twelve branches of excellent speech. The vehicles are three.

original: chos kyi dbang phyug kyang de'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbang phyug kyang de'o //
translated: The lord of dharma is also that.

original: chos kyi las ni gsal bar ldan //
analyzed: chos kyi las ni gsal bar ldan //
translated: The activity of dharma is to illuminate.

original: zhes te phyi nang gi ma rig pa'i mun pa chos de gnyis kyis sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes te phyi nang gi ma rig pa'i mun pa chos de gnyis kyis sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two dharmas dispel the darkness of outer and inner ignorance.

original: de yang 'jig rten snang byed ces pas sgrub ste /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten snang byed ces pas sgrub ste /
translated: That is also established by the Illuminator of the World.

original: ma rig pas bsgrubs pa'i sems can la dngos po'i gnas lugs snang bar byed pas gtso bo'i chos de ni mchog go //
analyzed: ma rig pas bsgrubs pa'i sems can la dngos po'i gnas lugs snang bar byed pas gtso bo'i chos de ni mchog go //
translated: The Dharma of the principal one is supreme, since it illuminates sentient beings, who are produced by ignorance, with the mode of being of entities.

original: chos kyi dbang phyug ni dge ba'i chos la dbang byed pas so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbang phyug ni dge ba'i chos la dbang byed pas so //
translated: The Lord of Dharma is so called because he has power over the virtuous dharmas.

original: theg pa gsum gyi chos ni 'jig rten pa'i chos las rgyal bas na rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi chos ni 'jig rten pa'i chos las rgyal bas na rgyal ba'o //
translated: The Dharma of the three vehicles is called the Victorious One because it is victorious over mundane dharmas.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi 'bras bu ni lha dang mi dang chos rgyal te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi 'bras bu ni lha dang mi dang chos rgyal te /
translated: The result of mundane dharmas is gods, humans, and a Dharma king.

original: 'das pa'i 'bras bu ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal dang byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'bras bu ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal dang byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The result of supramundane dharmas is sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: 'bras bu de rnams so //
analyzed: 'bras bu de rnams so //
translated: Those are the results.

original: so sor legs par thob par byed pa ni lam ste /
analyzed: so sor legs par thob par byed pa ni lam ste /
translated: The path is that which causes the attainment of each of those.

original: de ston par byed pa yang 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa yang 'jam dpal lo //
translated: Manjusri is the one who teaches that.

original: don grub ces 'dir mtshan nyid gsum dang sbyar te /
analyzed: don grub ces 'dir mtshan nyid gsum dang sbyar te /
translated: Accomplishing the aim is here applied to the three natures.

original: don grub ni kun brtags te dbye na gzung 'dzin gnyis so //
analyzed: don grub ni kun brtags te dbye na gzung 'dzin gnyis so //
translated: The accomplished aim is the imagined, which is divided into the two, apprehended and apprehender.

original: de ni sgro btags kyi ngo bor yod de /
analyzed: de ni sgro btags kyi ngo bor yod de /
translated: That exists as the nature of superimposition.

original: de la don grub ces dbye ba'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de la don grub ces dbye ba'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Why is it called the accomplished aim?”

original: don du snang ba ste phyi'i don du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don du snang ba ste phyi'i don du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In fact, it appears as an object, because it becomes an external object.

original: 'o na nang gi 'dzin pa la don ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na nang gi 'dzin pa la don ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Well, why is the internal apprehender called an object?

original: yul gyi ming yul can la brtags te sgro btags kyi ngo bor grub pas grub ces bya'o //
analyzed: yul gyi ming yul can la brtags te sgro btags kyi ngo bor grub pas grub ces bya'o //
translated: The name of the object is imputed to the subject, and it is said to be established as the nature of an imputation.

original: bsam pa grub ces pa gzhan dbang rnam rtog gi bsam pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa grub ces pa gzhan dbang rnam rtog gi bsam pa ste /
translated: The statement “established by thought” refers to the dependent nature, which is the thought of conceptualization.

original: gzung 'dzin du rtog / rgyu rkyen gyi dbang gis rjes su grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin du rtog / rgyu rkyen gyi dbang gis rjes su grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is established by the power of causes and conditions.

original: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
translated: It is said to be “abandoned in all aspects.”

original: zhes pa yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: This refers to the consummate nature.

original: de yang rgyan las /
analyzed: de yang rgyan las /
translated: Moreover, the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras says:

original: 'gyur med phyin ci ma log pa //
analyzed: 'gyur med phyin ci ma log pa //
translated: The unchanging and the unmistaken

original: yongs su grub pa rnam pa gnyis //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa rnam pa gnyis // zhes gsungs te /
translated: are the two aspects of the consummate.

original: mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: The unchanging consummate is emptiness.

original: phyin ci ma log pa yongs su grub pa ni mi rtog pa'i ye shes te mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa yongs su grub pa ni mi rtog pa'i ye shes te mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The unmistaken consummate is nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de ltar kun brtags ni sgro btags kyi ngo bor grub ste /
analyzed: de ltar kun brtags ni sgro btags kyi ngo bor grub ste /
translated: Thus the imputed is established as the nature of an imputation.

original: bsam pa 'grub pas yongs grub ni don dam du grub rtog pa spangs mi rtog pa grub ste /
analyzed: bsam pa 'grub pas yongs grub ni don dam du grub rtog pa spangs mi rtog pa grub ste /
translated: The consummate is established as ultimate, since it is established as the nonconceptual, having abandoned the conception of establishment.

original: mtshan nyid gsum la grub pa gsum gyi ming gis btags so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum la grub pa gsum gyi ming gis btags so //
translated: The three kinds of establishment are designated by the names of the three natures.

original: yang de gsum de ltar gyi shes pa @94b skyes la mi 'gags pa'i skad cig ma nyid la gnas skabs kyis gsum du gzhag ste /
analyzed: yang de gsum de ltar gyi shes pa @94b skyes la mi 'gags pa'i skad cig ma nyid la gnas skabs kyis gsum du gzhag ste /
translated: Also, those three are posited as the three states in the very moment of the arising of the consciousness that is like that, without interruption.

original: dper na shes pa nyid chags shing lta bur sngon por skyes pa la yin pa shes pa'i sngon po yin bzhin du btags pa'i don gyi sngon por btags pa kun brtags so //
analyzed: dper na shes pa nyid chags shing lta bur sngon por skyes pa la yin pa shes pa'i sngon po yin bzhin du btags pa'i don gyi sngon por btags pa kun brtags so //
translated: For example, the consciousness itself that arises as blue, like a consciousness that is attached to blue, is the imagined in the imputation of the object designated as blue.

original: shes pa sngon po nyid gong gi ltar skyes pa de rgyu rkyen gzhan gyi dbang byas pa gzhan dbang ngo //
analyzed: shes pa sngon po nyid gong gi ltar skyes pa de rgyu rkyen gzhan gyi dbang byas pa gzhan dbang ngo //
translated: The consciousness that arises as blue, like the previous example, is the dependent, which is produced by other causes and conditions.

original: shes pa'i sngon po de la don gyi sngon pos stong /
analyzed: shes pa'i sngon po de la don gyi sngon pos stong /
translated: That blue consciousness is empty of the object blue,

original: yongs su grub pa ste de yang manydzu'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ste de yang manydzu'o //
translated: which is the consummate.

original: rnam par mi rtog nas mar 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa'i rgyas bshad de /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog nas mar 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa'i rgyas bshad de /
translated: The explanation of the consummate is the nonconceptual.

original: gzung 'dzin gyi sa rnam par mi rtog dbyings ni 'byung khungs te /
analyzed: gzung 'dzin gyi sa rnam par mi rtog dbyings ni 'byung khungs te /
translated: The nonconceptual basic element of subject and object is the source,

original: chos thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos po'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of all phenomena.

original: de nyid dngos por ma grub pas mi zad la /
analyzed: de nyid dngos por ma grub pas mi zad la /
translated: Since it is not established as a thing, it is inexhaustible.

original: de la dmigs nas 'phags pa'i chos thams cad skye bas chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid de ni dam pa'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs nas 'phags pa'i chos thams cad skye bas chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid de ni dam pa'o //
translated: Since all the qualities of the āryas arise in dependence on it, that emptiness, the basic element of phenomena, is the highest.

original: yang na mu stegs dang / nyan thos rang rgyal las dam bar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mu stegs dang / nyan thos rang rgyal las dam bar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, it is the highest in comparison with the tīrthikas, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos de las sangs rgyas kyi yon tan stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa zad pa'i mtha' med pas zad mi shes te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos de las sangs rgyas kyi yon tan stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa zad pa'i mtha' med pas zad mi shes te /
translated: Since the qualities of the buddhas, such as the strengths and fearlessnesses, are inexhaustible, they are inexhaustible.

original: de yang 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: de yang 'jam dpal lo //
translated: And that is Mañjuśrī.🔽Merit is the ultimate mundane merit, and Mañjuśrī possesses it.

original: bsod nams ni 'jig rten pa'i bsod nams mthar thug dang / 'jam dpal ldan la yang bsod nams 'jig rten las 'das pa yang mthar thug pa'i tshogs bsags la ye shes ni nyan thos kyis te /
analyzed: bsod nams ni 'jig rten pa'i bsod nams mthar thug dang / 'jam dpal ldan la yang bsod nams 'jig rten las 'das pa yang mthar thug pa'i tshogs bsags la ye shes ni nyan thos kyis te /
translated: Wisdom is that of the śrāvakas.

original: de yang 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: de yang 'jam dpal lo //
translated: And that is Mañjuśrī.

original: khyad par can gyi ye shes chen po ni theg pa chen por shes te /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi ye shes chen po ni theg pa chen por shes te /
translated: The great, special intuition is known as the universal vehicle,

original: nyan thos pas khyad par che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos pas khyad par che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is superior to the disciples vehicle.

original: khyad par che ba de gang zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par che ba de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that superiority?

original: rtogs pa dang / thugs rje ste nyan thos gang zag la bdag med rtogs /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang / thugs rje ste nyan thos gang zag la bdag med rtogs /
translated: It is realization and compassion. The disciples realize the selflessness of the person,

original: rang don las gzhan don med la /
analyzed: rang don las gzhan don med la /
translated: but they have no altruism beyond their own aim.

original: theg pa chen pos chos dang gang zag gnyis ka la bdag med du rtogs /
analyzed: theg pa chen pos chos dang gang zag gnyis ka la bdag med du rtogs /
translated: The universal vehicle realizes the selflessness of both persons and things,

original: thugs rjes tshogs thams cad gzhan don du bsngos des khyad med do //
analyzed: thugs rjes tshogs thams cad gzhan don du bsngos des khyad med do //
translated: and through compassion, it dedicates all collections to the aims of others.

original: ye shes ldan zhes pa ni gong ma de gnyis dang 'jam dpal ldan no //
analyzed: ye shes ldan zhes pa ni gong ma de gnyis dang 'jam dpal ldan no //
translated: The term endowed with intuition refers to the above two, and to Manjusri.

original: de yan chad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rin chen rigs la so drug go //
analyzed: de yan chad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rin chen rigs la so drug go //
translated: From here on, the precious lineage of the Tathagata has thirty-six.

original: theg pa chen po'i ye shes ni yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin par shes te de yang manydzu'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i ye shes ni yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin par shes te de yang manydzu'o //
translated: The intuition of the universal vehicle is known as neither existent nor nonexistent, and that is Manjusri.

original: tshogs gnyis zhes pa @95a * //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis zhes pa @95a * //
translated: The two collections are

original: nyan thos dang theg pa chen po'i tshogs gnyis manydzus bsags so zhe'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang theg pa chen po'i tshogs gnyis manydzus bsags so zhe'o //
translated: The two accumulations of the Listeners and the Great Vehicle are gathered.

original: man ngag tu ni sgrub thabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: man ngag tu ni sgrub thabs dang sbyar te /
translated: In the esoteric instructions, it is applied to the means of achievement.

original: bsod nams ldan pa zhes brten gyi gang zag dang po'i sangs rgyas bsgom pa mtshon /
analyzed: bsod nams ldan pa zhes brten gyi gang zag dang po'i sangs rgyas bsgom pa mtshon /
translated: Endowed with merit refers to the first Buddha of the person who is the basis.

original: bsod nams tshogs kyis tshogs bsags pa'i yul dang yan lag bdun mtshon /
analyzed: bsod nams tshogs kyis tshogs bsags pa'i yul dang yan lag bdun mtshon /
translated: Endowed with merit indicates the object of gathering the accumulations and the seven limbs.

original: ye shes kyis ye shes kyi tshogs stong par bsgom pa mtshon /
analyzed: ye shes kyis ye shes kyi tshogs stong par bsgom pa mtshon /
translated: Wisdom indicates the meditation on emptiness of the accumulation of wisdom.

original: khyad par gyis ye shes lnga bsgom pa mtshon /
analyzed: khyad par gyis ye shes lnga bsgom pa mtshon /
translated: Distinctive indicates the meditation on the five wisdoms.

original: ye shes ldan gyis zhal drug pa bsgom par mtshon /
analyzed: ye shes ldan gyis zhal drug pa bsgom par mtshon /
translated: Endowed with wisdom indicates the meditation on the six faces.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: mngon shes drug ldan rjes dran drug / ces gsungs pas rdo rje rjes su dran /
analyzed: mngon shes drug ldan rjes dran drug / ces gsungs pas rdo rje rjes su dran /
translated: endowed with the six superknowledges and the six recollections indicates the vajra recollection.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs che ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs che ba //
translated: The great mind of all the buddhas

original: zhes gsungs pas rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ste mchod rten mtshon no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ste mchod rten mtshon no //
translated: indicates the Vajraḍākinī, the lord of the vajra realm, and indicates the stūpa.

original: de rnams kyis bsgres te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis bsgres te /
translated: Those are the correspondences.

original: sgrub thabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgrub thabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is applied to the means of achievement.

original: rtag pa zhes pa ni mi 'gyur ba yongs grub kyi stong pa la bya /
analyzed: rtag pa zhes pa ni mi 'gyur ba yongs grub kyi stong pa la bya /
translated: The term “permanent” refers to the emptiness of the unchanging consummate nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brtags pa'i mi mthun pa mi rtag pa yin te stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa'i mi mthun pa mi rtag pa yin te stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The opposite of the imagined nature, which is impermanent, is emptiness.

original: gal te stong pa de mi rtag na rgyu rkyen dang bcas par thal lo //
analyzed: gal te stong pa de mi rtag na rgyu rkyen dang bcas par thal lo //
translated: If that emptiness were impermanent, it would follow that it would have causes and conditions.

original: 'dod rtog zer na mi rtag par thal /
analyzed: 'dod rtog zer na mi rtag par thal /
translated: If you say that it is an imagined conception, it follows that it is impermanent.

original: yang 'dod rtog zer na stong pa ma yin par thal lo //
analyzed: yang 'dod rtog zer na stong pa ma yin par thal lo //
translated: If you say that it is an imagined conception, it follows that it is not empty.

original: kun rgyal ni ming gi rnam grangs te stong pa de nyid g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba thams cad du byung sngon gyur rgyal zhes bya ba rnal 'byor gyi de gnyis med de /
analyzed: kun rgyal ni ming gi rnam grangs te stong pa de nyid g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba thams cad du byung sngon gyur rgyal zhes bya ba rnal 'byor gyi de gnyis med de /
translated: The all-victorious one is a synonym for that emptiness. It is called “victorious” because it has occurred in all movements and nonmovements before.

original: gsang ba 'dus par /
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus par /
translated: The Guhyasamaja Tantra says:

original: thabs dang shes rab gnyis med pa //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab gnyis med pa //
translated: Method and wisdom are nondual.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so forth.

original: bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa bzhi bsam pa yul du bzhag la blo ldan ni sems byed ngo ;
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa bzhi bsam pa yul du bzhag la blo ldan ni sems byed ngo ;
translated: The wise ones, who have placed the four concentrations such as the first concentration and so forth in the field of their thoughts, direct their minds.

original: / yang na bsam du med pa'i bsam gtan ni /
analyzed: / yang na bsam du med pa'i bsam gtan ni /
translated: Or else, the concentration that is inconceivable is as follows.

original: bsam gtan gyi bsam bya ni gud na med blo ldan ni sems byed gud na med de /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi bsam bya ni gud na med blo ldan ni sems byed gud na med de /
translated: The object of contemplation of the wise is not elsewhere; the mind of the wise is not elsewhere.

original: mchog ces pa de rnams rje btsun nyid do //
analyzed: mchog ces pa de rnams rje btsun nyid do //
translated: The supreme is just the venerable one himself.

original: de yang so so'i chos thams cad skye med du rig pas bsam bya la sogs pa mi g-yo mchog gi dang po zhes pa ni 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyi chos lnga tshan lngas bsdus pa gcig ston te /
analyzed: de yang so so'i chos thams cad skye med du rig pas bsam bya la sogs pa mi g-yo mchog gi dang po zhes pa ni 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyi chos lnga tshan lngas bsdus pa gcig ston te /
translated: Moreover, since all phenomena are known to be unarisen, the object of contemplation and so on are unmoving. The supreme first one is shown to be the result, the five sets of five qualities of a buddha.

original: de yang sangs rgyas pa'i chos bden brdzun ji ltar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas pa'i chos bden brdzun ji ltar 'dod ce na /
translated: Moreover, how do they assert the true and false phenomena of the Buddha?

original: grub mtha'i dbang dang dngos po'i gnas lugs gnyis te /🔽grub mtha' ni sems tsam rnam bcas kyis /
analyzed: grub mtha'i dbang dang dngos po'i gnas lugs gnyis te / grub mtha' ni sems tsam rnam bcas kyis /
translated: There are two: the power of tenets and the mode of being of things.

original: sangs rgyas kyi @95b sa ni chos yod do cog bden pas 'dod /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi @95b sa ni chos yod do cog bden pas 'dod /
translated: The Proponents of Consciousness with Features assert that all existing phenomena are true.

original: rnam med drir bcas ni ye shes bden la gzugs sku brdzun te /
analyzed: rnam med drir bcas ni ye shes bden la gzugs sku brdzun te /
translated: The Proponents of Consciousness without Features assert that pristine consciousness is true and the form bodies are false.

original: phyed bden phyed brdzun du 'dod de /
analyzed: phyed bden phyed brdzun du 'dod de /
translated: They assert that half is true and half is false.

original: sh'anti pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sh'anti pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the position of Shāntarakṣhita.

original: sgyu ma gnyis med kyi dbu ma ni /
analyzed: sgyu ma gnyis med kyi dbu ma ni /
translated: The Madhyamaka of Nondual Illusion

original: sangs rgyas pa'i gnas lugs de 'di'i lta bas sangs rgyas sa na chos bden brdzun gang du yang grub pa med par 'dod /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i gnas lugs de 'di'i lta bas sangs rgyas sa na chos bden brdzun gang du yang grub pa med par 'dod /
translated: The view of this system asserts that the abiding reality of buddhahood is that no phenomenon is established as either true or false at the stage of buddhahood.

original: 'o na sangs rgyas kyi sa na rgyun chad dam snyam pa la brtags tshod du rgyun ma chad do //
analyzed: 'o na sangs rgyas kyi sa na rgyun chad dam snyam pa la brtags tshod du rgyun ma chad do //
translated: If one wonders, “Is there a discontinuity at the stage of buddhahood?” it is examined and found that there is no discontinuity.

original: 'o na brtags tshod du ji ltar yin snyam na gnyis med kyi ye shes lnga po 'di nyid la gnas skabs kyi ldog pa'i bye brag gis sku lnga /🔽ye shes pa ;
analyzed: 'o na brtags tshod du ji ltar yin snyam na gnyis med kyi ye shes lnga po 'di nyid la gnas skabs kyi ldog pa'i bye brag gis sku lnga / ye shes pa ;
translated: If one wonders, “How is it examined and found to be so?” it is asserted that the five nondual wisdoms exist as the five kāyas, the five pristine consciousnesses,

original: rigs lnga / spyan lnga /🔽mtshan lngar yod par 'dod do //
analyzed: rigs lnga / spyan lnga / mtshan lngar yod par 'dod do //
translated: the five families, the five eyes,🔽and the five names, based on the specific occasion and the distinctions of the reversal of the five afflictions.

original: de la sku lnga ni /
analyzed: de la sku lnga ni /
translated: The five kāyas are as follows:

original: gzugs med gzugs bzang dam pa ste //
analyzed: gzugs med gzugs bzang dam pa ste //
translated: The sublime form of the formless.

original: zhes pa'i skabs su 'og nas kyang ston na sku ni bsdu na gcig ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i skabs su 'og nas kyang ston na sku ni bsdu na gcig ste /
translated: Since this will be explained below, the kāyas are summarized as one.

original: mchog gi dang po zhes pa chos sku ste de 'jam dpal nyid do //🔽gnas skabs su chos sku longs sku sprul sku ste /
analyzed: mchog gi dang po zhes pa chos sku ste de 'jam dpal nyid do // gnas skabs su chos sku longs sku sprul sku ste /
translated: The first sublime one is the dharmakāya, which is Mañjuśrī himself.

original: gsum po de yang 'jam dpal nyid 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: gsum po de yang 'jam dpal nyid 'chad pa ste /
translated: The three—the dharmakāya, sambhogakāya, and nirmāṇakāya—are also explained to be Mañjuśrī himself.

original: dbye na sku lnga ste /
analyzed: dbye na sku lnga ste /
translated: If classified, there are five bodies:

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
translated: the body of perfect enjoyment,

original: sprul pa'i sku dang / rnam par smin pa'i sku dang / ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang / chos sku'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku dang / rnam par smin pa'i sku dang / ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang / chos sku'o //
translated: the emanation body, the body of maturation, the essence body, and the body of attributes.

original: de la longs sku ni gnas khyad par can 'og min gyi gnas padma can dang / bde ba can dang / snyon pa sku khyad par can mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan /
analyzed: de la longs sku ni gnas khyad par can 'og min gyi gnas padma can dang / bde ba can dang / snyon pa sku khyad par can mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan /
translated: The body of perfect enjoyment is in the special place of the Unsurpassed, the place of the lotus, the place of bliss, and the special body is adorned with the major and minor marks.

original: 'khor khyad par can kun du bzang po la sogs pa la chos khyad par can gnyis med kyi chos ston te /
analyzed: 'khor khyad par can kun du bzang po la sogs pa la chos khyad par can gnyis med kyi chos ston te /
translated: The special retinue is Samantabhadra and so on, and the special Dharma is the teaching of the nondual Dharma.

original: de lta bu nyid 'joms nyog longs spyod pas longs sku'o //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid 'joms nyog longs spyod pas longs sku'o //
translated: Since suchness itself is enjoyed, it is the body of perfect enjoyment.

original: sprul sku ni gnyis med de nyid gzhan don btsal mi dgos par lhun grub tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: sprul sku ni gnyis med de nyid gzhan don btsal mi dgos par lhun grub tu byed pa'o //
translated: The emanation body is that nondual suchness that spontaneously accomplishes the benefit of others without the need to search for it.

original: rnam smin ni mi 'dra bar smin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam smin ni mi 'dra bar smin pa ste /
translated: Maturation is the ripening of differences.

original: gnyis med de nyid gnas ston pa 'khor chos la sogs pa mi 'dra bar smin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis med de nyid gnas ston pa 'khor chos la sogs pa mi 'dra bar smin pa'o //
translated: Nondual suchness is the ripening of differences in the teacher, retinue, Dharma, and so on.

original: ngo bo nyid ni de rnams kyi don btsal na cir yang mi rnyed pa de'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni de rnams kyi don btsal na cir yang mi rnyed pa de'o //
translated: The essence is that when one searches for the meaning of those, nothing is found at all.

original: chos sku ni de ro gcig pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: chos sku ni de ro gcig pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The dharmakāya is the nature that is of one taste with that.

original: de rnams la ye shes dang spyan lnga la sogs pa yang sbyor te /
analyzed: de rnams la ye shes dang spyan lnga la sogs pa yang sbyor te /
translated: Those are also applied to the five pristine consciousnesses, the five eyes, and so on.

original: sku ni longs sku /
analyzed: sku ni longs sku /
translated: The kāya is the saṃbhogakāya.

original: ye shes ni so sor rtog pa /
analyzed: ye shes ni so sor rtog pa /
translated: The pristine consciousness is discernment.

original: spyan ni shes rab spyan no //
analyzed: spyan ni shes rab spyan no //
translated: The eye is the eye of wisdom.

original: rigs ni padma'i rigs /
analyzed: rigs ni padma'i rigs /
translated: The family is the padma family.

original: sangs rgyas ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: The buddha is Amitābha.

original: de bzhin du sprul sku /
analyzed: de bzhin du sprul sku /
translated: Similarly, the nirmāṇakāya

original: bya ba grub pa /
analyzed: bya ba grub pa /
translated: is the successful activity.

original: sha'i @96a * //
analyzed: sha'i @96a * //
translated: The flesh eye

original: spyan ; las kyi rigs /
analyzed: spyan ; las kyi rigs /
translated: is the karma family.🔽The accomplished purpose

original: don grub / rnam smin /
analyzed: don grub / rnam smin /
translated: is the fully matured family.

original: mnyam nyid / yon tan mi 'dra /
analyzed: mnyam nyid / yon tan mi 'dra /
translated: The unequaled qualities🔽are the deva eye.

original: lha'i spyan rin chen rigs /
analyzed: lha'i spyan rin chen rigs /
translated: The jewel family

original: rin 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rin 'byung ngo //
translated: is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: ngo bo nyid me long /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid me long /
translated: The essence is the mirror.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan /
translated: The buddha eye

original: rdo rje'i rigs /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs /
translated: is the vajra family.

original: mi bskyod pa /🔽chos sku / chos dbyings /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa / chos sku / chos dbyings /
translated: Akṣobhya🔽is the dharmakāya.

original: chos kyi spyan /
analyzed: chos kyi spyan /
translated: The dharma eye

original: bde gshegs rigs /
analyzed: bde gshegs rigs /
translated: is the sugata family.🔽Vairocana

original: rnam snang zhes bya'o //🔽bdag nyid can zhe'o //
analyzed: rnam snang zhes bya'o //🔽bdag nyid can zhe'o //
translated: is said to be the nature.

original: khyab bdag ye shes lnga yi bdag / sangs rgyas lnga bdag cod pan 'chang //
analyzed: khyab bdag ye shes lnga yi bdag / sangs rgyas lnga bdag cod pan 'chang //
translated: You are the lord of the five gnoses,🔽you wear the crown of the five buddhas.

original: spyan lnga chags pa med pa 'chang //
analyzed: spyan lnga chags pa med pa 'chang //
translated: You possess the five eyes, free of attachment.

original: zhes pa rnams kyis de rnams kyang rje btsun 'jam dpal nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa rnams kyis de rnams kyang rje btsun 'jam dpal nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: These lines show that all of these are Mañjuśrī, the venerable one himself.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ces pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ces pa ni /
translated: As for “all buddhas,”

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams khyod la brten zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams khyod la brten zhes 'byung ste /
translated: the text says that the tathāgatas of the elements and the elements’ derivatives are based on you.

original: rje btsun khyod ni sangs rgyas thams cad bskyed pa'i yab kyang yin na /
analyzed: rje btsun khyod ni sangs rgyas thams cad bskyed pa'i yab kyang yin na /
translated: Venerable one, since you are the father who gives birth to all buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpar snang bas sangs rgyas kyi sras po yang yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpar snang bas sangs rgyas kyi sras po yang yin no //
translated: you are also the son of the buddhas, appearing as a bodhisattva.

original: nyan thos dang rang rgyal ni sku dang gsung gi sras la byang chub sems dpa' thugs kyi sras yin pas dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang rgyal ni sku dang gsung gi sras la byang chub sems dpa' thugs kyi sras yin pas dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are the buddhas’ sons in terms of body and speech, while the bodhisattvas are the sons in terms of mind, and so are called “supreme.”

original: bgrod par bya ba rnams kyi mchog go //
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba rnams kyi mchog go //
translated: They are the best of those to be traversed.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rang bzhin shes pas srid pa las byung ba'i skye gnas kyi byed rgyu med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rang bzhin shes pas srid pa las byung ba'i skye gnas kyi byed rgyu med de /
translated: Since he knows the nature of the nature of all phenomena, he is without the causal activity of birth in the world.

original: chos dang gang zag gi bdag gis dben pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i srid pa des sel lo //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag gi bdag gis dben pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i srid pa des sel lo //
translated: Since he is devoid of the self of phenomena and the self of persons, he is free from the existence of cyclic existence.

original: gcig pu sra mkhregs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gcig pu sra mkhregs zhes pa ni /
translated: The one, solid, and hard

original: 'jam dpal gyi sku de ni rdo rje las grub pa ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyi sku de ni rdo rje las grub pa ste /
translated: is the body of Manjushri, which is made of vajra.

original: thams cad kyis mi shigs shing mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyis mi shigs shing mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is indestructible and indivisible by anything.🔽The one who is born

original: skyes ma thag pa ni gdul bya dang 'tsho ba'i bsam pa skyes ma thag tu'am /
analyzed: skyes ma thag pa ni gdul bya dang 'tsho ba'i bsam pa skyes ma thag tu'am /
translated: is born as soon as the thought of living in the world is born,

original: mthong ma thag tu des 'dul /
analyzed: mthong ma thag tu des 'dul /
translated: or as soon as he is seen, he is tamed.

original: 'gro ba yang rje btsun nyid do //
analyzed: 'gro ba yang rje btsun nyid do //
translated: The one who goes is the Lord himself.

original: nam mkha' ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes las byang sems rdo rje'i bdag nyid du rang byung ste 'jam dpal nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes las byang sems rdo rje'i bdag nyid du rang byung ste 'jam dpal nyid do //
translated: Space is the self-arisen nature of the bodhichitta vajra from the wisdom of emptiness, which is Manjushri himself.

original: shes rab ye shes zhes pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab ye shes zhes pa ni /
translated: The wisdom of wisdom

original: zab pa dang rgya che ba dbyer med du rtogs pa las ye shes kyi me 'bar te /
analyzed: zab pa dang rgya che ba dbyer med du rtogs pa las ye shes kyi me 'bar te /
translated: is the blazing fire of wisdom from the realization of the indivisibility of the profound and the vast.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bud shing bsreg pa ni me chen po'o //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bud shing bsreg pa ni me chen po'o //
translated: The burning of the firewood of afflictions together with their traces is the great fire.

original: man ngag tu ye shes kyi tshogs sogs pa'i dus su rang lus mes bsregs pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: man ngag tu ye shes kyi tshogs sogs pa'i dus su rang lus mes bsregs pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: In the esoteric instructions, the accumulation of wisdom is applied to the burning of one's body by fire.

original: ye shes de'i 'od kyis 'jig rten gsum po thams cad snang bar byed pas 'od chen @96b no ;
analyzed: ye shes de'i 'od kyis 'jig rten gsum po thams cad snang bar byed pas 'od chen @96b no ;
translated: The light of that wisdom illuminates the entire triple world, so it is the great light.

original: / de yan chad padma'i rigs so drug go //
analyzed: / de yan chad padma'i rigs so drug go //
translated: Up to this point, there are thirty-six [topics] of the lotus family.

original: ye shes ni gzung 'dzin med pa'i ye shes de man ngag tu /🔽slar sos ye shes lus su byas //
analyzed: ye shes ni gzung 'dzin med pa'i ye shes de man ngag tu / slar sos ye shes lus su byas //
translated: Wisdom is the wisdom free from subject and object. In the esoteric instructions,

original: zhes pa'i tshig gi sa bon no //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig gi sa bon no //
translated: it is the seed of the words, Reviving, one makes the body of wisdom.

original: skar ma ni pa ba sangs te yi ge aa bsgom pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: skar ma ni pa ba sangs te yi ge aa bsgom pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The star is Venus, applied to the meditation on the syllable a.

original: 'di na mar ye shes kyi chos ye shes lnga bsgom pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di na mar ye shes kyi chos ye shes lnga bsgom pa dang sbyar te /
translated: Here, the topic of wisdom is applied to the meditation on the five wisdoms.

original: lam me ba ni me long lta bu ste /
analyzed: lam me ba ni me long lta bu ste /
translated: The lamp is the mirrorlike [wisdom],

original: sku gnyis kyi rten phyed cing mi tog pa'o //
analyzed: sku gnyis kyi rten phyed cing mi tog pa'o //
translated: which is the support of the two form bodies, half-moon and flower.

original: 'gro ba'i mar me ni chos thams cad so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mar me ni chos thams cad so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The lamp of the world is Mañjuśrī, because he illuminates all phenomena with the wisdom of discernment.

original: ye shes sgron ni mnyam pa nyid kyi chos thams cad dang mnyam par byed pa'o ;
analyzed: ye shes sgron ni mnyam pa nyid kyi chos thams cad dang mnyam par byed pa'o ;
translated: The lamp of wisdom is Mañjuśrī, because he makes all phenomena equal through the wisdom of equality.

original: / gzi brjid ni bya ba grub kyis gang 'dul ba la sprul /
analyzed: / gzi brjid ni bya ba grub kyis gang 'dul ba la sprul /
translated: The splendor is Mañjuśrī, because he manifests emanations to tame beings through the wisdom of accomplishing activities.

original: mdzes pa der snang ba'o //
analyzed: mdzes pa der snang ba'o //
translated: The beauty is Mañjuśrī, because he appears in that way.

original: ye shes lnga po de yang 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: ye shes lnga po de yang 'jam dpal lo //
translated: Those five wisdoms are also Mañjuśrī.

original: 'od gsal gyi chos dbyings /
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi chos dbyings /
translated: The clear light is the dharmadhātu.

original: sngags mchog ni yi ge h'um ste /
analyzed: sngags mchog ni yi ge h'um ste /
translated: The supreme mantra is the syllable hūṃ.

original: de'i sngags bdag ni 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: de'i sngags bdag ni 'jam dpal lo //
translated: The lord of that mantra is Mañjuśrī.

original: h'um ni khro bo h'um mdzad kyi sa bon te /🔽khams gsum rnam rgyal gyi rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha so bdun du yang rje btsun de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: h'um ni khro bo h'um mdzad kyi sa bon te / khams gsum rnam rgyal gyi rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha so bdun du yang rje btsun de 'byung ngo //
translated: Hūṃ is the seed syllable of the wrathful Hūṃkāra.🔽The venerable one also appears as the thirty-seven deities of the root maṇḍala of Trilokavijaya.

original: rig sngags ni khams gsum rnam rgyal gyi gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor na lha so bdun gyi phyogs kyi sbubs na gnas pa yang de'o //
analyzed: rig sngags ni khams gsum rnam rgyal gyi gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor na lha so bdun gyi phyogs kyi sbubs na gnas pa yang de'o //
translated: The knowledge mantra is also the thirty-seven deities residing in the corners of the maṇḍala of the dhāraṇī of Trilokavijaya.

original: gsang sngags ni de'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor na lha so bdun rang rang gi mtshan ma nas 'bras tsam la sems gtad nas gnas pa yang de'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags ni de'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor na lha so bdun rang rang gi mtshan ma nas 'bras tsam la sems gtad nas gnas pa yang de'o //
translated: The mantra is the concentration of the mind on the sign of each of the thirty-seven deities in the mandala of the Dharma of that [Vairochana].

original: don chen ni khams gsum rnam rgyal gyi las kyi dkyil 'khor na lha so bdun yang 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: don chen ni khams gsum rnam rgyal gyi las kyi dkyil 'khor na lha so bdun yang 'jam dpal lo //
translated: The great meaning is that the thirty-seven deities in the mandala of the activity of the Conqueror of the Three Realms are also Manjushri.

original: gtsug tor ni khams gsum rnam rgyal gyi dbu la de bzhin gshegs pa dbu rgyan gyis nga rgyan pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor ni khams gsum rnam rgyal gyi dbu la de bzhin gshegs pa dbu rgyan gyis nga rgyan pa'o //
translated: The ushnisha is the Tathagata ornamenting the head of the Conqueror of the Three Realms with a crown.

original: rmad du byung ba ni rdo rje'i gzugs te /
analyzed: rmad du byung ba ni rdo rje'i gzugs te /
translated: The marvelous is the vajra form,

original: 'od kyi gzi brjid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'od kyi gzi brjid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: endowed with the splendor of light.

original: nam mkha'i stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: nam mkha'i stong pa nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of space is

original: de'i bdag nyid 'jam dpal lo /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid 'jam dpal lo /
translated: the nature of Manjushri.

original: des 'jig rten dang 'das pa'i gzugs ston pa'am /
analyzed: des 'jig rten dang 'das pa'i gzugs ston pa'am /
translated: He displays mundane and supramundane forms,

original: yang na ting nge 'dzin sna tshogs ston pa'o //
analyzed: yang na ting nge 'dzin sna tshogs ston pa'o //
translated: or else he displays various samadhis.

original: sangs rgyas ni rigs lnga chos skur ro gcig pas mchog go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rigs lnga chos skur ro gcig pas mchog go //
translated: The Buddha is supreme because the five families are of one taste in the dharmakaya.

original: 'gro kun dga' ba ni blang dor shes pa'i shes rab kyi mig dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro kun dga' ba ni blang dor shes pa'i shes rab kyi mig dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The delight of all beings is endowed with the eye of wisdom that knows what to adopt and what to reject.

original: de yang 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: de yang 'jam dpal lo //
translated: He is also Manjushri.

original: sna tshogs ni sprul pa sna tshogs kyi gzugs kyis 'gro ba dag pa bskyed pa yang 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: sna tshogs ni sprul pa sna tshogs kyi gzugs kyis 'gro ba dag pa bskyed pa yang 'jam dpal lo //
translated: He is also Manjushri, who creates the welfare of beings by means of various emanations in various forms.

original: 'jam dpal de ni drang srong chen po rnams kyis @97a * //🔽mchod pa'i 'os su 'dug la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal de ni drang srong chen po rnams kyis @97a * // mchod pa'i 'os su 'dug la /
translated: Manjushri, that great sage, is worthy of worship by the great sages.

original: sems can thams cad kyis brjod pa ste bstod pa'i 'os su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis brjod pa ste bstod pa'i 'os su gyur pa'o //
translated: He is worthy of praise, that is, of expression, by all sentient beings.

original: rigs gsum ni sku gsung thugs gsum mo //
analyzed: rigs gsum ni sku gsung thugs gsum mo //
translated: The three families are the three: body, speech, and mind.

original: 'chad ba ni 'dzin pa ste manydzu'o //🔽gsang sngags ni 'jig rten dang 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'chad ba ni 'dzin pa ste manydzu'o // gsang sngags ni 'jig rten dang 'das pa ste /
translated: The explanation is the retention, that is, the Manjushri.

original: de yang manydzu'o //
analyzed: de yang manydzu'o //
translated: The mantra is the mundane and supramundane, and that is the Manjushri.

original: dam tshig ni mi 'da' ba'i don gyis te chos thams cad byang chub sems las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam tshig ni mi 'da' ba'i don gyis te chos thams cad byang chub sems las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The commitment is the meaning of non-transgression, because all phenomena do not transgress the thought of enlightenment.

original: thams cad mi 'da' bas chen po'o //
analyzed: thams cad mi 'da' bas chen po'o //
translated: It is great because everything is not transgressed.

original: gtso bo thams cad las 'thon par gyur pa 'jam dpal de /
analyzed: gtso bo thams cad las 'thon par gyur pa 'jam dpal de /
translated: Manjushri, who has emerged from all the chief ones, is the great mantra, the great commitment.

original: dkon mchog gi rang bzhin te mchog tu gyur pa'i yon tan rtsis las 'das pa'i yon tan yongs la khyab pa'i yon tan gsum 'dzin to //
analyzed: dkon mchog gi rang bzhin te mchog tu gyur pa'i yon tan rtsis las 'das pa'i yon tan yongs la khyab pa'i yon tan gsum 'dzin to //
translated: The nature of the Three Jewels is the three qualities of holding the qualities that are supreme, the qualities that are beyond calculation, and the qualities that are all-pervading.

original: yang na man ngag tu dam tshig gi gsang ba mi smra ba mi thos pa gsum rgyud klog pa'i dam tshig ste /
analyzed: yang na man ngag tu dam tshig gi gsang ba mi smra ba mi thos pa gsum rgyud klog pa'i dam tshig ste /
translated: Alternatively, in the pith instructions, the three commitments of not speaking, not listening, and not transgressing the secret are the commitment of reading the tantra.

original: de las mi 'da' la gsang sngags ni gsang sngags kyi don du bltas nas mtshan 'dogs pa ste /🔽spros las byas pa rus bstan par //
analyzed: de las mi 'da' la gsang sngags ni gsang sngags kyi don du bltas nas mtshan 'dogs pa ste / spros las byas pa rus bstan par //
translated: Not transgressing that, the mantra is seen as the meaning of the mantra and is designated as the name.

original: dra ba de la sngags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dra ba de la sngags zhes bya'o //
translated: The mantra is explained as the web.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes skyob des 'gro ba 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: shes skyob des 'gro ba 'dzin pa'am /
translated: That which protects the mind holds migrating beings,

original: yang na de nyid 'jam dpal gyi thugs rjes 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de nyid 'jam dpal gyi thugs rjes 'dzin pa'o //
translated: or it holds those beings with the compassion of Manjushri.

original: gtso bo dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa ni gtso 'khor gzhung dkon mchog gsum /
analyzed: gtso bo dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa ni gtso 'khor gzhung dkon mchog gsum /
translated: The principal one who holds the Three Jewels is the principal one and retinue, the three scriptural Three Jewels,

original: lam dkon mchog gsum /
analyzed: lam dkon mchog gsum /
translated: the three path Three Jewels,

original: 'bras bu dkon mchog gsum pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu dkon mchog gsum pa ste /
translated: and the three result Three Jewels.

original: de la gzhung dkon mchog gsum ni gsung gi gsung bas rgyas dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la gzhung dkon mchog gsum ni gsung gi gsung bas rgyas dang sbyar ro //
translated: Among those, the three scriptural Three Jewels are connected with the three vajras of enlightened body, speech, and mind.

original: gsung mkhan sangs rgyas gsung rgyu chos gsung bas dge 'dun no //
analyzed: gsung mkhan sangs rgyas gsung rgyu chos gsung bas dge 'dun no //
translated: The speaker is the Buddha, the speech is the Dharma, and the one to whom it is spoken is the Sangha.

original: lam ni bskyed rim gyis lha rigs lnga dang / rigs gsum la sku lnga'i bdag nyid can ni sangs rgyas /
analyzed: lam ni bskyed rim gyis lha rigs lnga dang / rigs gsum la sku lnga'i bdag nyid can ni sangs rgyas /
translated: The path is the generation stage, the five or three families of deities, and the five kāyas, which are the Buddha.

original: shes rab 'khor lo sngags chos /
analyzed: shes rab 'khor lo sngags chos /
translated: The Dharma is the mantra and the rites.

original: thabs kyi byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dge 'dun no //
analyzed: thabs kyi byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dge 'dun no //
translated: The Sangha is the method, the bodhisattvas, and so on.

original: rdzogs rim la gnyis med /
analyzed: rdzogs rim la gnyis med /
translated: The completion stage is nonduality.

original: sangs rgyas rtogs pa de dge 'dun yang dang yang goms pa de chos /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rtogs pa de dge 'dun yang dang yang goms pa de chos /
translated: The Buddha is the realization of that. The Sangha is the repeated cultivation of that. The Dharma is the five topics.

original: 'bras bu ni chos lngas bsdus pas sangs rgyas /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni chos lngas bsdus pas sangs rgyas /
translated: The result is the Buddha, who is subsumed by the five topics.

original: sngags chos kun du bzang po la sogs pa dge 'dun no //
analyzed: sngags chos kun du bzang po la sogs pa dge 'dun no //
translated: The Sangha is Samantabhadra and so on.

original: de yang rje btsun nyid 'bras bur snang ngo //
analyzed: de yang rje btsun nyid 'bras bur snang ngo //
translated: Moreover, the venerable one appears as the result.

original: theg pa mchog gsum ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ston pa yang 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: theg pa mchog gsum ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ston pa yang 'jam dpal lo //
translated: The three of the supreme vehicle are Mañjuśrī, who teaches the vehicles of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: don yod @97b zhags pa zhes pa ni byang sems rdo rje'i rigs la bya ste /
analyzed: don yod @97b zhags pa zhes pa ni byang sems rdo rje'i rigs la bya ste /
translated: The one called Amoghapāśa is the bodhisattva of the vajra family.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gdul bya thog ma med pa la lam du 'dzud pa'i phyir don yod pa'i rnam rgyal ba ni rdo rje'i rigs te /
analyzed: gdul bya thog ma med pa la lam du 'dzud pa'i phyir don yod pa'i rnam rgyal ba ni rdo rje'i rigs te /
translated: The Amoghasiddhi family is the vajra family, because it causes disciples to enter the path from beginningless time.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khro bos gdul ba la de'i gzugs kyis thog ma med pa ste rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: khro bos gdul ba la de'i gzugs kyis thog ma med pa ste rgyal ba'o //
translated: It is the conqueror of beginningless wrathful ones to be tamed by means of its form.

original: 'dzin pa chen po ni rigs padma'i rigs /
analyzed: 'dzin pa chen po ni rigs padma'i rigs /
translated: The great holder is the lotus family.

original: sgo ba ni lcags sgrog gis bya /
analyzed: sgo ba ni lcags sgrog gis bya /
translated: The door is made with the chain.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gdul bya 'dod chags can mi gtong bar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya 'dod chags can mi gtong bar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the holder of the attachment of disciples with desire.

original: rdo rje zhags pa ni rin chen rigs /
analyzed: rdo rje zhags pa ni rin chen rigs /
translated: The vajra lasso is the jewel family.🔽The door is the lasso.

original: sgo ba ni zhags pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: sgo ba ni zhags pa ci zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ser sna can thogs pa med par 'dzud pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna can thogs pa med par 'dzud pa'o //
translated: It is the one who causes the miserly to enter without obstruction.

original: rdo rje lcags kyu ni rdo rje'i rigs mi bskyod pa /
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu ni rdo rje'i rigs mi bskyod pa /
translated: The vajra hook is the vajra family of Akshobhya.

original: sgo ba ni lcags kyu ste /
analyzed: sgo ba ni lcags kyu ste /
translated: The door is the hook.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gong ma'i khro bo zhe sdang can 'dzin cing thogs pa med par dkyil 'khor du 'dzud pa'o //
analyzed: gong ma'i khro bo zhe sdang can 'dzin cing thogs pa med par dkyil 'khor du 'dzud pa'o //
translated: It is the one who holds the wrathful ones of the higher realms and the hateful ones and causes them to enter the mandala without obstruction.

original: zhags pa che ni las kyi rigs don grub /
analyzed: zhags pa che ni las kyi rigs don grub /
translated: The great lasso is the family of activity, Amoghasiddhi.

original: sgo ba ni 'bebs pa ste /
analyzed: sgo ba ni 'bebs pa ste /
translated: The door is the one who brings down.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phrag dog can dgyes pa bskyed cing de lam du thogs pa med par 'dzud pa'o //
analyzed: phrag dog can dgyes pa bskyed cing de lam du thogs pa med par 'dzud pa'o //
translated: It generates delight in the jealous, and it causes them to enter the path without obstruction.

original: de yan chad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi las kyi rigs so drug go //
analyzed: de yan chad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi las kyi rigs so drug go //
translated: Up to this point, there are thirty-six families of the Tathagata's karma family.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi mtshan brgya dang brgyad cu rtsa gcig / tshigs bcad ni tshig rkang gcig gis ma tshang ba'i lnga bcu rtsa lnga ste le'u drug pa rdzogs so; ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi mtshan brgya dang brgyad cu rtsa gcig / tshigs bcad ni tshig rkang gcig gis ma tshang ba'i lnga bcu rtsa lnga ste le'u drug pa rdzogs so; ;
translated: The Tathagata's family has one hundred and eighty-one names. There are fifty-four verses, one verse line short. Chapter Six is complete.

original: // rdo rje 'jigs byed ces pa mtshan de skad du grags pa'i mtshan can gyi khro bo cig yod do //
analyzed: // rdo rje 'jigs byed ces pa mtshan de skad du grags pa'i mtshan can gyi khro bo cig yod do //
translated: There is a wrathful deity known by the name Vajrabhairava.

original: gang las grags she na /
analyzed: gang las grags she na /
translated: From where is it known?

original: rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi rgyud las so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi rgyud las so //
translated: From the Vajrabhairava Tantra.

original: mtshan de skad du grags pa'i khro bo de dngos su gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan de skad du grags pa'i khro bo de dngos su gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the actual deity known by that name?

original: rje btsun 'jam dpal nyid de /
analyzed: rje btsun 'jam dpal nyid de /
translated: It is the venerable Manjushri himself.

original: de skad ces bya ba'i khro bor sprul pa'o //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba'i khro bor sprul pa'o //
